texts.en: Leo wants a loan to buy groundnuts and coffee for resale. He is a married man dealing in produce in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of building a permanent house and educating his children. He also desires to expand his business into neighbouring areas.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts and coffee

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
Juan Diego G. es un  joven de 25 años que fabrica calzado artesanal femenino , negocio que iniciò cuando llegò procedende de la ciudad de Bucaramanga en el departamento del Santander del Sur, y se instaló en el departamento del Atlàntico hace 6 años. En su desempeño en el oficio  le enseñó un familiar,  que ademàs le financiò la materia prima para dar inicio y continuidad, a su hoy trabajo en el municipio de Soledad,con el que genera ingresos para el sostenimiento de su famila y por eso sueña con hacerlo crecer paulatinamente, mediante el apoyo de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y su trabajo disciplinado. 
Este es su primer financiamiento en esta organizción, para elaborar sandalias que tiene encargadas por clientes, para quienes ha fabricado nuevos diseños y que en el pasado  no habia podido cumplirles oportunamente, por el poco capital que maneja y que limita sus posibilidades de crecimiento.  Juan Diego vende a credito y de contado, sus inventarios rotan cada 18 dias y espera un resultado exitoso de su inversiòn, porque tiene capacidad productiva y experiencia en la ampliaciòn en el mercado en el que interactua.
texts.en:
Juan Diego G. is a young man of 25 who makes women's footwear by hand.  He started his business when he arrived in Atlántico department from the city of Bucaramanga, in Santander del Sur department, 6 years ago.

It was a family member who taught Juan Diego this trade.  He also loaned him the money to buy raw materials in order to get started and keep going in his business.  Today he works in the town of Soledad and makes income to support his family.  He dreams of gradually growing his business through the support of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and his own disciplined work.

This is Juan Diego's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to make sandals that his customers have ordered.  He has made  new designs for them.  In the past, he hasn't been able to fill his orders in a timely manner because he didn't have enough capital.  This limited his possibilities for growing his business.  Juan Diego sells his good on credit and for cash.  His inventory turnover is 18 days and he hopes that his investment will be successful because he has the production capacity and experience needed to expand in his market.

loans.use: to buy soles, liners, adhesive and other supplies

loans.name: Feni

texts.en:
Feni is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a security agent; he contributes to his family basic needs with his earnings. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Feni has operated a food stall for the past three years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming self-reliant in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 15,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, salt, and utensils for her food stall.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, salt and utensils for her food stall.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Harriet   has a business of a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Harriet sells her products in the market, by means of retail. Harriet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more braids and cream relaxers.

The main business challenge(s) for Harriet include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of braids and cream relaxers. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked and bridal salon. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita el 20 de mayo de 2009, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Lourdes J. contactó con la asesora para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, logró juntar a 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 5° ciclo.
La sra. Lourdes se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en su casa, está casada y tiene 2 hijos varones, ella desea poder vender a mayores escalas y cantidades, pero para lograr eso necesita más variedades para ofrecer, por ello solicita el crédito a fin de poder comprar cosméticos Avon y volver a venderlos en las cantidades que ella cree le traerán buenos ingresos económicos.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
This group of women is called 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Enterprising Women).  The group was formed in the city of Ita on May 20th, 2009.  The current Director General, Lourdes Jiménez, contacted an advisor to find out how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) works.  She managed to get together 21 women who are now happily working on their 5th loan cycle.

Lourdes' business is selling cosmetics from home.  She is married and has two sons.  She would like to be able to sell on a larger scale and in larger quantities but in order to achieve this she needs a greater variety of products.  For this reason, she has requested her loan so that she can buy Avon cosmetics and sell them in the quantities that she believes will make her a good income.

All the members of this group carry out activities in order to raise funds.  They help each other to achieve the goals that they have within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics (especially from Avon)

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher would like a loan to buy drugs for selling. He is a salary earner who desires to educate his children and become a clinical officer. He lives in Kyenjojo Uganda and has also set up a drugstore to supplement his salary amid challenges of limited funds. His dream is to own a pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy drugs for selling

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. Her biggest monthly expense is school tuition fees.

She operates a food market selling coconuts and vegetables by retailing to her neighbours and passersby. Eunice has been operating this business for the past two years, which has helped her meet her family needs with her income. She dreams of expanding and becoming self reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose H. es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de bebidas desde hace varios años, está casado con la Sra. Inocencia, con quien tiene 8 hijos, 4 de ellos ya casados con hijos también y los 4 restantes viven en la casa aún con ellos.
Además de esta activadad se dedica al trabajo en albañilería, actividad que lo realiza con uno de sus hijos.
El Sr. Jose es una persona muy responsable y sacrificada, se dedica de lleno al bienestar de su familia y se encuentra muy agradecido con la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que le otorga.
texts.en:
José H. is a salesman.  He has been selling drinks for several years.  He is married to Inocencia and has 8 children.  4 of his children are already married and have kids themselves.  The other 4 still live at home.

In addition to this business, José also works in construction together with one of his children.  José is a very responsible and selfless person who is fully committed to his family's well-being.  He is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving him.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Gilsom

texts.en: Gilsom wants a loan to buy alcohol to resell. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda and dreams of building a permanent house and educating his children. For three years he has been selling alcohol, and his goal is to secure a vehicle to supply to different trading centers.

loans.use: To buy alcohol for resale

loans.name: One Family Enterprise-Ibanda Group

texts.en: Thirty-two year old S. Augen has been at the helm of a pharmacy business in Buhembe trading center, Ibanda, for the past eight years. Augen is married with 3 kids and he says the skills he acquired while training as a pharmacist have benefited him greatly. Weekly this business brings in shillings 100,000 as profits. With this loan, he wants to restock his pharmacy with more drugs to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for resale at his pharmacy

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: Molly would like a loan to buy a plot of land.  She is a teacher by proffession and has been in service for three years .She has challenges of limited funds due to the high expenditure on rent and her dream is to build a house for residence and educate her children.

loans.use: Buying a plot of land

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, all of whom are in school.  Irene has a business selling maize and wheat flour. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Irene   sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale. Irene has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bags of wheat and maize flour. The main business challenge(s) for Irene include drought, which hit most parts of Uganda, and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van. Irene lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en: Zeynab B. is 49, a brave married woman who works hard for the good of her five children, and she does so with the help of her husband and two sons of 20 and 22 years old. She has 21 years of experience in breeding and selling cattle. Her husband usually sells her cattle in the livestock bazaar. The strict discipline she uses with her children allows her to count on her household’s advice and support in working the fields.  Zeynab’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her and they have gathered many lessons during this time that they can use when they form their own households. Zeynab needs a small loan to purchase one more calf.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Lidia Maritza

texts.es: La señora Lidia Maritza García T. se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas en el centro comercial polvos azules tiene su negocio desde mayo del dos mil diez y de esa forma genera ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales ,tiene un hijo de veintidós años al cual ayuda es sus estudios universitarios su sueño a futuro es hacer crecer mas sus negocio para poder costear los estudios de su hijo y además le gustaría comprarse una casa , la solicitante invertirá el dinero en comprar mercadería por cambio de estación como son chompas pantalones y otros tiene buenas referencias personales es por ello que se propone el crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia Maritza García T. sells women’s clothing in the Polvos Azules (Blue Powders) Shopping Center.  She has had her business since May 2010 and, through it, has generated income to cover her personal expenses.  She has a 22 year old son whom she helps and who studies at university. 

Her dream is to make her business grow in order to be able to pay for her son’s university fees.  In addition, she would like to buy a house. She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise for the change of season such as sweaters and pants.  She has good personal references, and that’s why she has applied for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the changing season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy small home appliances which have been ordered by her customers

loans.name: Señor Pan De Azucar De Sacllo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PAN D. AZUCAR D. SACLLO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito D. Calca, perteneciente a la provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Benita; ella tiene 49 años D. edad y es casado y tiene 8 hijos; La socia se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería ella cultiva lo que son papa, maíz, cebada entre otros, a la vez venD. leche D. vaca a los mercados que se encuentran en el valle sagrado como Urubamba, Calca y Ollantaytambo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante por su familia y más ahora que una D. sus hijas está estudiando en una Universidad privada la carrera D. enfermería, la socia está muy contenta ya que está apoyando a su hija que más lo necesita. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para los estudios universitarios D. su hija.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y a la venta D. chicha D. jora (hecho a base D. maíz), todas las socias solo se dedican a esta actividad.

La socia se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The partners are part of the village bank "Pan D. Azucar D. Sacllo".  This bank is located in the district of Calca, which is part of the province of Calca and the department of Cusco. 

Benita is 49 years old, married and has 8 children.  She practices farming and raises cattle.  She grows potatoes, corn and barley, among other things, and also sells cow's milk to the markets in the Sacred Valley, for example Urubamba, Calca and Ollantaytambo.  She is a very happy and enterprising woman who really wants to help her family get ahead, and even more so now that one of her daughters is studying nursing at the private university.  She is very pleased that she is helping her daughter in the way that she needs. 

She is asking for a loan for her daughter's university studies.

The other members of the group participate in agriculture, raising livestock, and selling chicha D. jora (a corn-based drink).  All of the members do only these things.

Benita feels very happy about the loan and promises to meet the payments.

loans.use: to pay for university for her daughter

loans.name: Maxima Maria

texts.es: Máxima Maria tiene 36 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Pues busca la forma de sobrevivir para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con fondos propios,  ya que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante, pues fue así que decide ofrecer ciertos productos como cremas, colonias y así la mayoría de de sus clientes le hicieron la fama que ella es una excelente vendedora. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo pues así comprara talcos, cremas, pintura de uñas, pinturas de labios. Sueña con tener su propia tienda en donde ofrezca sus productos.
texts.en: Máxima Maria is 36 years old. Her economic activity is selling cosmetics. She is seeking a way to live and pay her household expenses. She started this business with her own money, since she has been able to get ahead with a lot of hard work. She decided to offer certain products such as creams and colognes. Most of her customers gave her good publicity because she is a good saleswoman. That is why she is asking for this loan for working capital. She will buy powders, creams, nail polish, and lipsticks. She dreams of having her own store where she can offer her products.

loans.use: to buy powders, creams, nail polish, and lipsticks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the brake system on his passenger transport vehicle

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa F. is married to a farmer and together they live with their 5 dependents. She buys palm fruits and processes it into palm oil for sale at Frami, near Abura in Cape Coast. She has been in this business for 11 years. Yaa uses her income to assist her husband to take care of her family. Yaa will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to produce more oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to reinvest back into her business for further growth. In this picture, Yaa is in the process of extracting the oil from the palm fruits.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruits to produce oil for sale

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: El señor Máximo es chofer y trabaja en el sindicato de transporte de Pasajeros Eduardo Avaroa del cual es dirigente y percibe un salario; el crédito lo requiere para comprar repuestos para su vehiculo como ser llantas de auxilio y comprar un motor nuevo;  su esposa es comerciante y con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. Vive en casa  propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Maximo es casado y tiene cinco hijos . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Maximo is a driver and his part of the passenger transport union "Eduardo Avaroa", which he directs and receives a salary from.  The loan is needed to buy replacement parts for his vehicles such as spare tires, and to buy a new motor.  His wife is a saleswoman and with their incomes they are able to maintain themselves.  They live in their own home which is located in the zone of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.  Maximo is married and has 5 children.  This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy spare tires and a motor for his passenger transport vehicle

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia O. sells hair products, body creams and slippers at Abura, near Frami. Leticia has received senior high education. She is divorced and currently taking care of 3 children.  She has been in this trade for 8 years. Her income that is generated from her sales is used to take care of her family. A loan is going to help her buy more body creams and slippers for resale. She anticipates reinvesting her profit for further growth of her business. In the photograph, Leticia has her left hand placed on the slippers and the right hand placed on the hair products and body creams.

loans.use: A loan is going to help her buy more body creams and slippers for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha es empleada domestica y también vende comida y linaza; el crédito lo requiere para comprar mas insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideo, linaza, papa, etc. Para su negocio; con los ingresos que obtiene  mantiene a sus dos hijos. Vive en casa  de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  La cliente obtuvo anteriormente un crédito a través de Kiva y pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Martha is a domestic employee and also sells food and linseed.  She needs the loan to buy more ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, linseed, potatoes, etc. for her business.   With the income from her jobs she takes care of her two children.  She lives in her parents' home which is located in the zone of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.  She is single and has two children.  She has had a loan before with Kiva and was able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, pasta, potatoes, linseed, etc for her food sales business

loans.name: Rafael Arcangel

texts.es: Rafael Arcángel se dedica a brindar los servicios de carpintería. Es una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de su negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le realizan diferentes encargos, por lo que Rafael siempre deposita mucho esfuerzo en lo que realiza, tiene más 6 años en esta actividad, su padre le enseño a sobrevivir con este negocio, no es un trabajo fácil, pero esto es lo que más le gusta a Rafael.  El financiamiento es para la compra de pega, clavos, maque, madera, junco, tintes, herramientas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Rafel Arcangel provides carpentry services. He is a very hard worker and enjoys his work. Most of his customers return because Rafael puts a lot of effort into what he makes. He has six years of experience and his father taught him this trade. It is not easy work but it is what Rafael enjoys doing.

The loan is to buy glue, nails, lumber, reeds, dyestuff, tools and such things.

loans.use: to buy glue, nails, lumber, reeds, dyestuff, tools...

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase crates of beer and motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena K. is a producer of palm oil at Abura, near Frami. She also sells cosmetics and underwear.  Abena has attained a senior high level of education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a petty trader. As a way of supporting her husband, she pays the school fees of her children. She wants to expand her cosmetics and underwear business. So she is requesting a loan to buy these items in larger quantities for resale. The increase in her capital as a result of the loan will be used to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of cosmetics and underwear for resale

loans.name: Edgard

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 36ans marié avec 2enfants qui fréquente l’école .En tenant compte des revenus de ses clients, il vend les pagnes au marché sur un étalage.

Depuis 2ans, il s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes sur place, il achète les pagnes à la mode pour attirer ses clientes et ses ventes journalières sont comprises entre 30.000F à 120.000F.

Le prêt de HOPE va lui permettre de renouveler son stock de pagne en achetant : 20 pièces wax sosso, 10 pièces de pagnes qualiwax, 10pagnes  c’est le moment brillant.
 A l’avenir, il compte ouvrir une boutique pour vendre  les pagnes en gros et détail afin donner de la valeur  à celle qui les portes.

En ayant plus de revenus, il sera capable de subvenir aux situations financières et sociales de sa famille.
Sa simplicité est connue de tous dans son quartier.
texts.en: A 36-year-old young man with two children at school, he sells the pagnes (colorful West-African printed cloth) on a market stall, taking his clients' income into account. For the past two years, he has used local wholesale suppliers. He purchases fashionable pagnes to appeal to his clients, and his daily sales vary between F30,000 and F120,000. HOPE's loan will allow him to renew his pagnes inventory by purchasing twenty pagnes "sosso wax," ten "qualiwax," and ten "wax"; it's his moment to shine. In the future, he intends on opening a store to sell pagnes wholesale and retail, to offer value to the women who wear his products. By increasing his revenues, he will be able to provide for his family's financial and social needs. His unaffected ways are renowned in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase sosso, wax, and qualiwax pagnes (cloth)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells creams and panties at Abura, near Frami.  She also cooks rice to sell. Grace has been through senior high school. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She began cooking not long ago and she is requesting a loan to expand her rice selling business by buying more rice and other ingredients to cook for sale. She helps her husband to provide the general needs of her family. The additional capital she hopes to get from her business will be reinvested back into the food business. In this photograph, Grace has placed her two hand on the cooked rice.

loans.use: she is requesting a loan to expand her rice selling business by buying more rice and other ingredients to cook for sale.

loans.name: Yahir

texts.es: La señorita Yahir  trabaja en el llenado de formularios y trámites para universitarios; el crédito lo necesita para pagar el costo de defensa de grado para optar el título de Auditora en la Universidad y así poder conseguir un trabajo en su profesión. Yahir vive con sus padres en casa propia en la zona de San Sebastián de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Miss Yahir works in completing forms and processing documents for university students.  She needs a loan to pay the costs of defending her degree and thus, to receive the title of Auditor in the University and be able to pursue work in her profession.  

Yahir lives with her parents in her own house the the San Sebastian zone of the city of La Paz.

loans.use: TO PAY THE COST OF HER EXAMINATION FOR HER AUDITING DEGREE

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus, age 37, is charged with the responsibilty of taking care of his four children. He lives in Kyenjojo Uganda. He sells maize and beans and has the challenge of a poor road network thus hindering his business. His dream is to own a food store. Justus wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El señor Simón, con el dinero del préstamo construirá un muro de contención al vecino ya que en época de lluvias sufre de filtraciones que debilitan la estructura de su vivienda, su esposa es costurera, su principal fuente de ingreso es de albañil en construcciones privadas; vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona San Juan Alto Tembladerani de La Paz. Está casado y tiene 8 hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Simon is married and has eight children. They live in their own house located in the area of San Juan Alto. His wife is a seamstress. His income comes from plumbing jobs in private constructions.

Mr. Simon will utilize the money from the loan to build a retaining wall by his neighbor’s property because during the raining season there is leakage that weakens the structure of his home.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall in his house.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
For the past four years, Efua S. has been frying poolo (a local name for this dish), as shown in the picture. The main ingredients used in making this are flour, grated coconut, nutmeg and others. She is married and has eight dependants. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to help her husband to take care of her family. Efua will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare poolo for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest into the business for further growth.

In this picture, she is taking out the cooked poolo from the hot oil.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare poolo

loans.name: Brenilda

texts.es: Brenilda, de 50 años, es una madre de familia abnegada y muy jovial. Vive en casa de sus suegros, junto a su esposo y su hija Angie, de 20 años, por quien se desvela sus días. Brenilda, es una madre de familia de mil oficios, vende zapatos y  ropa según los  pedidos que le hacen sus clientes,  y durante los fines de semana prepara y vende cebiches (platillo típico de Lima) en la puerta de su casa, asimismo se dedica al lavado de prendas en su casa.  En donde  dice, “mantenerse muy entretenida ya que le permite captar buenas utilidades para el bienestar y la educación de su hija, por lo que su esposo  se siente contento por los aportes de Brenilda. Por esta temporada de verano esta muy dedicada al lavado de  frazadas, edredones, y demás prendas, ya que son muchos que envían por la temporada de invierno que se aproxima, pero sólo estruja las prendas y hace la entrega a sus clientes, desventaja que tiene ya que no cuenta con el tendal suficiente para toda la ropa que lava. En vista de ello, en adelante le gustaría ampliar la construcción de su casa y también instalar un restaurante. Pero, por el momento le urge comprarse otra lavadora, para abastecerse de la demanda que tiene. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a seguir pagando como lo venia haciendo. Y dice “que está contenta de trabajar con sus compañeras y compañeros de grupo”, por ser muy responsables. Con el crédito, piensa comprar otra lavadora, para dinamizar la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Brenilda is a 50 year old self-sacrificing and cheerful mother. She lives in her in-laws’ house with her husband and their 20 year old daughter, Angie for whom she works hard.

Brenilda is a mother who does many jobs: She sells shoes and clothes to her customers, prepares ‘cebiches’ - traditional dishes of Lima - and sells them at her doorstep on weekends and also does laundry at her house. She enjoys all this work since it provides good profit that covers her daughter’s expenses and education and contributes to her husband’s contentment. 

During this time of the year – summer - she is mainly washing blankets, comforters and items like that since the demand is high in preparation for the winter months coming ahead. She does not have a big enough area for clotheslines in order to dry all of her laundry, so in the future, she would like to expand her house as well as open a restaurant, but for now it is important to buy one more washing machine to take care of the laundry given to her by her customers. 

This is the tenth loan with MFP and she is committed to repay it in a timely manner as has always done. She is very happy working with the other members in the group because they all are very responsible. She is planning to buy one more washing machine with the loan requested.

loans.use: to buy one more washing machine.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: El señor Sabino, con el dinero del préstamo construirá un muro de cerramiento en su vivienda; su principal fuente de ingreso es de albañil en construcciones privadas y su esposa es ayudante en su trabajo, vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Alto Llojeta de La Paz. Sabino y su esposa tienen 5 hijos.
texts.en:
With the loan money, Sabino will build an enclosing wall at his home.

His main source of income is working as a builder on private construction projects, and his wife helps with his work. They live in their own house in the Alto Llojeta area of La Paz. Sabino and his wife have 5 children.

loans.use: to build an enclosing wall around his house

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en: Rhodora is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store and a native bags business. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and native bags business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,300. Rhodora is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rhodora aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena W. displays food items on a table for resale in Abura near Frami. She is married and lives together with her six dependants. Her husband is a carpenter. As a way of supporting her husband, she pays part of the utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will serve as additional income to increase her sale of food items. Her business goal is to build a shop where she can sell in.

loans.use: to increase her sale of food items.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi M. lives in the village of Kurdghelauri, Kakheti Region, with his family - his wife, parents and two children: a seven-year-old daughter and a six-month-old son. Giorgi’s wife is a housewife and his parents are pensioners. 

Giorgi’s family has 8 milch cows. Alex – Giorgi’s father is actively involved in the family’s farming activities. Cheese and "matsoni" (Georgian yogurt) produced by the family are sold on the open market in Telavi, a nearby town. Giorgi is a handyman and works on the renovation of houses. 

With the requested loan Giorgi’s family plans to purchase calves, raise them and sell the raised animals after 6-7 months for a higher price. With the gained profit, Giorgi plans to renovate his own house to improve living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Riziel

texts.en:
Riziel is a married woman who lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a videoke business & selling food. Her husband Joerge, who is 42 years old, works as a mechanic to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 6 to 15 years old. 

Riziel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Riziel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to repair and maintain the videoke machines she rents out and also use some of the money to buy ingredients for her food vending business, so that she can continue to save up for future home improvements & the education of her children. Riziel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of videoke machines

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El señor Rogelio, con el dinero del préstamo construirá una nueva habitación en su vivienda; su principal fuente de ingreso es de elaboración de joyas en oro y plata en su taller familiar. Rogelio vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en la zona de Llojeta de La Paz. Rogelio está casado y tiene 2 hijos.
texts.en: Rogelio will use the money from the loan to build a new bedroom in his home.  His main source of income is making gold and silver jewelry in his family workshop.  Rogelio lives in his own home which is located in the zone of Llojeta in La Paz.  Rogelio is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: to construct a bedroom in his home

loans.name: Ferlie

texts.en: Ferlie is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by selling vegetables and farming. Her husband Oscar, who is 49 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 3 and 22 years old. Ferlie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ferlie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000 to buy more vegetables to sell and to buy fertilizers, etc. for her farm, so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Ferlie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a quarrying business and a tricycle transport business. Her husband Diosdado, who is 50 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 17 and 25 years old. Rebecca joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rebecca has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000 to pay for the overhead expenses of her quarrying operations so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education and the future expansion of her business. Rebecca is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for the overhead expenses of her quarry business

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en: Haydar H. lives in Bilasuvar. He is 32-years-old married man and the father of two  children who are currently in school. They all live together in their own house, located in the settlement built for refugee families in Bilasuvar. Haydar got his start as a farmer in his parents' fields when he was very young. After marriage he decided to start his own sheep-breeding business. The income from this business is the only source of profit for the family. Haydar would like to expand his business, buying more sheep and balanced feed so that he can increase his sales. For this reason, he requested a loan for 1000 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to purchase 10 more sheep. His goal for the future is to breed 100 and more sheep.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B. is married and has four children. She has been through senior high school. Ama cooks waakye  (rice and beans cook together) at Abura near Frami, which she has been doing for 12 years. Her husband is a teacher. Ama uses her income to assist her husband to take care of her family. Ama will use the loan to purchase more rice and beans to cook wakye for sale. Ama plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans to cook wakye for sale.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is a married woman who lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by buying and selling used clothing. Her husband Miguel, who is 58 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 24 to 30 years old. Lucena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lucena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 30,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000 to purchase more used clothing stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs, buy home appliances, and save up to increase her revolving capital. Lucena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Eufracio

texts.es: El señor Eufracio, con el dinero del préstamo comprará los artefactos para un baño completo; su esposa es costurera y él es policía. Viven en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en la zona Alto Tacagua de La Paz. Tienen dos hijos.
texts.en: Eufracio wishes to buy a toilet and sink in order to complete the bathroom in his home.  His wife is a seamstress and he is a policeman.  They live in their own house located in the Alto Tacagua zone of La Paz.  They have two children.

loans.use: TO BUY A TOILET AND SINK FOR THE BATHROOM IN HIS HOUSE

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. produces palm oil for distribution to her customers. She is divorced and has been through senior high school. Abena also makes dough nuts at Abura. She has been doing multible businesses for 20 years. She is asking to use the loan to expand her palm oil business. She uses her income to take care of her family. She hopes to reinvest the new profits. Abena is showing the palm fruits she uses for the palm oil.

loans.use: to expand her palm oil business.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en: Zoraida is a 41-year-old single woman who supports her family through direct selling of plastic home products and operating a sari-sari store. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Zoraida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Zoraida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 to purchase more stock to sell both for her home products business and for the sari-sari store so that she can continue to save up for her future security and to support her household expenses. Zoraida is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer and printer so his children can do their homework.

loans.name: Guy Saturnin

texts.fr:
Agé de 41ans,  marié, père de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie de 3 à 14ans est devenu vendeur du pétrole en et détails depuis 2004.

Il achète son pétrole dans les stations services, qu’il stock dans des futs de 120 litres.
Par jour il a des ventes qui sont comprises entre 30.000F à 50.000F.

Avec le prêt actuel, il va stocker plus de pétrole pour mieux contrôler ses revenus et bénéfices en achetant : 240litres de pétrole, 20bouteilles de 1litre vides, 2entonoirs de différents dimensions.
Dans son quartier, on l’appelle papa pétrole car il le seul fournisseur et compte devenir grossiste, pour cela il doit beaucoup vendre, faire plus de bénéfice afin que le camion citerne lui face des livraisons à domicile.
Il se bat pour le bien être de sa famille,/p>.
texts.en:
This is a 41-year-old, married man with four children ranging in age from 3 to 14. In 2004, he started selling petrol at retail. He buys his petrol from gas stations and stores it in 120L barrels. His daily sales reach 30,000 to 50,000F.

With this loan, he plans to increase his stocks of petrol to better monitor his income and profits. To that end, he will buy 240L of petrol, 20 empty 1L bottles, and 2 funnels in different sizes. 

In his neighborhood, they call him Papa Pétrole (“Daddy Petrol”) as he is the sole supplier. He plans to become a wholesaler and to do so, he must increase his profits. This will allow him to get petrol delivered by tank truck to his home. He strives to ensure his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy petrol wholesale, funnels, empty 1L bottles

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en: Maricar is a 29-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  fishing/fish selling and tricycle transport. She lives in Victorias, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Maricar is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase fishing nets for her fishing business. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maricar aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: Santa, de 47 años, es una mujer muy jovial y responsable. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Erasmo, de 63 años, y sus 2 hijas, de las cuales la mayor trabaja y estudia. Por muchos años se dedicaba a recorrer las calles ó se instalaba en las periferias del mercado, para vender prendas de bebé. Pero hace 9 años, está emprendedora mujer a base de mucho esfuerzo y mas la ayuda de su esposo, logró adquirir un puesto en un mercado poco concurrido, además carecía de capital suficiente para invertir. Pero con el tiempo y gracias a mucha paciencia y dedicación, hoy el mercado se ha vuelto muy concurrido, es por ello que ya se ha establecido comercialmente, y que deja su mercadería a crédito, de esa manera ha logrado crecer de a poco. Han transcurrido  9 años en este negocio y se siente complacida por su labor. Ahora que cuenta con un poco más de capital, su negocio se ha dinamizado mucho más. Por ello, está segura que trabajando con mucha persistencia,  en adelante logrará ampliar  y tener más stock.  Por ello, requiere comprar diversidad de prendas de bebé entre otros regalos, para diversificar su negocio. En su grupo comunal integran  4 personas, y todos han demostrado ser responsables. Es así que ingresan a su décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y ratifican sus compromisos de puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más prendas, para abastecer su negocio y continuar desarrollando.
texts.en:
Santa, 47, is a very cheerful and responsible woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Erasmo, 63, and their two daughters. The elder daughter works and studies.

For many years Santa sold baby clothes, either by walking through the streets or setting up on the edge of the market. But nine years ago, with a lot of effort and with help from her husband, this enterprising woman was able to get a stall in a market that was not very crowded and did not have enough capital to invest. But with time, and thanks to great patience and dedication, today the market is very popular. Because of this Santa is now established as a businesswoman, and because she sells her merchandise on credit she has been able to grow little by little.

She has been working in this business for 9 years and is pleased about her work. Now that she has a little more capital, her business has gotten much better. For this reason, Santa is sure that by working very persistently she will eventually be able to expand and have more stock. To do this she needs to buy a variety of baby clothes and other gifts to diversify her business.

Her communal bank has four members, and they have all shown that they are responsible. This is how they have earned their tenth loan with MFP, and they confirm their promises to make their payments punctually. With the loan she is asking for, Santa will buy more clothes to stock her business and continue to develop it.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and meet customer demand.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab S. is 51 years old and lives with his big family in the villageof Shalauri, Kakheti Region. Zurab’s family consists of six persons: Himself, his wife, his 19-year-old daughter, his 22-year-old son and his pensioner parents. 

Zurab’s family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they own a vineyard and sell grapes to winemakers in season.  They also sell dairy products from their three milch cows in a nearby town. Zurab works as a taxi driver as well; he uses his car for this. In addition to the above-listed activities, Zurab brings logs from the forest to sell. He uses his horse for transportation of the logs. 

With the requested amount, Zurab plans to purchase calves and raise them. He plans to sell the raised calves after 6-7 months, in the fall, for a higher price. He hopes that his profit will positively influence the family’s income, as Zurab plans to use the profit for expansion of the mini-farm through purchasing additional milch cows.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Nixon

texts.es: El señor Nixon es contador en una empresa, el crédito lo necesita para comprar material de construcción como ser cemento, arena, ladrillo, estuco, esto le ayudara a mejorar su vivienda. Su trabajo es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es soltero, tiene un hijo y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de  Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Mr. Nixon is an accountant at a company. He is single, has a son and lives in his own house located in the Tembladerani area of La Paz. His work is the source of income to support his family.

He needs the loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, bricks and plaster to upgrade his housing. This is the first time to request a loan from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, plaster and bricks to upgrade his housing

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en: Nemia is a married woman who lives in Victorias, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fishing/fish vending business. Her husband Rodolfo, who is 53 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living.  They have four children who are 23 to 29 years old. Nemia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nemia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase a fishing net so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family and to expand her fishing activities. Nemia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Adzo

texts.en: Adzo A. is divorced and has three children. Adzo is into multiple businesses. She sells plantain, palm fruits, makes palm oil  for sale at Abura near Frami in Cape Coast. Her income is used to feed and educate her children. Adzo will use the loan to purchase extra quantities of palm fruits for sale to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adzo plans to build a small factory for the production of palm oil.

loans.use: to purchase extra quantities of palm fruits for sale.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa T. is a palm oil extractor and a chop bar operator (a food joint where people come to eat) at Abura in Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Adwoa has been in the food business for 5 years. She supports her husband in the provision of the household expenses. A loan is going to help her expand her cooking business. She hopes to put up a better structure with her new profits.

loans.use: to expand a cooking business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José es empleado en una empresa privada pero también realiza el trabajo de colocación de parkets para pisos; el crédito lo necesita para comprar herramientas como ser una lijadora y también madera, esto le ayudara a realizar de mejor manera los trabajos; estas dos actividades son la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es casado tiene cuatro hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La P.. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO.
texts.en:
José is employed by a private company, but he also works laying parquet floors. He needs the loan to buy tools like a sander and also to buy wood. This will help him to do his work better. These two jobs are his sources of income for supporting his family.

José is married and has four children. They live in their own house in the Alto San Pedro area of La P.. This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy a floor sanding machine and wood for his business laying parquet floors.

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Mery M. makes soaps locally for sale in Abura near Frami in Cape Coast. She is holding in her hands one of the soaps she has made. Mery is married and has three children. She has a junior high school educational background. Mery helps her husband provide for the basic needs of the family. Mery will use her loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare the soap for sale. Mery plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare soap for sale.

loans.name: Amour Divin Group

texts.fr:
Ronald est le coordinateur  de son groupe Amour Divin.
 

Ronald habite dans la ville de Trou-Du-Nord  d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare  et l’eau est très limitée.

Ronald  a dirigé son commerce de bonbon, divin; l’huile  pendant les dernières 5 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Ronald  était un élève

Ronald  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir au commerce du bonbon et de vint
Ronald  peut utilise ses emprunt a l’aidera a réalisé un plus  gros bisness

Des autres membres de Amour divin ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tells  commerces comme boisson, vêtements et produits alimentaire.

Celons Ronald  ses défis  principal c’est manquement d’argent pour être un grand commerçant.

Ronald dit que son but principal  est possédé un gros biseness il veut considérer comme un leader  de la communauté.
texts.en:
Ronald is the coordinator of the group Amour Divin (“Divine Love”). He lives in the city Trou-Du-Nord in Haïti, where electricity is scarce and water supplies are very limited.

For the past five years, Ronald has been running a store selling candy, wine and oil. Prior to this occupation, Ronald was a student.

Ronald wants to use this loan to invest in his business. He expects the credit to help increase his profits.

Other members of Amour Divin require a loan for such activities as the sale of beverages, clothing and food items.

According to Ronald, the main challenge is the lack of money to become an important businessman. His main goal is to own a large business and be considered a community leader.

loans.use: to sell clothing and food products

loans.name: Concepcion Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña Concepción, resiD. en Usulután, tiene 51 años D. edad, vive en compañía D. su madre, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, este negocio lo desarrolla desD. hace 5 años, lo aprendió D. su madre, trabaja todos los días D. la semana D. 6:00am a 4:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha presentado problemas en el desarrollo D. sus actividades D. comerciante.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. ropa para vender, ayudando a fortalecer el negocio y ofreciendo a los clientes variedad D. prendas D. vestir y continuando con su actividad para proveer ingresos y tener más solvencia económica.
Las aspiraciones D. doña Concepción es volverse una gran comerciante, tener competente el negocio e ir ahorrando para cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Concepcion lives in Usulutan and is 51 years old.  She lives with her mother and has worked in clothing sales for the last 5 years.  She learned the traD. from her mother and she works every day from 6 am to 4 pm.  To date, she has not had any problems in carrying out her work as a saleswoman.

She is seeking a loan to buy more clothes to sell; this will strengthen her business and offer her customers a greater variety of clothing which will help her to improve her income and be more economically solvent.

Concepcion aspires to become a great saleswoman, have a strong business, and save money to cover her expenses.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: La señora Martina es productora lechera y también elabora quesos; su esposo es profesor en el área rural, el crédito lo requiere para comprar un terreno para forraje de sus vacas lecheras. Las actividades mencionadas son las fuentes de ingresos de su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi del departamento de La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Martina is a milk producer and also makes cheeses.  Her husband is a teacher in a rural area.  The loan is needed to buy land where the dairy cows can forage.  The activities mentioned are the income sources for her family.  They own their own home which is located in Achacachi in the department of La Paz.  She is married and has two children.  This is her first time working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy land for dairy cows to pasture

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 63 años, es un hombre soltero, noble y muy responsable. Vive en compañía de sus inquilinos, en su casa propia. Desde hace 25 años Rolando, se dedica a los trabajos de albañilería  y pintados de paredes internas y externas de las casas. Con las ganancias que recibía, logró construir de a poco su casa y acondicionar algunas habitaciones. Como resultado de ello, vio lo rentable que sería alquilar las habitaciones, es así que han transcurrido 12 años, alquilando dichos espacios que le resulten lucrativos. Por ello, todo lo que gana lo invierte en la restauración de su casa, como la: conexión de agua, instalación de luz  y los  servicios sanitarios,  todo ello para el bienestar de sus inquilinos. De está manera trata de brindar una mejor comodidad para que permanezcan más tiempo en su casa, aunque muchos de ellos lo deterioran, y siempre tiene que dar el mantenimiento necesario. Para el futuro, tiene el propósito  de  instalar un negocio, ya que su edad y sus problemas de su salud, no le permiten desarrollarse en su trabajo de la actualidad. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, dice “que confíen en él, porque  pagará todas sus cuotas de manera responsable”, como líder que es,  de su pequeño grupo comunal está orgulloso de representarlos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará cemento para restaurar las paredes de su casa y apoyar a su sobrino, para que instale su local para ofrecer el servicio de llamadas.
texts.en:
Rolando is 63 years old and single.  He is an honest and very responsible man who lives with his tenants in his own home.

For 25 years, Rolando has been doing construction work and painting houses (both interior and exterior painting).  With the profits that he has made, he has managed to gradually build his home and adapt some rooms.  He saw how profitable it would be to rent out rooms and so he has been renting out these spaces in his home for the past 12 years.  This has been very profitable for him.

Rolando invests all the profits that he makes in doing work to his house, for example, connecting water, installing light and installing bathrooms.  He does all this for the well-being of his tenants.  He tries to make his tenants comfortable so that they stay in his house longer, though many of them damage his property and he has to make necessary repairs.  In the future, he plans to set up a business since his age and health problems do not allow him to work at the moment.

This is Rolando's tenth loan from MFP and he says that he can be trusted to make all his repayments responsibly.  He is the leader of his small community bank and is proud to represent it.  He will use his loan to buy cement to do work on the walls in his house and also to support his nephew in setting up premises for a 'locutorio' (an establishment that provides telephone booths for public use).

loans.use: to buy cement to do some work on the walls in his house and to support his nephew in setting up a 'locutorio' (an establishment that provides telephone booths for public use)

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noé de 36 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, se dedica a un taller eléctrico, vive en su propia casa con su esposa y una hija de un año de edad.
Él trabaja en su casa, ahí tiene instalado el taller, trabaja haciendo balcones, rejas y puertas, por el momento tiene la necesidad de adquirir tubos y laminas para el desarrollo de su trabajo, dichos materiales los va a comprar a través de un préstamo que le financie el gasto.
Esta inversión le ayudara a contar con los elementos necesarios para la ejecución de sus trabajos encargados, mejorando su servicio y la calidad hacia los clientes.
Su sueño es algún día lograr ampliar el taller y formar su propia empresa en electrónica.
texts.en:
Noé, 36 years old, lives in San Miguel.  He has an electrical shop.  He lives in his own house with his wife and one-year-old daughter.  He works in his house, where he has his shop, making balconies, railings, and doors.  Right now he needs to buy metal tubes and sheets for the development of his work.  He will buy these materials using a loan that will pay for the cost.

This investment will help him to be able to count on the resources necessary to carry out the work he takes on, improving the service and quality he provides to his customers.

His dream is to some day be able to expand the shop and create his own business in electronics.

loans.use: to purchase metal tubes and sheets.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama N. is a seamstress and a baker at Abura near Frami in Cape Coast. Mama has completed senior high school. She is divorced and caring for two children. She has been in this business for five years. Her business for some time has been suffering and she wants to improve it by buying more materials to sew in order to attract more customers. A loan will help her expand her business and to be able to take proper care of her children. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the acquisition of a shop.

loans.use: To buy materials to sew

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria se dedica a la costura, realiza artesanías las mismas las comercializa en la feria de la zona 16 de Juliode la ciudad de El Alto; también forma parte de un grupo musical donde tiene ingresos extras , el crédito lo requiere para comprar una maquina overlock de coser ya que es una herramienta de trabajo que necesita para realizar los trabajos con mayor rapidez .Vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa Dolores de la ciudad de El Alto, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Maria works in sewing. She makes handicrafts, which she sells in the market in the July 16th zone of the city of El Alto. She is also a member of a musical group, which brings in extra income. She needs the loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, which she needs to do her work more quickly. She lives in a rented house in the Villa Dolores neighborhood in the city of El Alto. She is single and has one son. This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: La señora Rita elabora zapatos de cholita con la ayuda de su esposo y la señora vende los mismos en la feria de zona  16 de Julio los días jueves y domingos; el crédito lo requiere para comprar  una maquina de costura y materia prima como ser  Plantillas, suelas, cuero, gamuza; esa es la actividad que realiza para mantener los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto, es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Rita makes “cholita” shoes [type of shoes worn by ladies who wear traditional-style skirts] with her husband’s help. She sells them in the market in the July 16th neighborhood on Thursdays and Sundays. She needs the loan to buy a sewing machine and materials such as insoles, soles, leather, and suede. This business is how she provides for her family’s expenses. She lives in her parent’s house, located in the Bautista Saavedra neighborhood of the city of El Alto. She is married and has one son. This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials for making shoes, such as insoles, soles, leather, and suede

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. sells pastries, ice cream and drinks in Abura near Frami, which she has done for two years. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Nana uses her income to help her husband educate, feed and clothe the children. A loan will help her purchase stock in large quantity to be able to sell more. Nana plans to save the new profits from her expanded business towards establishing a snack bar.

loans.use: to purchase stock in large quantity.

loans.name: Maria Nuestra Señora Group

texts.es:
Jessica Marilia, Ella es Viuda, 35 años D. edad, 02 niños.
La señora Jesssica es presidente del grupo comunal " Maria Nuestra Señora"; en el distrito D. Chilca en Huancayo. 
Ella es padre y madre para su sus 2 pequeños hijos: Carlos y Monica, quienes se han convertido en el impulso y fuerza para su vida.
La Señora Jessica Marilia al no contar con un trabajo estable decidiò abrir una pequeña bodeguita (tienda) en su propia casa; esto ha sido su sustento y por ello requiere el prèstamo para poder ampliar la bodeguita y poder vender otros productos. Ademàs D. este negocio la Señora Jessica Marilia ha aperturado al costado D. su bodeguita un locutorio (servicio D. telèfono pùblico), esto ha sido un buen acierto, ya que por la zona no hay telèfonos pùblicos ni tampoco otro servicio similar.
(En la fotografìa la Señora Jessica Marilia està vestida con chompa color rojo, està D. pie y es la segunda D. la derecha)
texts.en:
Jessica Marilia R. C. Vda. D. P., who is a widow, is 35 years old and has 2 children. Jessica is the president of the communal bank “Maria Nuestra Señora”, which is located in the district of Chilca, in Huancayo. 

She is a single mother for her 2 small children, Carlos and Monica, who have become the motivation and source of strength for her life. 

Since Jessica doesn’t have a stable job, she decided to open a small store in her own house. This has been her source of income. She needs the loan to expand her small store so she can sell other products. In addition to this business, Jessica has also opened a public telephone service next to her store. This has been a good decision because in her neighborhood there aren’t other public telephones or similar services. 

(In the photo, Jessica is wearing a red sweater. She is standing and is the second from the right.)

loans.use: to purchase domestic products to sell in her store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. is married and has three children. She has been through senior high school. Ama fries fish and shrimp at Abura near Frami for sale. Her income is used to assist her husband in taking care of the home.  Ama will use the loan to buy fresh fish and shrimp to fry for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to provide a meaingful education for her children.

In this photograph, she is demonstrating how she fries the fish.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and shrimp to fry for resale

loans.name: Gerbacio

texts.es: El señor Gerbacio, es maestro albañil, y trabaja a contrato, el crédito lo necesita para la compra de material de construcción como ser: cemento, estuco, arena, vigas. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto; es viudo y tiene cuatro hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy contento con los créditos que se le otorgaron y mejoro la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gerbasio is a master mason who works on contract. He needs the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, stucco, sand, and beams. This business is his source of income for covering his family’s expenses. He lives in his own house, which is located in the Villa Ingenio neighborhood of the city of El Alto. He is a widower and has four children. He has been very happy with the loans he has been granted, as they have improved his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, stucco, sand, and beams, to finish a work contract

loans.name: Lylliam Yenny

texts.es:
Lyliam Yenny M. proveniente de una familia campesina, decidió buscar futuro en Medellín,  fue entonces cuando se vio obligada a montar su propio negocio para aportar a cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues su esposo trabaja por días en el campo y con lo que gana no es suficiente para el sustento diario. 

Esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar una nevera y surtido de lácteos para ampliar su oferta de productos y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lyliam Yenny M. comes from a peasant family, but she decided to look for a better future in Medellin. She was then obliged to establish her own activity in order to contribute to the payment of her family expenses, as her husband works in the country every day but what he earns is not enough to provide for their daily needs.

This entrepreneur needs a loan to buy a fridge and a supply of dairy products in order to increase the number of goods she offers and so improve her sales.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and a supply of dairy products

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba P., a divorced mother of three children, has multiple businesses as she sells bread, rice porridge, pastries, etc. at Abura near Frami. A high school graduate, Araba has been in this trade for four years and is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be invested in pastry-making, since demand for it has started increasing. She hopes to build a snackbar someday.

loans.use: To invest in her pastry-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a wood planer machine to improve the quality of his products.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 48 años, es casado y vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos en una casa heredada por sus padres. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, dispone de amplio espacio libre, lugar que aprovechó para construir su granja de cuyes, desde entonces atiende todos los días a sus animales, asimismo posee extensas tierras donde cultiva y cosecha alfalfa, siendo estos derivados como forraje para sus animales, y lo que le sobra es comercializado. Por otro lado su esposa la ayuda en cuidar los demás productos que tiene cultivados, como es el caso de la papa, maíz  quinua y verduras. Considera que su granja de animales es rentable porque tiene contactos de personas que le aseguran la compra frecuencia de estos animales, además  de que le agrada desarrollar esta actividad ya que le permiten mejorar un poco más su calidad de vida y siempre esta en búsqueda de ver que cultivos son más rentables y recuperar lo invertido en cada campaña de siembra. Este es su tercer crédito en MFP y considera que ser parte de su banco comunal ha suido una grata experiencia  porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce  hace años y son sus propios vecinos  y que siente por ellos un aprecio sincero por lo que ha decidió seguir trabajando mas tiempo en su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y también en  la compra de madera para mejorar la infraestructura de su granja de cuyes.
texts.en: Julio is 48 years old, is married and lives with his wife and his two children in a house that he inherited from his parents. For the past fifteen years he has been working in agriculture and in the raising of young animals. He has a lot of land, which he has used to build a guinea pig farm. He cares for his animals everyday. He also has extensive lands that he uses to raise and harvest alfalfa. Alfalfa provides feed for his animals. The extra alfalfa he sells. His wife helps him care for the other products that he grows, which include potatoes, corn, quinoa, and vegetables. He considers his animal farm profitable, as he has contact with buyers that frequently buy his animals. Nevertheless, he would like to develop this activity as it allows him to improve his quality of life. He is always looking to see which crop is profitable, as he wants to recoup the cost of each harvest season. This is his third loan with MFP and he feels that his membership in this community bank has been a good experience as all of the members are people that he has known for years and they are his neighbors. He is grateful that they have continued to work together in this group. With this loan that he is requesting, he will buy bags of fertilizer and also wood to make a better structure for his guinea pig farm.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and wood to be used to improve the infrastructure of his guinea pig farm

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es: La Señora Maria Hortencia de 55 años, reside en Villanueva con su compañero de vida pues sus 8 hijos viven de manera independiente. Ella es una mujer llena de metas y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante. Maria tiene su negocio que es la venta de tortillas y tamales ubicado en su vivienda, es bien frecuentado por las personas del lugar, ya que ella se destaca por ser buena vendedora y por ser amable con su clientela. Es por eso que le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, comales, bolsas, entre otros productos. Maria tiene gran esperanza en que esto le permitirá mejorar la economía de su hogar y así aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Hortencia is 55 years old, and she lives in Villanueva with her lifetime partner as all of their 8 children live on their own. She is a woman with many goals and a willingness to improve herself. Marian engages in selling tortillas and tamales in a shop she has set in her house. It is well attended by the locals, as she stands out for being a good seller and for being kind to her customers. For this reason she is requesting a loan she will use to buy maize, comales (clay dishes used to prepare tortillas), and bags among other products. Maria has high hopes this loan will help her improving the economy of her family in order to reach a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy maize, comales, bags and other products for her activity.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina O. displays groceries on a able at Abura near Frami for resale. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Paulina has been selling groceries for three years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to acquire more provisions so she can meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to save the new profits from her business towards building a new shop.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to acquire more provisions so she can meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: El señor Rufino, Chofer asalariado, el crédito lo requiere para el aumento de anticrético ya que el señor vive en la casa de una prima y pero paga alquiler; la casa queda ubicada en la Zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, con los ingresos que obtiene  mantiene a su familia. Es Divorciado  y tiene dos hijos . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rufino is employed as a driver. The loan he is requesting will be used to increase the amount of his anticrético* arrangements, as he is living in a family member’s house to whom he pays rent. The house is located in Llojeta, a neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He is able to provide for his family thanks to his earnings. He is divorced and has two children. This is his first cycle with IMPRO and KIVA

<cite>*Anticrético: a special type of arrangement in which property is pawned to the tenant in exchange for an upfront rental payment, and the rent is returned to the tenant at end of the rental period.</cite>

loans.use: To increase the amount of his anticrético agreement in order to stop paying rent.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama B., a divorced high school graduate, is a cosmetics-seller and a seamstress  at Abura near Frami.  Mama, who  has been a seamstress for years, wants to expand her sewing business and so is requesting a loan to buy materials, thread, lining, etc.  She hopes to reinvest her new profits.

loans.use: to buy materials, thread, lining, etc. to enhance her sewing business.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Atzacan Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Lucila una integrante del grupo "Rosas de Atzacan" que esta ubicado en el estado de VeraC., México. Ella se dedica a la venta de tacos y tamales que inicio hace 20 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de un triciclo, sus compañeras la consideran una persona responsable, al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente contenta, tiene 33 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y tiene un hijo, quiere este credito para la compra de triciclos para aumentar sus ventas, también espera en un futuro poder construir su casa en su terreno y así poder ofrecerles a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una carrera a su hijo para que logre sus sueños.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Lucila’s house; she’s a member of the “Rosas de Atzacan” croup located in the state of VeraC., México.  She’s been selling tacos and tamales for the last 20 years.  She is asking for a loan to buy a tricycle (three-wheeled cart).  Her fellow group members consider her to be a responsible person.

She is 33 years old and at the moment of requesting the loan is happy.  She finished middle school and has a child.

She wants this loan to buy tricycles to increase sales.  She also hopes in the future to be able to build her house on her lot to offer her family a better quality of life and a career for her son so that he can reach his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new tricycle to increase sales

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La señora Justina trabaja como empleada en un cine y también realiza ventas de cosméticos y lavado de ropa, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos de repostería para su venta, pues muchos clientes le han pedido este tipo de producto (como paletas,moldes, cremas para decorar, etc.). Con los ingresos que obtiene  mantiene a su familia. Vive en casa  de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciada y tiene tres hijos . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Justina is an employee working in a movie theater; she also engages in selling cosmetics and in offering laundry services. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase baking products to sell, since many clients have asked for this kind of product (such as spatulas, molds, decorative icing, etc.) She is able to provide for her family thanks to her earnings. She lives in her parents’ house in Tacagua, a neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She is divorced and she has three children. This is her first cycle with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy baking products for resale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua B. sells palm oil at Abura near Frami in Cape Coast. Efua has been through senior high school. She is married and has nine dependants. Her husband is a farmer.  She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more palm oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business build a storage place for her oil.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Daize

texts.es: Daize, es empleada en una casa, el crédito lo necesita para cancelar las mensualidades en un Instituto  y así seguir estudiando. Vive  en casa de sus Padres ubicada en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz, es Soltera y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el señor trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Daize works as a maid in a house. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay off her monthly installments for a school, so that she will be able to keep on studying.
