She lives in her parents’ house in Villa Copacabana, a neighborhood of the city of La Paz; she is single and she has no children. This is her first cycle with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To pay for her monthly installments for a school.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen A. lives with his wife and three children in Shake village in the Sisian region. Karen keeps a cattle farm and cultivates land. Karen has some machinery that requires renovation. Karen also cuts the grass in the fields during the season and it is vital for him to have the tractor run well and be ready before that. It is all thanks to hard work and lots of effort that Karen is able to earn an income for his family and secure his children’s stable future.

Karen took the loan to repair his tractor before seasonal works start.

loans.use: to repair his tractor

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. has six dependants she is taking care of. Ama cooks kokonte at Abura near Frami in Cape Coast, which she has done for 7 years. She sells “wele” (the coat or skin of a cow) as well.  It is used in preparing soups and sauces. Her husband is a farmer. Ama contributes her income to the well-being of the home. Ama will use the loan to purchase more "wele" to supply her increasing customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to buy a piece of land.

In front of her she has displayed some of the coats yet to be sold.

loans.use: to purchase more "wele" (cow hide) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a certified course relevant to her profession.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Alicia D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y sus hijos D. 23, 20, 17, 15 y 11 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. semilla D. marañón y maní, este negocio lo inicio hace 20 años, viaja tres veces por semana a San Salvador y Santa Tecla a vender el producto.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. semilla D. Marañon y maní, ya que se está en plena temporada D. esta fruta por lo que ella desea realizar la compra para adquirir un mejor precio. Este financiamiento le servirá mucho, pues contara con suficiente producto para seguir trabajando en las ventas y D. esta manera ayudar a su familia que es muy numerosa.
Su objetivo es seguir mejorando el negocio y poder apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y que algún día puedan ser bachilleres.
texts.en:
Alicia, 38, lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután Department with her husband and children who are 23, 20, 17, 15 and 11 years of age.  She sells peanuts and cashews.  She started the business 20 years ago.  She travels to San Salvador and to Santa Tecla three times a week to sell the product.

She is asking for a loan to buy cashews and peanuts because this is the height of the season for these fruits and she wants to buy now at a better price.  The loan will be very useful because she’ll have enough products to continue working in sales and thus help her family which is quite numerous.

Her goal is to continue improving the business and to help her children with their studies so that some day they will be high school graduates.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and cashews

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua F. sells second hand clothes and provisions at Abura near Frami. Ekua has received a junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her business is quite young and she needs a loan to be able to stock her shop with provisions for resale. Her business objective is to build another shop in a different locality.

loans.use: to stock her shop with provisions to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Reside junto a su familia en el sector Chacupe Bajo del distrito de La Victoria, una zona rural que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Josefina se dedica a la venta de verduras en un puesto ubicado en el mercado “Los Patos” de su distrito. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, por ello cuenta con clientela fidelizada debido a su buen trato y la calidad y frescura de las verduras. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Josefina desea comprar un lote de verduras para surtir su puesto de verduras, aprovechando la oportunidad del buen precio esto ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Josefina es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina is 38 years old, she is married and she has one child. She lives with her family in Chacupe Bajo, a sector of La Victoria district, a rural area located twenty minutes away from the town of Chiclayo.

Josefina engages in selling vegetables in a stall located in the “Los Patos” market of her district. She has been running this activity for 5 years, and she can count on loyal customers thanks to her kind manners and to the quality and freshness of her vegetables. She uses the incomes coming from this activity to help her husband supporting their family’s economy.

Josefina wants to buy some more products to supply her vegetables stall, taking advantage of the current good prices. This will help her increase her sales and her incomes. This is why she has thought it useful to ask Edpyme Alterntativa for her first loan of 1000 PEN that will help her reach her goal.

Josefina is a rather calm and responsible woman. Her main goal is to keep on improving as an entrepreneur in order to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baking material such as pans

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes Q. is married and has four children. Agnes fries “poolo” (local name) at Abura for sale. “Poolo” is made from flour, grated coconut, sometimes sugar is added and nutmeg. It is deep-fried. 

Agnes husband is a farmer. Agnes uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Demand for the "poolo" is increasing and she is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to be able to produce on a larger scale for sale.

Her increased profit will be reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make local delicacy.

loans.name: Jose Lazaro

texts.es:
Don José Lázaro, de 55 años de edad,  reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y pipián, es un señor de familia, vive con sus hijos y nietos. Don José tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la producción agrícola, aprendió en su familia desde pequeño el proceso que lleva el trabajo de la tierra.
Actualmente quiere sembrar maíz y pipián, para lo que solicita un préstamo y cubrir con él los gastos en abono y fertilizantes, esto le permitirá estar preparado con los materiales para cuando inicie el proceso del cultivo.
Para don José la actividad agrícola significa mucho, por lo que no quiere dejar algún día de cultivar el maíz y pipián,  cada año se esfuerza por tener una mejor producción y dar los cuidados necesarios, ya que de este trabajo depende su familia.
texts.en:
Don José Lázaro is 55 years old and lives in the division of Jiquilisco in Usulután region.   He works in growing corn and pipián fruit.  He is a family man who lives with his ​​children and grandchildren. Don José has been devoted to agricultural production for 20 years, since childhood he has learned from his family the ways of working the land.

Currently he wants to sow corn and pipián fruit, which is why he is requesting a loan to cover expenses of manure and fertilizers.  This will allow him to be prepared with the materials for when he starts the cultivation process.

For Don José farming means a lot, so he doesn't want to miss one day of growing corn and pipián fruit.  Each year he strives for better production and to take care of necessities, as his family is dependent on this work.

loans.use: to cover the costs of manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah O. sells provisions in a shop at Abura near Frami. Hannah has received senior high education. She is divorced and has three children. She has been selling provisions for 10 years.  

As a single parent her income goes into school fees and utility bills. She is requesting for a loan to buy extra provisions that are requested by her customers. The additional income realized as a result of the loan will be re-invested back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: She is requesting for a loan to buy extra provisions that are requested by her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds and vegetables, as well as sacks of manure

loans.name: Jorgelina Soledad

texts.es:
La Sra. Jorgelina G. de 30 años de edad es costurera y trabaja con su madre hace más de 10 años, empezó trabajando en una fábrica y que con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar su primera máquina.
Actualmente posee 2 máquinas de coser con los que trabaja día a día  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.
Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya y en Kiva solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una nueva máquina, ya que actualmente con el inicio de clases cuenta con un gran número de pedidos.
texts.en:
Jorgelina G. is 30 years old.  She is a dressmaker and has been working with her mother for more than 10 years.  She started out working in a factory and, through a lot of hard work, managed to buy her first machine.  She currently owns two sewing machines which she uses every day to get her family ahead in life.

Jorgelina has decided to request a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva in order to buy a new machine since the school year is beginning right now and she has a large number of orders.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: For the past four years Abena K. has been producing palm oil for sale. She also sells drinks. Abena lives together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a farmer. She contributes covering household expenses. She needs more palm fruits to be able to process oil in large quantity for sale. A loan will go a long way to help her expand her oil production business. The extra profit realized from the loan will be reinvested back into oil making.

loans.use: to expand her oil production by buying more palm fruits.

loans.name: Hilda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hilda D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Puerto el Triunfo departamento D. Usulután, ella vive con sus dos hijos D. 15 y 11 años D. edad, este negocio lo tiene hace 8 años, lo atienD. todos los días y sus hijos le ayudan en el servicio a los clientes.
Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería y mariscos, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su inventario en la tienda y ofrecer a los clientes mayor producto, teniendo también oportunidad D. vender más.
Para ella su objetivo es mejorar cada día la condición económica D. su familia y sacar a sus adelante con los estudios.
texts.en:
Hilda, 34, lives in Puerto Triunfo, Usulután Department with her two children who are 15 and 11 years of age.  She’s had the business for 8 years and is open every day; her children help her take care of customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise and seafood.  This purchase will help her improve her inventory in the store and offer customers more products leading to more sales.

Her objective is to improve her family’s economic situation every day and to have her children finish their education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and seafood

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño Jesús se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Sary P. contactó con la asesora  para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, juntó a 15 mujeres que se encuentran trabajando en el 1er. ciclo.
La sra. Sary es propietaria de una despensa, ella emprendió este negocio para poder obtener un ingreso familiar sustentable económicamente, se dedica principalmente a la venta de frutas y verduras en su despensa, la cual ya la tiene desde hace mucho tiempo, ahora desea poder brindar mejor calidad y variedad a sus clientes por eso solicita el crédito, a modo de poder comprar más frutas y vegetales y luego obtener un margen mayor de ganancia por su venta.
texts.en:
'Divino Niño Jesús' (Divine Child Jesus) is the name of this group of women which was formed in the ctiy of Ita by its current Director General, Sary P..  She contacted an advisor to find out how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program works.  She gathered together 15 women who are currently working on their first loan cycle.

Sary owns a small grocery store.  She started her business in order to make sustainable income for her family.  She mainly sells fruit and vegetables in her store which she has owned for a long time.  She would like to provide better quality and variety to her customers which is why she is requesting this loan, so that she can buy more fruit and vegetables and make a better profit margin on her sales.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruits

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena O. is standing in front of her provisions shop. She is married and has one child. Alongside the provisions she sells jewelry. She has attained junior high education.  

Abena uses her income to assist her husband in paying the expenses of the household. Abena will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to save to expand her jewelry business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana es una madre D. familia D. 50 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Vallecito que se ubica a 12 km del distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización D. ganado ovino y aves D. corral, ella cría sus animales en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona y también en el mercado local en donD. resiD.. Esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años y es D. mucha ayuda para solventar junto a su esposo los gastos familiares.

Mariana desea adquirir alimento balanceado para su ganado y sus aves con la finalidad D. que obtengan buen peso y D. esta manera venderlos a un mejor precio incrementando sus ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 600 nuevos soles.

Mariana es una madre bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Mariana is a 50 year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the hamlet of Vallecito located 12 km from the TambogranD. agricultural district in the Piura region, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She works raising and selling sheep and poultry. She raises her animals in the area behind her house and when they have reached a good size and weight she sells them to the businessmen who often visit the area and also in the market near where she lives. She has done this for 5 years and is of great help to her husband in paying the household expenses.

Mariana wants to get commercial feed for her sheep and poultry with the aim of fattening them up so she can sell them for a better price and improve her earnings. For this reason she thought it best to request a loan of 600 soles ($225) from Edpyme Alternativa.

Mariana is a devoted mother to her family who always watches out for their well-being and development. People who know her respect her and are very fond of her.

loans.use: to purchase commercial animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Diosnel Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Diosnel tiene 61 años de edad, es separado, tiene hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes a él, vive en el barrio denominado Calle Yvate de la ciudad de Itá, posee un puesto comercial en el mercado municipal de la ciudad hace mas de 20 años, allí realiza la venta de diversos artículos como ser bazar, regalos, juguetes, bijouteri y artículos de  santería.
Solicita el préstamo en esta ocasión para surtir sus artículos de juguetería con la compra de camioncitos, pelotas, muñecas, mochilas y otros juguetes y artículos de santería.
El señor Diosnel demuestra ser una persona muy seria, responsable y trabajadora, manifiesta que dicha ganas de trabajar lo trae desde muy joven ya que proviene de una familia muy humilde que siempre le inculcó la responsabilidad.
Gracias a esta profesión mejoró su nivel de vida y ayudó a sus hijos a estudiar para que puedan ser personas útiles a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Diosnel is 61 years old, separated, and his children are grown and independent.  He lives in the Calle Yvate neighborhood of Itá. For more than 20 years he has had a shop in the city marketplace where he sells a wide variety of items such as household goods, gifts, toys, jewelry and trinkets, and santería items (santería is a blend of traditional African beliefs with Christianity).

He is requesting the loan at this time in order to increase his stock of toys by purchasing toy trucks, balls, dolls, backpacks and other toys, and santería items. 

Sr. Diosnel has shown himself to be a very serious, responsible and hardworking person. He has been working since he was very young, and comes from a very humble family who instilled him with responsibility. 

Thanks to his profession he improved his quality of life and helped his children study so they could be useful members of the community.

loans.use: Compra de juguetes y artículos de santería

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Vilma, D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en Usulután, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la administración D. una tienda, donD. ofrece productos D. consumo, el cual lo tiene desD. hace 5 años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, ya que quiere reforzar el inventario comprando materiales que son demandados por los clientes y que espera le dé lo resultados el aumento del comercio.
Su objetivo es invertir en el negocio para fortalecerlo ya que D. él dependen económicamente ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Vilma, 43, lives in Usulután with her husband; she doesn’t have children.

She runs a grocery store selling consumables that she’s had for five years.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise because she wants to strengthen her inventory buying merchandise that’s requested by her customers hoping the result will be an increase in commerce.

Her goal is to invest in the business to strengthen it because she and her husband depend on it economically.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo tiene 69 años, es casado y vive al lado de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene más de 48 años de experiencia en las actividades agrícolas junto a su esposa e hijos, siembran todo tipo de  verduras, así como papa. Por otro lado se dedica también a la crianza de reses y vacas, en donde vende la leche que extrae, asimismo arrienda los toros, ya que son de mucha ayuda para hacer surcos en los terrenos. Al cabo de un tiempo a base de cuidado y esfuerzo, extrae los productos que sembró y al ver la calidad, estos son llevados a su propia comercialización, con ello puede cubrir los gastos necesarios que de su familia requiere. Pero sabe que no es suficiente, es por esta razón que también se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en su propia movilidad, permitiéndole aumentar sus ingresos. Ahora sus planes es  aumentar la producción agrícola y ganadera, ya que hasta el momento le ha ido favorablemente. Es su sexta oportunidad de crédito que tiene con MFP,  se siente muy satisfecho y contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal que tanto aprecio tiene porque le ha permitido  mejorar en su forma de manejar el dinero  de su hogar y tener amigos a los considera muy cercanos. En esta ocasión comprará sacos de abono y fertilizantes que le ayudarán a preparar la tierra para el siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Segundo is 69, married, and lives with his 3 children in his own home. 

He has more than 48 years' experience in agricultural work. Together with his wife and children, he grows all types of vegetables, as well as potatoes. He also raises cattle and milk cows, selling the milk and renting out the bulls, that are very helpful for plowing. In the proper time, through his care and hard work, he sees the results of his harvest, and these are sold in the appropriate way according to the quality. 

With all of this he can cover the necessary expenses for his family. But he knows that it isn't enough, and for this reason he works offering transport services with his own vehicle, which allows him to increase his income. Now his plan is to increase his agricultural and cattle production, which has gone well for him so far. 

This is his sixth opportunity for a loan with MFP. He is very satisfied and happy to belong to his communal bank, and he greatly appreciates that he has been able to improve his household money management and have friends that he feels very close to. At this time, he will purchase bags of manure and fertilizers that will help him prepare the land for the next planting.

loans.use: to purchase bags of manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Hugo Rene

texts.es:
Don Hugo, reside en Usulután, tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la venta de medicina, el cual lo inicio hace 11 años después de haber terminado su servicio de militar.
El está solicitando un préstamo para adquirir más medicamentos, para fortalecer el negocio, ya que le ayudara a ofrecer mayor diversidad de medicamento y contar con la preferencia de los clientes.
Don Hugo sueña con poseer un local propio, donde pueda ofrecer a los clientes sus productos de calidad y de esta manera ayudar a su familia de una forma más solvente.
texts.en:
Don Hugo lives in Usulután.  He is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children.  He sells medicine, which he started doing 11 years ago after completing his military service.

He is requesting a loan to buy more medicines.  This will strengthen his business because it will help him provide a greater diversity of medicines and meet his customers' preferences.

Don Hugo dreams of having a separate location where he can offer his customers quality products, and thus help his family become more solvent.

loans.use: to buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is into palm oil production at Abura. Sarah has been through junior high school. She is married to a driver and they live together with their two children. She has been in this trade for three years. She assists her husband in payment of the household expenditures. Her loan will be invested into their oil production for further growth. She hopes plough back her additional profit.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to make palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama K. is married and has 11 dependants. She attained a senior high level of education. Ama sells palm oil at Abura near Watreso, which she has been doing for 50 years. Her husband is a farmer. Ama supports her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. She wants to expand her business and so is requesting a loan to produce more oil for sale. The new profit will be saved to buy an oil-extracting machine.

loans.use: to produce more oil to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells second hand clothes at Abura near Watreso. She is married and has two children. Her husband also deals in used clothing. She assists her husband in feeding the family. Her loan will be used to buy clothing in bulk for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 19 años; está casada con Edson. Ambos cuidan de sus 2 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos es de su anterior compromiso. Pero según afirma viven en armonía familiar, en su casa propia ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está abnegada mujer es la agricultura, donde siembra café y plátanos en sus 2 hectáreas de  terrenos agrícolas que se sitúa en la parte alta de su comunidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder extraer el plátano cada 15 días, pues se siente gustosa de obtener ganancias. Ya tiene 4 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo logró obtener buenas ganancias anuales en su cosecha de café, que lo comercializa en la ciudad de Villarica. Asimismo pudo obtener un motocarro, que le sirve para trabajar en el trasporte público. El cual le ayuda en los gastos diarios del hogar. Ahora planea incursionar en el negocio de venta de carne y productos lácteos, ya que en la campaña de café tiene gran demanda. Pues se requiere para la preparación de los alimentos del personal que trabaja en las diferentes haciendas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de Prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está segura podrá lograr sus objetivos. Luz, se está invirtiendo su capital de trabajo en la próxima cosecha de café. Por ello con el crédito comprará varios kilos de pescado de agua dulce, así como también comprará queso proveniente de la sierra para comenzar su negocio de venta de comida para la jornaleros.
texts.en:
Luz is 19 years old and married to Edson.  They both look after their 2 children, of whom one is from an earlier relationship.  Luz tells us that they live together in family harmony, in their own home which is located in Unión Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).

This self-sacrificing woman works as a farmer.  She grows coffee and bananas on her 2 hectares of farmland which are located in the elevated part of her community.  What she most enjoys about her work is being able to pick her bananas every two weeks as she feels glad to be making profits.  She has 4 years experience in this business and, over time, she has managed to obtain good annual profits from her coffee crops which she sells in the city of Villarica.  She has also been able to obtain a car that she uses to provide a public transport service.  This helps her with her daily household expenses.  Now Luz is planning to start a business selling meat and dairy products since there is a lot of demand during the coffee season.  These products are needed to prepare meals for the staff who work on all the different ranches.

Luz belongs to the "Desarrollando para el Progreso de Prisma" community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She is certain that she will be able to achieve her goals.  Luz is investing her working capital in her next coffee harvest.  For this reason, she will use her loan money to buy several kilos of freshwater fish and cheese from the mountains so that she can start her business selling meals to farm laborers.

loans.use: to buy fish and cheese

loans.name: Serenidad Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Serenidad, se conformó en fecha 17 de enero del 2009, gracias a que la Directora de Finanzas la Sra. Maria Mercedes C., quien se dedica a la venta de especias, ya formó parte de otro grupo anteriomente, que al desintegrarse dicho grupo, decidió contactar con la asesora y formar su propio grupo, la misma contactó con sus vecinas y logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 8º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La sra. Maria Mercedes vende especias, desde hace mucho tiempo mantiene a su familia con este pequeño negocio, hoy día quiere ampliarlo comprando mayor cantidad de especias y venderlas en proporciones igualmente cuantitativas por ello solicita el crédito para poder hacerlo y alcanzar su meta económica.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Women’s Committee was formed on January 17, 2009 by the Financial Director Sra. Maria Mercedes C.. In the past she was part of another group, but when it broke up, she decided to contact the advisor and form her own group. She talked to her neighbours and managed to put together a group of seventeen women who enjoy working together. They are now in their eighth loan cycle in the program.

Maria earns her living by selling spices. With the income from this small business, she has supported her family for many years. Now she wishes to expand it by buying and selling a larger quantity of spices. As a result, Maria is seeking a loan so she can do this and reach her financial goals.

loans.use: to buy spices

loans.name: Las Begonias Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “Las Begonias”, y escogieron este nombre porque son muy trabajadoras, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en Hidalgo, está conformado por 9 integrantes. María Isabel Velázquez G. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 31 años, vive en unión libre, estudió hasta la secundaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos, de 7 y 10 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica al campo, pero al ver la poca estabilidad laboral, decidió emprender un negocio para apoyar en la economía y la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, el cual inicio aproximadamente 2 años, requiere del crédito para invertir en abarrotes e incrementar  sus ventas. La señora Isabel nos comenta de la responsabilidad que representa pertenecer a una institución como la nuestra. Esta foto fue tomada, en la casa de la Señora Leticia T., Tesorera  del grupo el cual está ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo, El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes, en la foto se observa al grupo de señoras que están unidas y sonriendo por el apoyo brindado ya que sin este las probabilidades de crecimiento son muy limitadas; a partir de los pestamos que se les han otorgado el futuro de estas mujeres se observa en crecimiento y mejora en todos los sentidos. Falto en la foto Joel debido a que tuvo que salir a cuidar a su mamá pues no había quien se quedara con ella ese día.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Begonias.” They chose this name because they are very hard working.  The group is located in Hidalgo and it has 9 members.

María Isabel Velázquez G., 31, is group President.  She’s in a common law marriage, finished middle school, is a merchant and has two children who are 7 and 10 years of age. Her husband works in the fields.

Seeing the lack of employment stability she decided to start a business to support her economy and her children’s quality of life.  She started selling groceries two years ago and needs the loan to buy groceries and increase sales. Isabel mentioned to us the responsibility that belonging to an institution like ours represents.  

This photo was taken at Leticia T.’s house.  She is group Treasurer of the group that’s located in the State of Hidalgo.  The group has 9 members and in the photo a group of unified women can be seen smiling because of the support provided because, without it, probabilities of growth are very limited. The future and improvement in every sense of these women has been seen to grow since the loans began.

Missing from the photo is Joel who had leave to care for his mother because there was no one available to stay with her that day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maame Afia

texts.en:
Maame Afia B. sells items such as milk, canned tomatoes, paper drinks, sugar, and others in her shop. There are not enough goods in her shop so she is requesting a loan to refill her shop to supply her customers with their needs. 

Maame is married and responsible for the upbringing of 7 dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She helps to take care of the home. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Afia plans to save to further her dependants' educations.

loans.use: to refill store inventory

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: For the past six years, Afia B. has been sewing for people. She is married and currently taking care of two children. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband to take care of the home. A loan from kiva will help to buy more sewing materials to sew to attract customers. Her business objective is to open a boutique where she can display some of the things she sews.

loans.use: A loan from kiva will help to buy more sewing materials to sew to attract customers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is married and has 5five dependents. She has received junior high education. Joyce sells eggs and bread at Abura near Watreso, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a chain saw operator. 

Joyce uses the income she generates from her sales to help in the upkeep of the home. She needs a loan to enable her to expand the sales of the bread and eggs. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to save towards buying a shop.

loans.use: to expand her sales of bread and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase miscellaneous car supplies.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua G. is divorced. She cooks "banku" (made from corn) at Abura near Watreso in Cape Coast. Ekua wants to add the cooking of other foods to the "banku" she is preparing and so is asking for a loan to buy foodstuffs such as yams, plantains, etc. to cook to sell. She would like to open a big restaurant some day so she will save her new profit towards that goal.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as yams, plantains, etc. to cook to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soles etc. for his sandal-making business

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. sells palm oil at Abura near Watreso. Araba has been through junior high school. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Araba has been selling palm oil for just two years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her initial working capital to buy more palm fruits to produce more oil for sale. She hopes to further educate her dependents with the new profit.

loans.use: to produce more oil for sale.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced. She lives in Melitopol with two daughters and a son. Irina sells footwear, slippers, and bags in the central marketplace of her home town. She has been in the market for 12 years. She has already invested about 20,000 Grivnyas in her turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Irina is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for her vending kiosk and boost her sales, thus generating additional income this spring season. Eventually, Irina would like to use some of her profits to meet a few specific needs for her family. Her responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize Irina as a consistent and serious entrepreneur capable of loan repayment.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Judy

texts.es: Judy, de 19 años; es una joven soltera y trabajadora que vive en compañía de su mamá Sonia, su padre Jaime y sus 3 menores hermanos, con los que vive en unión familiar en su casa propia ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Hace 2 años recibió la herencia de sus padres que consistía en una hectárea de terreno agrícola; donde comenzó a sembrar plátano y café, y aunque le falta muchas técnicas por aprender, se siente contenta por el logró que está realizando. Pues tiene un ingreso seguro vendiendo el grano de café a la cooperativa del Palomar. Ahora su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para poder mejorar sus cultivos, así como también ampliar su terreno. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el futuro de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibió. Judy, muy pronto comenzará a cosechar café, por ello con el crédito completará el dinero que le falta para la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
19-year old Judy is single and hardworking. She lives with her mother Sonia, her father Jaime, her three younger siblings, and her partner in their own home located in Unión Palomar in the Peruvian rainforest. Two years ago she inherited a hectare of farmland from her parents. She planted bananas and coffee with the help of her father, and although she doesn’t have a lot of aptitude for learning, she feels happy with what she has accomplished. She has a steady income from the coffee beans which she sells in the Palomar cooperative. 

Judy most enjoys the literacy program instigated by the Peruvian government which teaches older people who have not completed their primary education how to read and write. The biggest difficulty she faces is the lack of money to be able to improve her fields and to buy more land. She belongs to the Desarrollando para el Futuro de Prisma Communal Bank. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is grateful for the support she has received. Very soon Judy will begin the coffee harvest; the money from this together with the loan will enable her to buy several sacks of manure to spread on her fields.

loans.use: to buy bags of manure

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married with two sons. He is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka, which is a predominantly agricultural region of the Ukraine. Andrei runs 10 big greenhouses and a separate one for seedlings. He started this enterprise 15 years ago. He has already invested about 150,000 Grivnyas in the trade. 

Andrei is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase black plastic film to be spread on the ground, to finish installation of a heating system and construct a drip irrigation unit. Polyethylene film expenses will amount to 10,000 Grivnyas. Costs related to installation of a heating system amount to 3,000 Grivnyas. Installation of an irrigation unit costs about 2,000 Grivnyas. Greenhouse business has a huge potential in this region of Ukraine, which is why Andrei pins great hopes on further development of his venture.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film, and install heating and irrigation systems

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Juan, se conformó el 15 de Abril del 2010, gracias a la sra. Crescencia M., ella le comentó de la forma de trabajo al grupo y acerca del crédito, logró juntar a 18 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el 4º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Es un grupo que se destaca por trabajo en conjunto y solidario que realizan.
La sra. Crescencia se dedica a la Venta de Bebidas, ella posee ese negocio en su casa, desde allí provee a todos sus clientes con todas las bebidas que se necesitan el distintos festejos que se realizan, cumpleaños, aniversarios, agasajos (fiestas ofrecidas a alguien por una fecha importante como la Primera Comunión Católica), etc.
Sin embargo, desea aumentar su stock de productos para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes y vecinos, por ello solicita el préstamo a Kiva, para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
The San Juan Communal Bank was formed on April 15th, 2010, thanks to Crescencia M..  She talked about the way to work together in a group and about loans.  She managed to get 18 women together.  You can find them working very happily in their 4th cycle.  They work together in a cohesive and supportive way within the program.  It is a group that stands out because of its cohesive and supportive work.

Crescencia sells drinks.  She has this business in her house.  From there she provides all of her customers with all of the drinks that are needed for different festivities.  She provides drinks for birthdays, anniversaries, “asagojas” (celebrations for people for an important date like the Catholic First Communion), etc.

She wants to increase her stock of products in order to better meet the needs of her customers and neighbors.  That is why she is requesting a Kiva loan.  The loan is to be able to carry out her project.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, wine, and cider, etc.

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi is married with a grown son, Oleg. Valeryi is a farmer from the small town of Vodyanoye. He owns 6 greenhouses and 3 separate ones for seedlings. In addition, he also has a propagating frame for seedlings. Valeryi has invested about 200,000 UAH in his venture. He has been in this business for 22 years. 

Valeryi is seeking a loan of 15,000 UAH to construct a new greenhouse to expand his farming business. He is planning to use the loan as follows: 4,000 UAH to purchase polyethylene film; 1,000 UAH for metal wires; 1,500 UAH for cucumber seeds; 2,000 UAH  for fertilizers; 6,500 UAH for engineering and building expenses. Thorough management of funds received will ensure greenhouse construction that will be neither expensive nor time-consuming.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 23 años, es una excepcional mujer. Pues cuida de su papá Jesús, su mamá Herlinda y sus 2 hermanos; con los que vive en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). A pesar de haber culminado sus estudios de enfermería; no deja de dedicarse al oficio de sus padres, “la agricultura”. En sus propios terrenos agrícolas siembra café y plátanos, hace 5 años. De lunes a viernes trabaja en una farmacia de la ciudad de Villarica, mientras que los fines de semana, dedica su tiempo en los cuidados de sus cultivos los cuales quiere mucho, pues es la actividad de la familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder brindar trabajo en la cosecha de café a los vecinos de su localidad, pues necesita la ayuda de peones para extraer los granos de café. Su principal dificultad es la falta de apoyo, por ello más adelante está pensando contratar personal permanente para poder dar a sus cultivos el cuidado que necesita. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el futuro de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo recibido de parte de los miembros de su asociación. Luz, comprará con el crédito, abono orgánico y canastas, para la cosecha de café que se realizará a fines de este mes.
texts.en:
Luz, age 23, is an exceptional woman.  She takes care of her father, Jesús; her mother; Herlinda, and her two siblings.  They live together as a family in their own house.  The house is located in Unión Palomar (central Peruvian jungle).  In spite of having finished her nursing studies, she does not stop working in her parents’ business, farming.  For five years they have been growing coffee and bananas on their own farming land.

From Monday through Friday she works in a pharmacy in the city of Villarica.  On the week-ends she takes care of their crops, which she likes a lot because it is a family activity.  What she likes the most about her work is being able to give work to her neighbors during the coffee harvest.  She needs the workers’ help in order to extract the coffee beans.  Her main difficulty is the lack of help.  She is thinking of hiring permanent personnel later in order to be able to give her crops the care they need.

She belongs to the Desarollando para el Futuro de Prisma Communal Bank.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support she has received from the members of the association.  Luz will use the loan to buy organic fertilizer and baskets for her coffee harvest  at the end of this month.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and baskets for her coffee harvest at the end of this month

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es: La señora P. A. Islaida tiene 29 años D. edad es casada y tiene un hijo, vive en  Villa Juanita en Comas-Lima –PERU  ella se dedica a la venta D. anticuchos  afuera D. su casa, empezó el negocio porque deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. la casa pero a la vez sin tener que dejar a su  pequeño hijo con otra persona  en casa. No fue tan difícil empezar con el negocio pues una vecina que vendía  en su barrio se trasladaba a otra zona y le dejo el negocio a  la señora Islaida. DesD. entonces y por casi ya más D. un año sale todos los fines D. semana a vender sus anticuchos.  Su deseo es poder comprar un carro y ponerlo a trabajar  para que haya un mayor ingreso en el hogar.
texts.en:
P. A. Islaida is 29, married, and has one child.  She lives in Villa Juanita en Comas-Lima –PERU.  She sells kebobs outsiD. of her house.  She started this business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.  At the same time, she did not want to leave her small child with someone else at home.

It was not so difficult to start the business.  A neighbor who sold in her neighborhood moved to another area, and she left the business to Islaido.  From then on, and for almost more than one year, she leaves every week-end to sell her kebobs.  Her wish is to be able to buy a cart and put it to work in order to have greater income at home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her kebob sales

loans.name: Los Vecinos Del Valle Group

texts.es:
Alicia forma parte del Banco comunal “Los vecinos del valle” conformado por 20 emprendedores, que se desempeñan en los rubros de amasandería, salón de belleza, venta de ropa y lencería. Pertenecientes a la ciudad de Casablanca.
Alicia quien en la foto aparece en primera fila, al costado izquierdo, vistiendo una polera negra. Se dedica a la artesanía, específicamente la realización de velas, decoupage (es un efecto de pintura decorativa sobre madera y vidrio), mosaicos (composición geométrica, decorativa, hecha con piezas de cerámica) y tejidos de lana. Además vende ropa nueva.
El oficio de artesanía lo realiza desde hace 10 años, por lo que sus clientes frecuentes son antiguos y responsables. Ella vende su artesanía y ropa a domicilio (casa por casa). 
Alicia compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Santiago, ya que los precios son más convenientes para su negocio.
Alicia vive con su esposo y su nieto de 10 años, a quien cuida desde que nació, ya que su hija se fue a trabajar a otra ciudad y no se responsabilizó de su rol de madre. Por lo que ha tenido que criar y educar a su nieto. Es por esto su motivación de continuar con su negocio, ya que quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y educación a su nieto.
Con este préstamo Alicia comprará ropa para la temporada de invierno.
El sueño de Alicia es tener un auto, para repartir su mercadería en los sectores más rurales, ya que por ahora traslada sus productos en bicicleta, sin embargo en la temporada de invierno, ésta tarea se dificulta debido al frío y lluvia de la ciudad. Con esto aumentaría su clientela y por ende sus ganancias. 
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de participar en Fondo Esperanza le gustan mucho las reuniones grupales, debido a la responsabilidad  de las otras emprendedoras, es por esto que además es delegada del Banco comunal. En cuanto al financiamiento que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, ha sido un gran aporte para su negocio, ya que con este ha podido invertir y podrá aumentar sus ingresos.
Casablanca es una comuna de la provincia de Valparaíso, ubicada en la región del mismo nombre. Tiene un clima de tipo mediterráneo, con veranos de sequía prolongada y lluvias invernales cortas, pero muy fuertes. El nombre “Casablanca” proviene del siglo XVI cuando existía “una casa de muros blanquecinos” sobre una loma ubicada a un costado de uno de sus caminos más antiguos, llamado camino real de carretas. 
Actualmente su economía se basa en servicios, agricultura, transporte, agroindustria, turismo, comercio.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the "Los Vecinos del Valle" (Neighbors of the Valley) community bank which is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who have different businesses such as a bakery, a beauty salon and a business selling clothes and lingerie.  They live in the city of Casablanca.

Alicia is in the front row of this photo, on the left, wearing a black top.  She is in the craft business.  She makes candles, decoupage (a decorative paint effect used on wood and glass), mosaics (geometric, decorative, compositions made with pieces of pottery) and knitted items.  She also sells new clothes

Alicia started out in the craft trade 10 years ago which means that her frequent customers are long-standing and responsible.  She sells her crafts and clothes door to door.  Alicia buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago since the prices there are better for her business.  

Alicia lives with her husband and her 10 year-old grandson who she has cared for since he was born because her daughter went off to work in another city and didn't take responsibility for him as his mother.  For this reason, Alicia has had to raise and educate her grandson.  This is her motivation to continue in her business: she would like to provide her grandson with a better quality of life and an education.  She will use her loan to buy clothes for the winter season.

Alicia's dream is to own a car in order to distribute her merchandise to more rural areas.  Right now, she transports her products on a bicycle.  However, during the winter, this task becomes difficult because of the cold and rain in the city.  With a car, she would be able to increase her customer base and, consequently, her profits.

Alicia is very grateful and happy to be working with Fondo Esperanza.  She really enjoys the group meetings because the other entrepreneurs are all responsible.  Alicia is the community bank's representative.  As regards the loans that she receives through Fondo Esperanza, they have been a great support for her business since they have enabled her to invest and increase her income.

Casablanca is a town which is located in Valparaíso province, in the region of the same name.  It has a Mediterranean climate, with summers of prolonged drought and short, heavy, winter rains.  The name 'Casablanca' (literally: 'white house') dates from the 16th Century when there was a 'wall with whitish walls' located on a hillside, at the side of one of the oldest roads in the area called 'Camino Real de Carretas'.

Casablanca's economy is currently based on the service industry, agriculture, transport, agroindustry, tourism and commerce.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Germán

texts.es:
Germán tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el sector Primero de Mayo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado porque generalmente las personas viven en zona urbana marginal asimismo es también una zona comercial.

Germán se dedica a la compra y venta de papayas (es un fruto muy agradable, dulce y saludable) en el mercado Moshoqueque ubicado en su distrito. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, por ello cuenta con clientela fidelizada debido a su buen trato y la calidad y frescura de la frutas. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad sirven para solventas los gastos de su familia.

Germán desea comprar un lote de esta fruta, aprovechando la oportunidad del buen precio esto ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Germán is 65 years old, married, and lives together with his family in Primero de Mayo neighborhood, in José Leonardo Ortiz district, one of the most populous districts in Lambayeque region.  This district is noted for the fact that its people generally live in poorer, urban areas.  It is also a commercial area.

Germán's business is buying and selling papayas (a very pleasant, sweet and healthy fruit), in Moshoqueque market which is located in his district.  He has been in this business for 15 years and has a loyal customer base owing to his good customer service and the quality and freshness of his fruit.  He uses the income he makes in his business to cover his family's expenses.

Germán would like to buy a batch of papayas, taking advantage of the opportunity of a good price.  This will help him to increase his sales and profits.  For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, in the sum of 1,000 Peruvian soles.  This will help him to achieve his goal and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a batch of fruit for his business

loans.name: Gladys Ramona

texts.es:
La sra. Gladys tiene 45 años, y está casada con el sr. Ciro Z. D. 44 años D. edad, tienen 2 hijos varones D. 13 años y 5 años respectivamente, y ambos van a la escuela cerca D. su casa.
La sra. hace 13 años que se dedica a elaborar trabajos D. cotillón, para cumpleaños infantiles, quince años y bodas, también realiza trabajos D. decoraciones para todo tipo D. acontecimientos,  ya sea empresariales o  familiares.
Su esposo tenía en su domicilio una despensa bien surtida, y que atendía personalmente, pero luego le salió un trabajo en el Ministerio D. Obras Públicas, y la sra. Gladys también se hizo cargo D. la misma por un buen tiempo pero luego decidió cerrarlo, ya que los trabajos D. Cotillón le llevaban mucho tiempo y quería atender bien  a sus clientes.
Según manifiesta cuenta con muy buena clientela y trabaja por recomendaciones D. sus propios clientes.
El crédito que solicita le serviría para comprar materiales D. mejor calidad, ya que teniendo un poco más D. capital encontraría variedad y mejor precio.
texts.en:
Gladys is 45 years old and she is married with Mr. Ciro Z. who is 44 years old. They have two boys, aged 13 and 5 respectively. They both go to school near their house. 

She has been making decorations for kids' parties, sweet sixteens, and weddings. She also makes decorations for all types of occasions, whether for business or for families. 

Her husband had a well-stocked grocery store in their home that he used to manage personally but later he became employed with the Ministry of Public Works. Gladys managed the store for a time but she later decided to close the business because her decorations business enjoys a good client base and she becomes known through recommendations by her existing clients.

The loan that she requires is to purchase better quality materials. Having a better capital fund will help her add variety and she will be able to give betters prices.

loans.use: to purchase crafting materials to make decorations

loans.name: Sandro

texts.es: Sandro, de 35 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador que se independizó de su familia; comprando una casa al costado de la vivienda de sus padres, ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La siembra de plátanos y café en sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas; es su principal actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver madurar los granos que cuida con mucho esmero. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia en la siembra y venta de sus granos de café, que vende a los mismos intermediarios que visitan sus terrenos anualmente en cada campaña agrícola. Donde tiene que invertir gran cantidad de dinero para obtener una buena ganancia. Asimismo cuenta que los demás meses del año, donde no hay cosecha, trabaja como peón en otros cultivos, obteniendo una ganancia mensual de S/. 500 nuevos soles, que le ayudan a solventar sus gastos personales y los de su cultivo propio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz por la oportunidad de progreso que le facilitaron. Sandro, comprará 10 sacos de guano de isla, los cuales esparcirá entre sus plantaciones de café; porque en el mes de abril comenzará la rebusca (extracción de los primeros granos maduros).
texts.en:
Sandro is 35 years old.  He is a single, hard-working man who lives independently from his family, having bought a house next to his parents' home which is located in Unión Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).  Sandro grows bananas and coffee on his 3 hectares of farmland.  This is his main business activity. 

What Sandro most enjoys about his work is being able to watch his beans mature as he looks after them very carefully.  He has 20 years experience in growing and selling coffee beans.  He sells his produce to traders who visit his land annually, every harvest season.  He has to invest a large quantity of money in order to obtain good profits.  During the other months of the year, when there is no harvest, Sandro works as a laborer on other people's crops, making a monthly income of 500 Peruvian soles that he uses to cover his personal expenses and those of his own crops.

Sandro is a member of the 'Desarrollando para el Progreso de Prisma' community bank and this is his first loan from MFP.  He feels very happy to have been offered a chance to make progress.  Sandro will buy 10 sacks of guano which he will spread over his coffee plantations because in April he will begin extracting his first mature beans.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of bird guano

loans.name: Assurance De Phaeton Group

texts.fr:
Dalusma est le coordinateur de son groupe Assurance.

Dalusma habite dans la région de Phaeton d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Dalusma a dirigé son commerce de pieces mecaniques pendant les 8 dernières années.

Dalusma voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus de pieces 

Des autres membres D’assurance ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires et du poisson.

Dalusma dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause du chômage.

Dalusma dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’il achète un camion pour faciliter le commerce.
texts.en: Dalusma is the coordinator of his group, Assurance. Dalusma lives in the Phaeton region in Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Dalusma has been in the mechanical parts business for the last 8 years. Dalusma would like to use this loan to invest in more parts. Some other members of Assurance need a loan for businesses, including selling food products or fish. Dalusma says that his main challenge is the lack of regular customers because of unemployment. Dalusma says that his dream is to grow his business in order to be able to buy a truck to facilitate his business.

loans.use: to buy mechanical parts

loans.name: Las Prosperas De Carabayllo Group

texts.es: La señora Emilia M. Huamán tiene 38 años de edad y vive en  Carabayllo – Lima – PERU, es casada y tiene 03 hijos, desde muy joven a trabajada al inicio trabajaba ayudando en la venta de ropa a una señora, dedicándose a juntar su dinero  a fin de poder tener su propio negocio. Actualmente y en base de mucho esfuerzo la señora EMILIA vende ropa a pedido, con el dinero que gana ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos.  Su meta es poder obtener un lugar céntrico donde poder vender abarrotes y también desea  tener un  carro
texts.en: Emilia M. Huamán is 38 and lives in Carabayllo, Lima. PERU.  She is married and has three children.  From an early age, Emilia has worked selling clothing, and saved up until she was able to have her own business.   Emilia now supplies customer requests for clothing, and her profits allow her to provide for her family.  Her goals include finding a central place to open a store, and eventually to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy inventory of women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Maria Nicolasa V., es una persona casada, tiene 43 años de edad, cuenta con 6 hijos 5 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía al tejido de cortes típicos, cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, inicio siendo trabajadora para otras personas, actualmente quiere capitalizar su propio negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para compra de hilo que le servirá como materia prima para su trabajo, espera que con el préstamo pueda mejorar y crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Nicolasa V. is 43 years old and married.  She has 6 children, 5 of whom are studying.  Maria's business is producing handicrafts, weaving traditional skirts.  She has 4 years experience in this business, having started out working for other people.  She would currently like to capitalize her own business and is requesting a loan to buy thread that she will use as raw material in her work.  She hopes that the loan will enable her to improve and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy thread for her weaving

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de BOK JOM est un créé depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de WANGO qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent pratiquement le même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par des liens d'amitié et de voisinage. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce.

Madame HELENE N. (à droite de la photo avec une écharpe blanche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 72 ans. Elle est veuve avec des enfants qui sont tous majeurs. Mais elle a la charge de ses 05 petits. 

Avant elle faisait la transformation de mil en couscous pour revendre au marché et dans le quartier. Elle fait maintenant un petit commerce de légumes et de poissons séchés. Elle vend des choux, du piment, des aubergines doux et amers. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de financer son petit commerce de légumes et de poissons séchés.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de participer à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne de la famille et à l'achat des fournitures scolaires de ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
The Bok Jom group has been created during the inauguration of the Banc Villageois of Wango to which it belongs. It is composed of 12 women who live in almost the same neighborhood. They are friends and neighbors who decided to form a group together. Their main business activity is retail. Mrs. Helene N. (to the right in the photo, wearing a white scarf) is the group’s leader. She is 72 years old. She is a widow, and all her children are adults. But she has five grandchildren in her care.

In the past she used to cook millet couscous in order to sell it at the market or in her neighborhood. At present, she retails vegetables and dried fish. She sells cabbage, hot peppers, and sweet and bitter varieties of eggplant [aubergine]. Her new loan will allow her to finance her vegetables and dried fish business. Her goal is to provide for her personal needs and to  help to the everyday family expenses as well as with the costs of school supplies for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and dried fish

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la señora Carmen Elizabeth C., ella es una señora muy amable y activa, vive en su casita con sus tres hijos, ella es madre soltera pero siempre supo salir adelante a pesar de todo, ella tiene una despensa y retiró el crédito para poder agrandar su negocio ya que eso la ayudaría bastante.
También sus hijos tienen sus actividades para ayudarle en la economía del hogar.
La señora Carmen se enteró por medio de otros grupos que existe este programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y le interesó bastante, ella recorrió casa por casa en su barrio para conformar el grupo.
Este es un grupo muy unido, decidieron realizar actividades cada semana para obtener su caja en común, a pesar de que todas ellas tienen su micro-empresa.
Ellas son del Barrio Ypati de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, sus metas son sacar siempre adelante al grupo, sus micro-empresas y también a sus familias, y todas dan gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que les da.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Carmen Elizabeth C..  Carmen is a very kind and active lady who lives in her small home with her three children.  She is a single mother but has always known how to get ahead in life in spite of everything.  Carmen owns a grocery store and she took out this loan so that she could expand her business since this would help her a lot.  Carmen's children also have their own business activities and help her with the household finances.  

Carmen found out about the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program through other groups and she was very interested.  She went door to door in her neighborhood in order to get a group together.  This is a very united group whose members decided to carry out activities every week in order to make money for their joint fund, in spite of the fact that they all have their own small businesses to run.  The women are all from Ypati neighborhood, in the city of Villa Elisa.  Their goals are to always get their group, their small businesses and their families ahead.  They all give thanks to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity the organization gives them.

loans.use: to increase the size of her business

loans.name: Quimey Group

texts.es:
Jorge forma parte D. banco comunal “Quimey” conformado por 22 emprendedores, que se desempeñan en los rubros de artesanía, repostería, confección de tarjetas de visita, peluquería y comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, joyas y perfumes. Pertenecientes a la ciudad de Villarrica.
Jorge quién en la foto aparece en segunda fila, al lado izquierdo, se encuentra de pie y viste polera blanca. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para niños, mujeres y varones. Él trabaja en el garaje de su casa desde hace 2 años y vende sus artículos tres veces a la semana correspondientes a los días jueves, viernes y sábados. Los días restantes de la semana, se dedica a reparar muebles, vender bolsos y está preparando un nuevo negocio que es la Picaduría de leña. Durante la temporada de verano Jorge arrienda su casa a turistas, por dos meses (enero y febrero), ya que recibe más ingresos que su mismo negocio, Villarrica es una zona turística, lo que es favorable. Con éste préstamo comprará ropa usada de casa en la ciudad de Santiago, específicamente; sábanas y cortinas.
Jorge trabajó durante 20 años en el rubro D. comercio teniendo a su poder una distribuidora, pero lamentablemente su negocio quebró, sin embargo a pesar de ésta mala experiencia, su sueño es volver a tener una distribuidora de confites, que le permitan mantener una estabilidad laboral. Por ende sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio, ya que de esta manera obtendría mayores ingresos que le permitirían tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Jorge vive con su esposa y su hija de 22 años.
El está muy agradecido de Fondo Esperanza le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, sobretodo porque él es presidente y líder D. grupo de emprendedores, los apoya y aconseja.
En cuanto al financiamiento que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, éste será un gran aporte para su negocio, ya que con este podrá invertir más y aumentar sus ingresos.
Villarrica es una  ciudad al sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de La Araucanía. Es una ciudad pequeña, pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y turísticos, siendo uno de los principales centros de servicios D. área cordillerana y principal centro turístico de la región, junto con Pucón. Durante los meses de verano se realizan numerosas actividades y eventos culturales, artísticos y deportivos, Además de las innumerables alternativas de Ecoturismo, Turismo Aventura y Etnoturismo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of the communal bank “Quimey,” which is made up of 22 entrepreneurs.  They work in the areas of handicrafts, confections, making business cards, hair dressing and trade, specifically selling clothing, jewlery and perfumes.  They all live in the city of Villarrica.
In the photo, Jorge is on the left side of the second row.  He is standing and wearing a white t-shirt.  He makes his living selling second-hand men's women's and children's clothing.  For the last two years he has worked out of this garage.  He sells his merchandise three days a week, on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays.  During the rest of the week, he repairs furniture, sells handbags and is preparing to start a new business chopping firewood.  Because Villarica is a tourist area, which is favorable, Jorge rents his house to toursits during the two months of the summer season (January and February).  He makes more money from the rental than from his businesses.  With this loan, Jorge will purchase second-hand household linens in the city of Santiago, specifically sheets and curtains.
Jorge worked for 20 years in commerce, running a distribution company.  Regretably, his business went bankrupt.  Nevertheless, in spite of that bad experience, his dream is to once again have a confections distribution company, which would afford him job stability.  Consequently, he is motivated to continue with his businesses, since that is the way to obtain the greatest earnings and have a better quality of life.
Jorge lives with his wife and his 22 year-old daughter.
He is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza.  He really enjoys participating in the meetings, especially because he is the president of the communal bank and the leader of the entrepreneurs, who he supports and advises.
With regard to the financing he is receiving from Fondo Esperanza, it will be a great support to his business.  He will be able to invest more and increase his earnings.
Villarrica is a city in the south of Chile located in the Araucanía Region.  It is a small city but offers all the basic and tourist services.  It is one of the principal service centers in the mountain area and a prinicpal tourist center of the region, along with Pucón. During the summer months, there are numerous activities and cultural, artistic and sporting events.  In addition, there are countless options for Eco-tourism, Adventure Tourism and Ethno-tourism.

loans.use: to purchase sheets and curtains.

loans.name: Les Fines Fleurs 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Guensly  est le coordinateur  de son groupe Les Fines Fluers.
 

Guensly  habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE  d’Haïti où il y a peu d’électricité   et l’eau est très limitée.

GUENSLY vend du tennis soulies et autre  pendant les 5 dernières années.

Avant de faire le commerce, Guensly était un élève et aussi facteur.

Guensly  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir au commerce du soulier et de tennis. Guensly  voudrait utiliser ce prêt pour un agrandissement total de son commerce.

Guenly vit toujours dans le concubinage il a un enfant.

Son objectif principal c’est devenir un grand commercant durant toute sa vie d’avoir de grand magasin de commercer avec l’exterieur pendant toute son existence terreste.
texts.en:
Guensly is the coordinator of his group, The Delicate Flowers. 
Guensly lives in the city of Ouanaminthe in Haiti, where there is little electricity and the water is very limited.
Guensly has been selling tennis shoes among other things for the last 5 years. 
Before selling things, Guensly was a student and then a mailman. 
Guensly would like to use this loan to invest in his tennis shoe business. Guensly would like to use this loan for a total expansion of his business.
Guensly lives with his wife. He has one child.
His principal objective is to become a big businessman and to have a big store with an outside area for the rest of his life.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes

loans.name: Noe Efrain

texts.es:
Noe Efrain G. X., tiene 48 años de edad, curso el tercer años de educación primaria, se dedica a la fabricacion de muebles, carpinteria, lleva 23 años de experiencia con este trabajo, inicio haciendo trabajos con herramientas mecanicas y actualmente usa maquinas para agilizar y facilitar su trabajo. 

Solicita un préstamo para compra madera de pino blanco, que le servirá para fabricar mas muebles y mejorar sus ganancias, espera con el préstamo en el futuro contar con mas maquinaria y empleados.
texts.en:
Noe, who is 48 years old, completed the 3rd year of primary education.  He  does carpentry and makes furniture, and has 23 years of experience at it.  Noe began working with mechanics' tools and now uses machines to facilitate his work.

Noe is requesting a loan to purchase white pine lumber with which he will make furniture and improve his earnings.  He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to acquire more machinery in the future and hire more employees.

loans.use: TO BUY WOOD TO MAKE FURNITURE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY RICE, SWEETS, AND DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Restauration De Mon Repos Group

texts.fr:
Francisque est le coordinateur de son groupe Restauration.

Francisque habite dans la région de Mon Repos d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Francisque a dirigé son commerce de Charbon pendant les 7 dernières années.

Francisque voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus de Bois pour faire le charbon

Des autres membres de Restauration ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires et du charbon.

Francisque dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause de chômage.

Francisque dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’il achète un moto pour le taxi et aussi un camion pour faciliter le commerce.
texts.en:
Francisque is the coordinator of his group, Restoration.
Francisque lives in the Mon Repos region in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited.
Francisque has been in the business of selling coal for the last 7 years. 
Francisque would like to use this loan to invest in more wood to make coal.
Other members of Restoration need a loan for businesses including selling food products and coal.
Francisque says that his main challenge is the lack of regular customers because of unemployment.
Francisque says that his dream is to expand his business to be able to buy a motorcycle taxi and also a truck to facilitate sales.

loans.use: to buy wood to make coal

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es:
Dios con Nosotros se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa el 07 de Mayo de 2009, gracias a que la actual Directora General, la Sra. Licia A., contactó con la asesora para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando en el 6° ciclo.
La sra. Licia se dedica a la costura y trabaja en su casa desde hace 2 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella desea poder superarse económicamente pues desea eliminar la pobreza en la que viven los miembros de su familia y también anhela darle a sus hijos un futuro mejor, por eso solicita un préstamo para comprar más telas y realizar más confecciones con los materiales necesarios.
texts.en:
"Dios con Nosotros" (God is with us) is the name of an excellent group of women who formed their group in the city of Villa Elisa, on May 7th, 2009.  Their current Director General, Licia A., contacted an advisor to find out how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program works.  Once she had been advised about the program, she managed to get together 15 women who are now working on their 6th loan cycle.

Licia is a dressmaker and she has worked in this business from her home for 2 years.  She is married, has three children, and would like to make progress financially as she would like to lift herself out of the poverty in which she and her family members live and provide her children with a better future.  For this reason, she would like a loan so that she can buy more fabric and make more garments with the necessary materials.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las Emprendedoras se denomina el grupo conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa el 11 de Junio de 2008, gracias a Angela O., ella contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía, una vez asesorada acerca del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 9° ciclo.
La sra. Angela tiene una despensa en su casa desde hace 2 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella solicitó el crédito para poder comprar más comestibles para su tienda, pues tiene muchos clientes y no puede complacerlos bien porque su capital es limitado, por eso necesita esta ayuda financiera para impulsar su negocio y así poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
'Las Emprendedoras' (The Enterprising Women) is the name of this group which was formed in the city of Villa Elisa on June 11th, 2008.  Angela O. contacted an advisor during a weekly meeting.  Once she had been advised about how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program works, she managed to get together 16 women who are now working very happily on their 9th loan cycle.

Angela has had a grocery store in her home for 2 years.  She is married and has 4 children.  She requested this loan so that she could buy more groceries for her store since she has a lot of customers and cannot keep them all happy because she has limited capital.  This is why she needs this financial help, so that she can drive her business forward and better satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Margarita Ofelia

texts.es:
Margarita Ofelia T. A. es una mujer emprendedora pues aunque su esposo trabaja como vinculado a una empresa tiene dificultades con el pago de la nómina que no es muy cumplido lo que en algunos meses, les generaba inconvenientes para cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

Dicha situación fue lo que impulsó a Margarita a estudiar belleza y montar con mucho sacrificio su propio salón de belleza, en la que actualmente trabaja pero para la que también necesita mucho apoyo, pues desea comprar plancha para el cabello, una patillera toallas y Shampoo para ir mejorando su servicio y así captar cada vez más clientes.
texts.en: Margarita Ofelia T. A. is an enterprising woman.  Although her husband works for a company, they were having difficulties in paying his wages.  He hadn't been paid punctually for some months.  This was creating problems for the couple in covering their household expenses.  This situation drove Margarita to take a beauty course and, with a lot of sacrifice, she set up her own beauty salon in which she currently works.  However, she also needs a lot of support as she would like to buy a hair iron, clippers, towels and shampoo so that she can continue to improve her service and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a hair iron, clippers and towels

loans.name: Alicia Betty

texts.es:
Alicia de 47 años, vende un plato típico en Ecuador llamado “Fritada”. Por su dedicación y esfuerzo a podido mantener esta tradición vendiendo los platos de fritada que son hechos con carne de cerdo y granos. 

Trabaja desde muy temprano haciendo fritada para sus clientes fijos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar haciendo más paltos típicos. Pero por ahora quiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y asi mejorar su casa como cemento, arena y bloques.
texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old and sells a traditional dish in Ecuador called “fritada”. With effort and dedication, she has been able to maintain the tradition of selling “fritada” dishes made of pork and grains.

Alicia starts very early preparing “fritada” for her established customers. She has many aspirations for her business, which includes continuing to make more traditional dishes.
