Now she wants to use this loan to buy construction materials for making improvements to her home such as cement, sand, and blocks.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, and blocks for making home improvements.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 4 Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Unidas IV se conformó en el año 2007, y han crecido y aprendido con las diferentes circunstancias positivas y negativas que han podido superar y mejorar como parte de un proceso de crecimiento del comité.
Las señoras son de la ciudad Encarnacion, distante a 40 km. de la oficina de la fundación. Ellas destinan su dinero para diversas actividades en la zona en donde viven.
Actualmente 8 señoras son las que están desde el inicio del comité, otro número de integrantes han rotado para completar el número necesario requerido para la conformación del mismo.
Se sienten muy conformes con el crédito recibido en ciclos anteriores ya que les es de mucha ayuda para seguir adelante con sus actividades.
Renuevan por décima-segunda vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas, donde la directora general, Ramona M. las motiva a que sean puntuales y cumplan con sus responsabilidades.
La sra. Ramona posee una tienda general con cuyos ingresos mantiene a su familia, por eso solicita el préstamo porque como es el único ingreso económico para su familia, desea incrementarlo a través del aumento de las mercaderías y productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
The committee known as “Mujeres Unidas IV” (United Women IV) was established in 2007. The members have grown and learned through different circumstances, both positive and negative, to help them overcome obstacles and improve themselves as part of the growth process for their committee.

These women are from the city of Encarnación, which is 40km away from the office of Fundación Paraguaya. They will use this money for the different business activities that they operate in the area where they live.

There are currently eight ladies who were around when this committee was started. Other members have rotated in and out of the committee in order to reach the required number to maintain a group. The members are pleased with the loans they have received in previous cycles because they have helped them continue with their business activities. They are receiving a loan for the twelfth time. Going into this next cycle, the group maintains an excellent payment history. The group’s General Director, Ramona M., motivates her fellow group members to be prompt and thorough in all of their responsibilities.

Sra. Ramona has a general store that generates income to support her family. She is requesting a loan because this business is the only source of financial income for her family. Ramona wants to increase her inventory and the number of products that she offers.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to restock a general store.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda en donde vende víveres de primera necesidad. Como arroz, granos, enlatados, bebidas etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que desea incrementar la mercadería de la tienda. Trabaja desde muy temprano sola atendiendo la tienda. Quiere seguir trabajando en el futuro por eso quiere comprar mercadería para que su tienda quede más surtida. Con el préstamo desea comprara arroz, bebidas, enlatados etc.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has a small store in which she sells basic necessities such as rice, beans, canned goods, beverages, and other products.

Maria has many aspirations for her business and wants to increase the inventory of merchandise in her store. She begins her work very early and manages the store by herself. Maria wants to continue working in the future and acquire merchandise to keep her store well-stocked. With this loan, she wants to buy rice, beverages, canned goods, and other products.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beverages, canned goods, and other products.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres Nueva Esperanza se conformó en el año 2007, han tomado como experiencia muchas situaciones que les cupo vivir en todos estos años como grupo y equipo para crecer como comité, buscando un objetivo en común “Mejorar el nivel de vida de las integrantes”, además de mejorar como persona.
Las señoras son de la ciudad  de Encarnación, distante a 50 km. de la oficina de la fundación y el destino del crédito es para compra de mercaderías e insumos para su actividad comercial.
Las integrantes están con el ánimo de seguir  retirando el crédito ya que les ayuda en sus emprendimientos, teniendo en cuenta que la zona donde viven hay bastante movimiento comercial y necesitan de capital de trabajo para impulsar sus emprendimientos.
Renuevan por 12va vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas, por el buen acompañamiento de su directora  Mirta A., quien con sacrificio mantiene su producción agrícola y cría de animales en su residencia. Ella las motiva a que sean puntuales y cumplan con sus cuotas para seguir con la línea de crédito.
La sra. Mirta solo desea poder prosperar con el crédito que solicita ya que de ella depende el progreso económico de su familia.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) was established in 2007. This group has experienced many situations over the years that have helped them grow as a committee. They seek to achieve the common objective of “improving the standard of living of the members”. In addition, the members want to improve as people.

The women are from the city of Encarnación, which is 50km from the office of Fundación Paraguaya. This loan will be used to buy merchandise and supplies for their business activities. The members are excited about continuing to receive loans to help them with their ventures. They live in an area where there is significant commercial activity, so they need capital to promote their businesses.

The group is receiving a loan for the twelfth time. They are entering their next loan cycle with an excellent payment history. Mirta A., the group’s director, has made sacrifices to maintain her farm production and raise animals from her home. She encourages the members to complete their payments on time so that they can continue their line of credit.

Sra. Mirta’s only wish is to prosper with the loan she requested since the financial progress of her family depends on her.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for planting crops and raising animals.

loans.name: Violeta Group

texts.es:
Paola forma parte del Banco comunal “Violeta” conformado por 21 emprendedores, que se desempeñan en los rubros de arteS.ía y manualidades, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Paola quién en la foto se encuentra de pie en la primera fila y tercera del lado izquierdo, viste polera negra, además tiene lentes de sol sobre su cabello. Ella realiza todo tipo de arteS.ía y manualidades, específicamente soft (confección de muñecos con algodón y pantys), cartonaje (cosas hechas con cartón), confección de bolsas de tela. Ella trabaja en su casa confeccionando diversas manualidades, todas las tardes. Y las temporadas de más alta demanda son durante los meses de; mayo (día de la madre), septiembre (Fiesta costumbrista chilena) y diciembre (navidad). En estas temporadas Paola se instala con un local en una feria artesanal. El horario laboral es de 10ºº de la mañana a 9ºº de la noche.
Con éste préstamo comprará insumos para sus manualidades, entre éstos telas, blondas y silicona.
El sueño de Paola es tener un local establecido. Es por esto su motivación de seguir en la confección y venta de manualidades ya que pretende mejorar sus ingresos. 
Ella vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 18 y 7 años de edad. Su madre que vive en la ciudad de Santiago, le ayuda en la compra de insumos a precios más convenientes y se los envía a la ciudad de Chillán por encomienda. 
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, ya que son muy amenas, es por esto que además es delegada del Banco comunal. En cuanto al financiamiento que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, éste será un gran aporte para su negocio, ya que con éste podrá invertir y aumentar sus ingresos.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Paola is a member of the Communal Bank “Violeta”, which consists of 21 entrepreneurs who work in arts and crafts. They live in the city of Chilán.

In the photograph, Paola is standing in the second row, third from the left and wearing a black shirt and with a pair of sunglasses in her hair. She produces all types of arts and crafts, especially soft cotton dolls, objects made from cardboard, and cloth bags. Paola works from home, making all types of handicrafts every afternoon. The months in which she has the most demand are May (Mother’s Day), September (traditional Chilean festivals), and December (Christmas). During these times, Paola sets up a stand at the craft fair. Her work schedule is from 10am to 9pm. With this loan she will buy supplies for her handicrafts such as fabrics, lace, and silicone. Paola dreams of having an established shop. For this reason, she is motivated to continue producing and selling her handicrafts so that she can improve her earnings.

Paola lives with her husband and two children, ages 18 and 7. Her mother lives in the city of Santiago and helps her with purchasing supplies at affordable prices. The products are then shipped to her by parcel to the city of Chillán. Paola is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza because she enjoys participating in the meetings because they are very entertaining. For this reason, she has been appointed to be a delegate for her Communal Bank. The funding she has received through Fondo Esperanza has been a great help to her business, since it enables her to invest and increase her income.

Chillán is a community in the central district of southern Chile. Its name means “Window of the Sun” in the Mapudungun language, which is spoken by the Maupuche indigenous people. Chillán is also known as the “Cradle of the Nation” and the “Land of Artists” because many well-known figures in Chile’s history were born there, such as the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: To purchase craft supplies such as fabrics, lace, and silicone.

loans.name: Kusi Killa Group

texts.es:
Blanca es Presidenta del Banco Comunal Kusi Killa, tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos D. 18, 16, 14, 9 y 5 años D. edad. Blanca y su esposo tienen un taller D. artesanías (telares) en el famoso Barrio D. Santa Ana, cuna D. artesanos en Ayacucho, su esposo aprendió D. éste oficio D. sus abuelos, antes se dedicaban a la elaboración D. retablos, pero lo cambiaron por los telares que tienen mas demanda y ahora atienden pedidos.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. materiales como: Lana D. ovino, tintes, leña.
Blanca, con éste, es el segundo ciclo que está en Finca Perú, ingreso por la invitación D. una amiga, le gusta porque pueD. ahorrar ya que en casa no se pueD., aprenD. mucho en la capacitaciones que recibe y pasa momentos gratos con las compañeras D. su banco.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder exportar sus trabajos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Blanca is the president of the Communal Bank “Kusi Killa”. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children (ages 18, 16, 14, 9, and 5). Blanca and her husband have a workshop where they produce woven crafts in the famous neighborhood of Santa Ana, the home of artisans from Ayacucho. Her husband learned this traD. from his grandparents. Blanca and her husband previously maD. altarpieces, but they started weaving because there was more demand for these products. Now they focus on completing their orders.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of materials such as sheep’s wool, dyes, and firewood. Blanca is participating in her second loan cycle with FINCA Peru. She was invited to join by a friend and enjoys being able to save. Blanca has learned much from the training classes she has taken and likes spending time with the other members of her Communal Bank.

Her dreams incluD. growing her business, exporting her products, and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase sheep's wool, dyes, and firewood.

loans.name: Erling

texts.es: Erling, de 31 años, es un hombre luchador, pues hace 7 años falleció su padre. Dejándole así la responsabilidad de la familia. Él vive junto a su mamá Dora y a sus 6 hermanos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Su principal sustento son sus estudios de Topografía; lo que le permite trabajar en las instituciones del estado peruano brindando estudios sobre el área. Pero la actividad que le apasiona es la “agricultura”, donde tiene 6 años de experiencia sembrando café en sus 15 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas; los cuales abona y cuida, los fines de semana con la ayuda de sus hermanos. “Ellos me apoyan en el cuidado de mis cultivos cuando estoy ausente”, afirma. Asimismo se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibe de parte de los socios de la cooperativa de Sanchirio, donde comercializa sus grano de café; porque le apoyan constantemente en las capacitaciones para que el café que siembra sea de mejor calidad.  Ahora desea trabajar con más ahínco para poder obtener más ganancias, y así apoyar en los estudios de sus hermanos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el futuro de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por el apoyo recibido. Erling, invertirá el crédito en la compra de 6 sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en la hectárea de cultivo de café que le falta.
texts.en:
Erling, age 31, is a strong-willed man. Seven years ago, his father passed away so he was left with the responsibility for his family. He lives with his mother Dora and six siblings in their own home in the town of Unión Palomar located in the central Peruvian jungle. His main occupation is that of a topography instructor, which allows him to work with the Peruvian state institutions and teach classes in his field of expertise. However, farming is his passion. Erling has six years of experience growing coffee on fifteen hectares of land. He fertilizes and cares for his crops on the weekends with the help of his siblings. “They help me look after the crops while I’m away,” says Erling. In addition, he is grateful for the support that he has received from the members of the Sanchirio Cooperative where he sells coffee beans. This organization provides training to help farmers produce better quality coffee. Now he wants to work harder in order to earn more income and help his siblings with their education.

Erling is a member of the Communal Bank “Desarrollando Para El Futuro de Prisma” (Developing for the Future of Prisma). This is his first loan with MFP and he is grateful for the support he has received. Erling will invest this loan in the purchase of six sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on one hectare of coffee plants.

loans.use: To purchase six sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on his coffee crop.

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es: Aura Lila de Veintinueve años reside en Somotillo, es madre de 2 hijos que tiene bajo su custodia. Aura encontró en este negocio las necesidades diarias tanto de sus hijos como ella. Razón por la cual encontró en la venta de cosméticos por catalogo una excelente opción de cuidar a sus hijos y hacerse de dinero para costear necesidades básicas de sus vidas. Este es uno de los mejores momentos para invertir pues se acerca la temporada de verano. Con este crédito comprara brillo, pintura de labios, pintura de labios, polvos, cremas, tratamientos, perfumes y lociones a fin de incrementar su inventario y contar con nuevos productos que le piden sus clientes y vecinos a fin de mejorar cada día la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Aura Lila, age 21, resides in Somotillo and is the mother of two children in her custody. She has a business that provides for the daily needs of herself and her children. Aura determined that selling cosmetics was an excellent way to take care of her children and earn money to her cover her basic living necessities. The approaching summer season is one of the best times to invest.

With this loan she will buy lip gloss, lipsticks, powders, crèmes, treatments, perfumes, and lotions to increase her inventory and offer new products that her customers and neighbors request. In this manner, she hopes to improve her quality of life each day.

loans.use: To purchase lip gloss, lipsticks, powders, crèmes, treatments, perfumes, and lotions.

loans.name: Jessica Johanna

texts.es:
Jessica de 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene su propio negocio de comidas en un local. Con dedicación ha podido mantener su negocio estable. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am haciendo platos típicos en los almuerzos que vende hasta las 14h00pm. La ayuda su familia en el negocio ya que tiene muchos clientes y algunos locales que le hacen competencia. Ella quiere continuar trabajando para darle una buena vida a su hijo por eso quiere el préstamo para mejorar su local comprando con el sillas y mesas.
texts.en:
Jessica is 31 years old. This hardworking woman has her own location where she operates a food business. With dedication, she has been able to keep her business stable.

Jessica begins working at 6am to prepare dishes for lunch and then sells them until 2pm. With the help of her family, she is able to serve many customers in her business. There are other shops that provide competition. Jessica wants to continue working so that she can give her son a good life. She wants to use this loan to improve her shop by purchasing chairs and tables.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, de 34 años; se separó hace 9 meses de su esposo. A pesar de su tristeza, ella continúa trabajando por sus 2 hijos: Fernando y Sandra; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La actividad a la que se dedica es la siembra de café y plátanos; en sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos propios, situados en la zona alta de su comunidad. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo pudo obtener ganancias seguras, pues vende sus granos en la cooperativa de Sanchirio Palomar, asimismo cuenta que en temporadas de gran cosecha los mismos intermediarios llegan a su chacra para comercializar sus cultivos íntegros. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en el campo, “odio el bullicio de la ciudad”, afirma. Por el futuro de sus hijos, pues en ellos invierte la mayor cantidad de su ganancia, está pensando incrementar la expansión de sus terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el futuro de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta por la oportunidad de desarrollo que le brindan. Patricia, se está preparando para la cosecha de café. Por ello cuenta que con el crédito, está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico para que no realice el proceso de paleo (extracción de la planta de café por sobreproducción de granos de café, evitando que la próxima cosecha sea de baja calidad); asimismo en la compra de canastas y costales para la cosecha.
texts.en:
Patricia, age 34, separated from her husband nine months ago. Despite her sadness she continues work on behalf of her two children, Fernando and Sandra, and take care of them from her home in Unión Palomar, which is located in the central Peruvian jungle. Patricia grows coffee and bananas on three hectares of farmland that she owns in the upper district of her community. She already has eight years of experience and has been able to generate steady income throughout that time. Patricia sells her coffee beans at the Sanchirio Palomar Cooperative, but whenever she has a large harvest, she will also sell to brokers who come to her farm so that they can buy coffee directly from her. What she enjoys most about her work is being able to spend the bulk of her time in the field. “I hate the bustle of the city,” says Patricia. She plans to invest a large portion of her earnings in the acquisition of more farmland so that she can provide for her children’s future.

Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank “Desarrollnado Para El Futuro de Prisma” (Developing for the Future of Prisma). This is her first loan with MFP. She is pleased to be given the opportunity to develop. Patricia is preparing for the coffee harvest, so she will use this loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer to prevent her coffee plants from overproducing, which can result in low quality beans during the next harvest. In addition, she will purchase baskets and sacks for collecting the coffee beans during the harvest.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers, baskets, and sacks for collecting coffee beans.

loans.name: Camino De Victoria 4 Group

texts.en:
Zenaida is the coordinator of her group, Camino D. Victoria 4 (Road to Victory). She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to have her own business. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy watching television.

Zenaida is excited to be taking her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying sandals, slippers and jewels. She will use the profits for savings because the family needs to build a house and her husband's income only provides for basic expenses. Zenaida dreams of having her own home, in a good structure, safe and beautiful, and thanks to her business and to Esperanza loans, she hopes that her dream will become reality.

This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted her business to succeed. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Santiago.

loans.use: to buy sandals, slippers and jewels

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Maria Rosa tiene 50 años D. edad, es separada y tiene 2 hijos menores. Vive en el distrito D. Olmos, en la provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo. DesD. hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta D. comida y bebidas. Cuenta con un puesto pequeño en el parque D. su comunidad. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más insumos. También, desea comprar suministros escolares para sus hijos menores ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 500 nuevos soles. Maria es muy trabajadora y responsable. Posee buenas referencias personales y laborales D. su comunidad urbana. Ha manejado otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones D. manera puntual.
texts.en: Maria Rosa is 50 years old, separated, and has two dependent children.  She lives in Olmos district, in Lambayeque province, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.  For 2 years she has been selling meals and drinks.  She has a small stall in her local park.  She is very well known in the area and has an established and loyal customer base.  Maria would like to expand her business by purchasing more supplies.  She would also like to buy school supplies for her children now that the school year has begun in Peru.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Maria is very hard working and responsible.  She has good personal references and work references from her community.  She has received previous loans and maD. her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for making her meals and to buy school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, perfume, dresses, bags, footwear, creams and other products

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Viven en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande. Ésta es una zona agrícola que se encuentra en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuentan con servicios básicos como luz o agua potable.

Desde hace más de 4 años, Juan se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, el cual cría de edades menores y cuando los animales alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo, los vende en el mercado local. En adición, cultiva y mantiene limón, el cual cría, engorda y cosecha semanalmente para luego comercializarlos también en el mercado local. Realiza estas actividades, con la apoya de su esposa, en una parte posterior de su casa.

Desea invertir su crédito en alimentos balanceados para el engorde de su ganado y en abonos para el cultivo de limón. Espera lograr un buen peso y tamaño de sus animales y productos para venderlos a un mejor precio y  seguir creciendo en su actividad. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles. Juan es una mujer muy trabajador. Su esposa y él trabajan juntos para seguir adelante y lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 59, is married and has 3 children.  They live in their own house in the rural part of the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area in Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.  There are no basic services such as electricity nor potable water there.
For the last 4 years Juan has raised cattle.  He raises them from the time they are young and when the animals are well-developed, he sells them in the local market.  Also, he grows limes.  When they are ripe, he picks them weekly to sell in the local market as well.  His wife helps him,  and they have the cattle and lime trees behind their house.

He wants to buy balanced food to fatten his cattle, and fertilizer for the lime cultivation.  Juan is hoping to have his cattle reach a good weight and size.  He also  wants his other products to increase in size so that he can sell them at a better price and have his business grow.  That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 700 new sols.  Juan is a hard-working man and he and his wife work together to continue getting ahead and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy balanced food for his cattle and fertilizer for his lime trees.

loans.name: Pablo Victor

texts.es:
Pablo Victor T. S., es soltero, tiene 19 años de edad, es agronomo, se dedica a la agronomía, tiene 3 años de experiencia trabajando para otra persona, y ahora quiere empezar su propio bibero, por esa razon solicita un prèstamo a ASDIR, para poder comprar semillas, sembrar estos para que puedan germinar y crecer para poder venderlos cuando hayan crecido. Quiere cultivar flores y mora. 

Epera que con el credito pueda mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia, ya que es en su propio negocio donde quiere invertir.
texts.en: Pablo Victor T. S. is single.  He is 19 years old and an agronomist.  He has three years experience working for another person and now he would like to start his own nursery.  He is requesting a loan from ASDIR to buy seeds.  He will sow his seeds so that they can germinate and grow.  He will then sell them when they have grown.  Pablo would like to grow flowers and blackberries.  He hopes that this loan will help to improve his family's living conditions.  He would like to invest in his own business.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo menor. Viven en Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. Las principales actividades que se realizan en este caserío son la producción de flores, la artesanía y la crianza de ganado vacuno. La zona está llena de vegetación y la comunidad es muy pequeña. 

Desde hace 6 años, Bertha se dedica a la ganadería. Realiza esta actividad en la parte trasera de su vivienda en un establo donde cría vacas lecheras. Ella cuenta con dos vacas que le genera ingresos por la venta de leche. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en alimentos balanceados para su ganado. De esta manera, puede aumentar la producción de leche. Ya que el precio de este producto lácteo ha disminuido, necesita compensarlo con un aumento en la producción. Bertha ha manejado otro préstamo con Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones de manera puntual. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por darle la oportunidad de mejorar su crianza de ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
Bertha, age 51, is married and has one minor child. They live in Monsefú, an area known for its tourist and religious festivals. The principal businesses carried out in this village are flower production, handicrafts, and raising cattle. The area is heavily vegetated, and the community is very small.

For 6 years, Bertha has been raising cattle. She carries out this business at the rear of her dwelling in a barn where she raises dairy cows. She has two cows that generate income through the sale of milk.

Bertha has applied for a loan of 2000 new soles to invest in balanced feed for her cattle. In this way she will be able to increase her milk production. Since the price of dairy products has fallen she needs to compensate for this by increasing production.

Bertha has had another loan with Epydme Altermativa and has fulfilled all her obligations punctually. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her the opportunity of improving her cattle raising operation.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, de 52 años; convive hace 9 años con Felicia, con quien tiene una hija Joselin. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en ciudad de Tarma. Según menciona se casa dentro de 15 días. Desde hace 28 años comenzó a trabajar en una empresa de trasporte público, como chofer, trasportando a los pobladores del lugar a diferentes ciudades. En ese tiempo sufrió un accidente quedando lisiado, ahora está tramitando su pensión por tiempo de servicio. Según menciona,  en este tiempo de crisis la persona que la ayudado en los gasto del hogar, fue su esposa. Pues ella se dedica en la venta de cuyes y chanchos, en donde primero los alimenta y cuando llegan a un peso exacto, son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, obteniendo una ganancia de S/. 400 soles por venta. Su principal problema son los gatos que paga mensualmente el colegio donde estudia su hija. Por ello, ahora que no trabaja, está pensando incursionar en la fabricación de comida balanceada con el molino que posee, elaborando harina de quinua, maca, soya y demás. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera concretar sus objetivos. Arturo, dará el primer paso para su negocio invirtiendo el crédito en la compra de morocho por kilos, para comenzar a trabajar y procesarla en su molino.
texts.en: Arturo, who is 52 years old, has lived with his partner, Felicia, for 9 years.  They have one daughter, Joselin. They live together in their own home in the city of Tarma.  Arturo tells us that he will be married in 2 weeks.  Twenty-eight years ago, he began working in a public transportation company as a driver.  He would bring the residents of the area to different cities.  During this time, he was in an accident that left him disabled.  He is now arranging his pension for the time that he worked.  He tells us that during this time of crisis, the person who helped with the household expenses was his wife.  She makes her living selling guinea pigs and pigs.  First she feeds them, and when they reach a specific weight, they are sold in the wholesale market in the city.  She earns 400 PEN per sale.  Arturo's main problem is the monthly expense of the school his daugther attends.  Because of that expense and because he is not currently working, he is planning to get into the business of making health food with the mill that he has.  He wants to make quinoa, maca (a radish-like root), soy and other flours.  Arturo belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Muruhuay”, and this is his third loan with MFP, with which he hopes to make his plans into reality.  Arturo will take the first step for his business by investing the loan in the purchase of corn by the kilo to start working and processing it on his mill.

loans.use: to purchase corn by the kilo to process and make into corn flour.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 1 Group

texts.en:
Maricela´s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Even her parents were Haitians. She was born in the Dominican Republic in a very rural community surrounded with sugarcane fields. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. 

Maricela is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Luchadoras 1 (Fighting Women). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and six children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build a house. Now she pays rent. She operates a miscellaneous product store (general store). 

Maricela is excited to take out her fourth loan through Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan to help grow her business. She has been in business for almost 16 years. Maricela plans to use this loan to buy clothes like pants and t-shirts, cosmetics, shoes, and especially women's apparel.

She will use her profits to save for her future home. She is working hard to build a safe house and hopefully make her dream come true. Maricela wants to have a store and pay her loans back.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, t-shirts and other items

loans.name: Fiorela Melina

texts.es:
Fiorela tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de su abuela en la ciudad de Picsi, una pequeña comunidad urbana-marginal en vías de crecimiento. Cuenta con una bodega instalada en su casa donde vende abarrotes, verduras y carnes diariamente. Durante algunas temporadas, también vende ropa y zapatos. Realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 5 años cuando ayudaba a su abuela en el negocio para luego tomar las riendas como titular. Ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú, desea invertir su crédito en la compra de suministros escolares como papelotes, cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, laminas, carpetas plastificadas, tintes, gomas, plastilinas, grapadoras, y perforadores. Esta inversión la ayudará a tener más variedad de productos en su negocio lo cual incrementará sus ventas. El mercado de Picsi es muy bueno ya que está constituido por ciudadanos de la localidad como de los pueblos aledaños. 

Fiorela es muy trabajadora y responsable. Goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales manifestadas por clientes y vecinos en su comunidad. Ha manejado otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Fiorela is 21 years old and single.  She lives in her grandmother's home in the town of Picsi: a small, poor, urban community which is currently expanding.  Fiorela has a grocery store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and meat every day.  During some seasons she also sells clothes and shoes.  Fiorela has been in this business for more than 5 years.  She used to help her grandmother in the business and then took the reins as owner of the business.

Now that the school year has begun in Peru, Fiorela would like to invest her loan in buying school supplies such as stationery, exercise books, pencil sharpeners, books, wall charts, plastic folders, dyes, glue, plasticine, staplers and hole punchers.  This investment will help her to have a greater variety of products available in her business which will increase her sales.  The market in Picsi is very good since it is made up of local residents as well as residents from neighboring villages.

Fiorela is a very hard-working and responsible woman.  She has taken previous loans and made her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel tiene 53 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad. El señor tiene un taller de carpintería ubicado en su casa de habitación en el cual elabora puertas, sillas, comedores. Don Miguel dio inicio a su negocio hace 15 años, el señor se dedicaba a esta actividad desde su niñez pues fue por su hermano que aprendió el oficio. Cuando dio inicio el señor no tenía muchas herramientas y fue con el tiempo que empezó a hacerse de  su capital para comprar tanto madera como sus artículos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima como madera, junco, maque, alcohol, tela, herramientas, para cumplir compromisos de pedidos que actualmente tienen pendientes.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel, age 53, is married and has three adult children. He has a carpentry workshop located in his house in which he makes doors, chairs, and dining room sets. Don Miguel began his business 15 years ago. He has been involved in carpentry since childhood. He learned the trade from his brother.

When he began, Don Miguel didn’t have many tools. With the passage of time, he began to build up the capital needed to buy the wood required for his products. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, reeds, lacquer, alcohol, cloth, and tools in order to meet commitments for orders that are currently pending.

loans.use: to purchase wood, reeds, lacquer, alcohol, cloth and tools.

loans.name: Magaly Aurora

texts.es: Magaly tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Pacora en Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Cría los animales en un terreno cerca de su domicilio y cuando estos alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimentos balanceados. Desea obtener un mejor peso y tamaño de sus animales para venderlos a un mejor precio. Con esta inversión, podrá incrementar sus ingresos y seguir solventando sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en: Magaly is 39 years old, is single and has one son.  She lives in her own house in the rural area of Pacora District in Lambayeque. For more than 10 years she has made her living raising and selling small animals.  She raises the animals on a plot of land near her home.  When the animals reach are sufficiently developed, she offers them for sale to the general public and to businessmen who tend to visit the area where she lives.  Magaly has an established customer base in the area.  She learned her business from her father, which is to say that she knows her line of work perfectly.  She hopes to expand her business with the purchase of more animals and more feed.  She wants her animals to get to a better weight and size to be able to sell them for a better price.  With the investment, she will be able to increase her earnings and continue meeting her household expenses.  That is why she believed it would be advisable to request a loan of 800 PEN ($300 USD) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 36 años; vive en concubinato con Isaías. Ambos tiene 3 hijos: Jordy, Jordan y Wilson. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Hace 20 años que se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arveja, habas y papa en sus terrenos propios ubicados en el caserío de Anispampa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el apoyo que recibe de parte de su esposo.”Cuando cosecho mis sembríos, mi esposo sale a vender los sacos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma”, menciona. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, y conejos; los cuales vende a los pobladores de su localidad cuando lo solicitan. Además de dedicarse al negocio de compra y venta de maíz, también los vender por unidad. Su principal dificultad, es la falta de capital, pues cosecha y siembra constantemente; invirtiendo en el mantenimiento constante de sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente gustosa de poder aportar en el desarrollo de su asociación. Julia, comprará con el crédito 3 cosechas de maíz; los cuales comercializará por unidad en el mercado mayorista.
texts.en:
Julia is 36 years old and lives with her common-law husband Isaías.  They have 3 children: Jordy, Jordan and Wilson.  The family lives together in their own home which is located in the village of Bellavista Huaracayo.  Julia has been growing corn, peas, beans and potatoes on her own land, which is located in the village of Anispampa, for 20 years.  What she most likes about her work is the support that she receives from her husband.  "When I harvest my crops, my husband takes the sacks to sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma," she says.  Julia also raises animals such as guinea pigs and rabbits which she sells to people in her village when they request them.  As well as working in her business buying and selling corn, she also sells these products by the unit.  The main difficulty that she faces is a lack of capital since she sows and harvests constantly, and invests in constantly maintaining her crops.

Julia is a member of the "Señor de Muruhuay" community bank and this is her eighth loan with MFP.  She feels glad to be able to help in the development of the association.  Julia will use her loan to buy three harvests of corn which she will then sell by the unit in the wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy three harvests of corn which she will then sell by the unit

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es: Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente. Viven en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 5 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, en especial las ovejas. Cría los animales en un terreno cerca de su domicilio y cuando estos alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimentos balanceados. Desea obtener un mejor peso y tamaño de sus animales para venderlos a un mejor precio. Con esta inversión, podrá incrementar sus ingresos y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. También piensa en usar una parte de su crédito para la compra de prendas de vestir para su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old; she is single and has one dependent son. They live in the district of Las Lomas -- an agricultural area located in the Piura province, more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For more than five years, Rosa has been raising and commercializing farm animals, especially sheep. She raises her livestock in a yard near her house, and when they reach a good level of development, she offers them for sale to general public as well as to the merchants that visit the area where she lives.

Rosa has an established client base in the neighborhood. She would like to expand her business by purchasing more animals and balanced animal feed. She would also like to increase the size and weight of her animals in order to be able to sell them at a better price. 

This investment will allow Rosa to increase her income and to keep investing in her business; she is also thinking of using a part of her loan to purchase clothing for her family. For these reasons, Rosa has decided to seek a loan of 700 soles (Peruvian currency) from  Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals and balanced animal feed

loans.name: María Tarcila

texts.es:
María tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío San Pablo  que esta a 8km de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas, las cuales cría en un corral cercado en un terreno cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 20 años por ello conoce a la perfección este rubro, contando con clientela fidelizada. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda  a su esposo para sacar adelante a su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old, married, and lives together with her family in the village of San Pablo, 8km from the town of Tambogrande.  This is an agricultural district which is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

María raises and sells sheep.  She raises them in an enclosed pen on a plot of land near her home.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the general public and to the traders who visit her area.  María has been in this business for more than 20 years and therefore knows this line of work to perfection and has a loyal customer base.  She uses the income that she makes in her business to help her husband get their family ahead in life.

María would like to expand her business, buying more animals and balanced feed, so that she can increase her sales and improve her quality of life.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 30 años, es una mujer muy feliz; pues vive junto a su esposo Freddy con quien tiene 2 hijos: Brayan y Cielo, en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Cachunayo. Desde sus cortos 18 años comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de arvejas, maíz y demás hortalizas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el apoyo que recibe de su esposo, pues le ayuda en los constantes cuidados que le brinda a sus sembríos. Además de tener los terrenos cerca al río lo cual le beneficia en el crecimiento inmediato de sus cultivos. “Ahora estoy en la cosecha de maíz, donde obtendré buenas ganancias”, afirma. Su principal problema es no tener dinero para los estudios de su hijo mayor, pues comenzó a estudiar y ahora minimiza los gastos de mantenimiento de sus cultivos. Por ello más adelante está pensando comprar su propia casa, y de esa manera aliviar los gastos de arriendo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el noveno préstamo con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe. Luzmila, sembró arveja en sus 5 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas; por ello con el crédito comprará 5 sacos de abono orgánico, para esparcirlo entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 30 years old.  She is a very happy woman who lives with her husband Freddy and their 2 children: Brayan and Cielo, in a rental house which is located in the town of Cachunayo.  Luzmila has been farming since she was just 18.  Her main crops are peas, corn and other vegetables.  What she most likes about her work is the support that she receives from her husband since he helps her to constantly care for her crops.  Luzmila's land is near the river which benefits her in that her crops grow immediately. "Right now I am harvesting my corn which will make me good profits", she says.  Luzmila's main problem is not having money for her eldest son's studies since he has started school and now she minimizes the money she puts into maintaining her crops.  For this reason, she is planning to buy her own house in the future so that she can reduce the money she pays out in rent.

Luzmila is a member of the "Señor de Muruhuay" community bank and this is her ninth loan with MFP.  She feels grateful for the support that she receives.  Luzmila has sown peas on her 5 hectares of farmland.  She will use her loan to buy 5 sacks of organic manure to spread over her crops.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Zoila Ysabel

texts.es: Zoila tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de edad escolar. Viven en la ciudad de Picsi, una pequeña comunidad urbana-marginal en vías de crecimiento. Desde hace más de 5 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa y zapatos. Dirige el negocio desde su hogar donde cuenta con una vitrina para colocar y guardar sus productos. Sus clientes le hacen pedidos y ella sale a recorrer y concretar sus ventas para luego realizar sus compras. Cuenta con una base de clientes establecida y fiel. Solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para ampliar su mercadería con la compra de zapatos de varón y dama para vender durante esta temporada escolar. Gracias a este préstamo, Zoila pretende elevar el volumen de sus ventas como el número de clientes a los cuales no solo se les ofrecerá zapatos sino la variedad de productos que ella vende. El mercado de Picsi es muy apropiado para este tipo de negocio porque Zoila beneficia no solo de los clientes en su propia comunidad sino de los de los pueblos aledaños. Es muy conocida en la zona y goza de muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Zoila is 31 years old, married and has two school age children.  They live in the city of Picsi, a small, growing community on the urban border.  For the last 5 years she has been making a living buying and reselling clothing and shoes.  She runs her business from her home where she has a display cabinet to show and keep her products.  Her customers place orders and she goes around and affirms her sales to then be able to do her purchasing.  She has an established and faithful client base.  She is requesting a loan of 1000 new soles to increase her merchandise with the purchase of shoes for women and men to be sold during the school season.  Thanks to this loan, Zoila can increase the number of sales and customers to whom she will offer not only shoes but also the variety of other products that she sells.  The market in Picsi is very good for this type of business because it not only benefits from customers from the community but also from the nearby towns.  She is well know in the area and enjoys good personal and work related references.

loans.use: to purchase school shoes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
Maria tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos dependientes. Viven en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque

Desde hace más de 12 años, María tiene un Bar – Picantería, un establecimiento donde vende comida, piqueos y bebidas como cerveza, chicha y gaseosas. El negocio se encuentra en su propio domicilio. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en más envases de cervezas, mesas y sillas para su local. Con esta inversión, pretende incrementar sus ingresos para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y poder solventar sus gastos familiares. María les agradece mucho a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old, single, and has two dependent children.  They live in Tambogrande district, an agricultural area which is located in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

María has owned a bar-restaurant for more than 12 years.  She sells meals and snacks, and drinks such as beer, 'chicha' (a corn-based drink) and soda.  Her business is located in her home.  Maria is very well known in her area and she has regular and loyal customers.

María has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to invest in buying more bottles of beer, as well as tables and chairs for her premises.  With this investment, she plans to increase her income so that she can continue investing in her business and cover her family expenses.  María is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support in growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottles of beer, as well as tables and chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso tiene 51 años de edad y es casado. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos en la provincia de Lambayeque, situado a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace varios años, se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. También se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. Cría los animales menores y cuando alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en los mercados locales. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.

Ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa  para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. También planea comprar alimentos balanceados para sus animales para que puedan lograr mejor tamaño y peso. De esta manera, podrá venderlos a mejores precios. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ganancias para poder solventar sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Narciso is 51 years old and married.  He lives in his own home which is located in Olmos district, in Lambayeque province, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For several years, Narciso has been providing a passenger transport service in his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle which consists of a motorbike with a cabin in back inside which he transports passengers).  He also raises and sells cattle.  He raises young animals and, when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale in local markets.  He learned this business from his father, which is to say that he knows this work inside out.

Narciso has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can have some maintenance work and repair work done on his motorcycle taxi.  He needs to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he can continue offering a good service to his customers.  Narciso also plans to use his loan to buy balanced feed for his animals so that they can achieve a better size and weight.  This will enable him to sell them for a better price.  With the help of this loan, Narciso hopes to increase his profits so that he can cover his family expenses.

loans.use: to fix his motorcycle taxi and buy balanced feed for his cattle

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Francia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) 2 & 3. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children in a safe environment. She has been able to improve their environment after being in business and providing what her spouse can´t, such as a better standard of living, better home structure, clothing and many other small changes. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy dancing.

Francia buys and sells new and used clothing, this has been her business for over 3 and a half years, which she started with some money she received from previous employment. She is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her prior loan and grown her business. 

She plans to use this loan to invest further in her business. She will use the profits to increase her sales and to make her business grow, while she is saving to make one of her dreams come true (to become a lawyer), and others like to have a store and to guide her children into professional lives.

Her group is part of a biggest group formed in her rural community for them to do business and take big changes into her neighborhood, located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industry.

The town’s main economic activity revolves around a free trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Pictures were taken during the disbursal process in a meeting in one of the associate's home. That why we decided to take the photos while they were sitting.

loans.use: to buy different apparel for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his merchandise (fish)

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda, de 52 años, se separó de su esposo hace 2 años. Pero trabaja arduamente para educar a sus 2 hijos. En su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Desde que tenía 18 años comenzó su camino en la siembra de arveja, maíz y papa, en sus terrenos propios y arrendados a las afueras de la localidad. En todo este tiempo pudo obtener buenos compradores en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, quienes le pagan muy bien por sus cosechas; con el tiempo comenzó a llevar sus productos a la capital del país. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder negociar sus cosechas. “Cuando se trabaja a tiempo completo y con mucha inteligencia, se obtiene muchas ganancias”, menciona. Su principal problema es el pago de los estudios de sus menores hijos, como también en el pago del arrendamiento de sus terrenos agrícolas. Ahora ella desea obtener su propio capital de dinero para poder invertir con más facilidad en las cosechas de los diferentes productos que constantemente siembra. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta por el trabajo de presidenta que desempeña. Herlinda, sembrará un promedio de 30 sacos de papa, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con éxito su nuevo sembrío.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 52 years old.  She separated from her husband 2 years ago but works hard to educate her two children.  Herlinda lives in her own home which is located in the small village of Bellavista Huaracayo.

Herlinda started growing peas, corn and potatoes at the age of 18, on her own land and on rented land, on the outskirts of her village.  During this time, she has been able to obtain good buyers in the wholesale market in Tarma who pay her very well for her harvests.  Over time, she started taking her products to the country's capital.

What Herlinda most enjoys about her work is being able to negotiate her harvests.  "When you work full time and intelligently, you make good profits", she says.  Herlinda's main problem is paying for her children's studies and paying the rent on her farmland.  She would like to obtain her own capital in order to be able to invest more easily in her harvests of the different products that she constantly grows.

Herlinda is a member of the “Señor de Muruhuay” community bank and this is her ninth loan from MFP.  She feels very happy with her work as the president of her community bank.  Herlinda will sow an average of 30 sacks of potatoes.  She will use this loan to buy several sacks of organic manure so that she can start off her new crop successfully.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: La señora Dora se dedica a vender mercadería en general. Ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, sus esfuerzos de sacar a su hijo adelante es su prioridad  por lo que fue su motivación con este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante y su vivienda. Ella inicio este negocio debido a la necesidad de mantenerse porque buscaba trabajo y no encontraba, y con mucho sacrificio tenía que encontrar la forma de mejorar su condición. Por lo que así logro dedicarse obteniendo muy buenos resultados. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercaderías tales como cremas, perfumes, ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, bolsas y ropa en general, ya que se acerca la temporada de verano. Ella posee el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora earns her living by selling general merchandise. She has one son in her care, and her main motivation in running her business is to be able to provide for him. 

Dora sells various items both as a street vendor and from her home. She started this business because she looked for a job but was not able to find one,  and with a lot of personal sacrifice she has found a way to improve her living standards. 

With this business, Dora found an occupation for herself and has achieved good results. The loan will be invested into the purchase of inventory such as creams, perfume, pants, underwear, shirts, bags, and clothing in general -- given that the summer season is already at hand. Dora also has a dream to improve the living conditions in her home.

loans.use: to purchase creams, perfume, pants, shirts, bags and clothing in general

loans.name: Kerly  Tatiana

texts.es:
Kerly  tiene  21  años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el caserío de Las Monicas ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. Realiza esta actividad hace 1 año, teniendo clientela  establecida. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Kerly desea adquirir más productos de belleza y así ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido. Para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Kerly is 21 years old and single.  She lives together with her parents in the small village of Las Monicas, in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area which is located in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Kerly's business is selling cosmetics through a catalog.  She sells these products to her neighbors and friends.  She works hard every day to attract more customers since the more orders she makes, the more income she makes from the company that supplies the products.  She has been in this business for 1 year and has an established customer base.  Her business helps her to cover her personal expenses and support her parents with their household finances.

Kerly would like to acquire more beauty products and thereby expand her business, setting up a sales location for selling her cosmetics in her home.  This will mean that she will have products to hand and her customers won't have to wait until the end of the month which is when her orders arrive.  For this reason, she needs to acquire more products and, in order to achieve her goal, she has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of school supplies, such as books, backpacks, notebooks, and uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some chairs and planks to use as tables for her business

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de comida. Pero su especialidad es vender “tripita” es un plato con tripas de vaca y ensaladas (muy común en Ecuador). 

Empezó a vender tripita con su mama poco a poco ella fue incursionando en el mercado de las comidas, hasta que ahora tiene su propio negocio. Trabaja desde las 15h00pm hasta las 19h00pm. Trasporta todos los días la comida hasta el Recreo un sitio muy transitado por la gente para vender a un mayor volumen. Para seguir con su negocio y darle una buena vida a su hijo ella quiere construir mejor su casa comprando con el prestamo cemento, arena, bloques.
texts.en:
Flor, 28 years old, is a hard working woman who has a food sales business.  Her specialty is the sale of "tripita", which is a dish made with cow intestines, and salads ( very common in Ecuador).

She started selling tripita with her mother and slowly she began to penetrate the food market and now she has her own business.  She works from 3 pm until 7 pm.  Every day she transports her food to the Recreo, a place with a lot of people traffic, where she can sell more quantities.  To be able to continue with her business and give a good life to her son, she wants to improve her house by using the loan to buy cement, sand and brick.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic wares

loans.name: Marina Filomena

texts.es:
Marina de 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora que por el largo tiempo de su vida a podido especializarse en la costura y confección. Poco a poco con dedicación ha mantenido su taller de confección en una parte de su casa.  

Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano para terminar los pedidos que le piden. Hace camisas, pantalones, conjuntos etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando pero para ello y tener más ingresos necesita el préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser marca overlot, telas, hilos.
texts.en:
Marina is 55 years old. She is a hard-working woman who has developed the craft of sewing and tailoring over the long years of her life. Little by little, and with dedication, she has been running a sewing workshop in a part of her home.

Marina works every day, starting early in the morning, to finish the orders that her customers place. She makes shirts, pants, outfits, etc. Marina has a lot of aspirations for her business, and she would like to keep working, but in order to do that and to increase her income, she needs to purchase an overlock sewing machine, thread, and fabric.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, thread, fabric

loans.name: Miriam Patricia

texts.es:
Miriam de 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es comerciante de artículos plásticos. Trabaja desde muy temprano con la ayuda de sus hijos. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con sus ventas por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar artículos plásticos como bandejas, jarras, vasos etc. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando para generar más ingresos y ayudar a su esposo que es taxista y así con dos ingresos darle una buena vida a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Miriam, 45 years old, is a hard-working woman who sells plastic articles.  She works from very early in the morning with the aid of her children.

Miriam has many aspirations concerning her sales.  That is why she wants the loan -- to buy plastic articles such as trays, pitchers, glasses, etc.  In the future, Miriam wants to work hard to generate more income and help her husband, who drives a taxi, and thus, with two incomes, to offer a good life to their 3 children.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TRAYS, GLASSES, AND PITCHERS TO SELL

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Maria Del Trancito es una mujer casada de 42 años que vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos los clientes de Maria en su totalidad están ubicados en lugares cercanos de la ciudad ella se traslada caminando con facilidad y aprovecha para mostrar a ciertas personas que caminan ambulante. Su sueño es tener un mejor inventario ara ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Su mayor desafío es la competencia a la que con su experiencia ha logrado controlar, por eso siempre está en la búsqueda de nuevos mercados, así como también de buenos precios. Solicita este crédito como lápiz labial, cremas, perfumes, bolsos, ropa interior y cosméticos en general.
texts.en: Maria Del Trancito is 42 years old and married. She lives with her partner and their four children. For the last 3 years she has worked selling cosmetics. All of Maria's customers are located in areas near the city and she gets around easily on foot while taking advantage to show her products to passers-by. Her dream is to have a larger inventory to offer variety to her customers. He greatest challenge is her competition, which with her experience she has managed to control and which is why she is always in search of new markets and good prices. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of lipstick, creams, perfumes, bags, underwear and general cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, creams, perfumes, bags, underwear and general cosmetics.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel C. H. inicio el negocio de carpintería por herencia familiar su papa le enseño la labor de carpintero desde muy niño,a partir de esa fecha viene realizando esta actividad es casado su esposa se dedica a su casa tienen dos hijos que están en edad escolar presentan buenas referencias personales por parte de amistades su sueño a futuro es construir su casa de material noble esta solicitando el crédito para comprar materiales para su carpintería que son tablas clavos  pegamento entre otros para realizar sus trabajos y brinde un mejor servicio a sus clientes es por ello que se propone el crédito.
texts.en: Miguel Ángel C. H. inherited his carpentry business from his family.  His dad taught him the trade and he has been in the business ever since.  Miguel is married and his wife takes care of their home.  They have two school-age children.  Miguel has good personal references from his friends.  His dream for the future is to build his house from solid construction materials.  He is requesting this loan to buy materials for his carpentry business: planks, nails, adhesives, etc, so that he can carry out his work.

loans.use: To purchase materials (planks & nails among others) for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Liliana Penigna

texts.es: La srta Liliana Q. Gavilán es soltera sin hijos,vieve a quince minutos del centro de la ciudad y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos iniciando el negocio en mayo del dos mil diez debido a la falta de trabajo que la aquejaba, anteriormente trabajaba con su tía en un negocio familiar de venta de comida, ella estudio Derecho y Ciencias Policticas en la universidad de su ciudad, actualmente esta haciendo sus practicas profesionales como abogada en un  estudio jurídico; su sueño a futuro es implementar su negocio mejorando la cantidad y calidad de su mercaderia para satisfacer a sus clientes para poderse comprar una casa que es su principal necesidad a la fecha,ella es muy conocida en su zona contando con muy buenas referencias personales es por ello que se propone el credito.
texts.en: Miss Liliana Q. Gavilán is single without children. She lives 15 minutes from the center of the city and works in cosmetic sales. She began the business in May 2010.  Previously, she worked with her aunt in a family business of food sales. She studied law and political science at the university in her city. She is currently practicing law.  Her dream for the future is to implement her business improving the quantity and quality of her merchandise to satisfy her clients. She would like to purchase a home. She is very well known in her area and has very good personal references, and this is why she is being offered the credit.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: La señora Benedicta es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que son mayores e independientes  tiene una pequeña bodega donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, frutas, carnes verduras entre otras cosas, ella inicio el negocio hace 6 años con un pequeño capital que logro reunir con el apoyo de sus hijos. tiene su bodega en pampa de villa Curi, una localidad que se encuentra a quince minutos del centro de la ciudad de ICA, tiene buenos ingresos y sus clientes son fijos, el problema que enfrenta a diario es que tiene que trasladarse hasta el mercado el cual se encuentra lejos de su vivienda, su sueño a futuro es adquirir un vehiculo que le permita movilizarse con mayor rapidez, con el dinero comprara mercadería de primera necesidad para  vender en su bodega  tales como arroz azúcar leches aceites entre otras cosa y hacer crecer su negocio para que le genere mas ingresos, benedicta esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: Mrs. Benedicta O. S. is a single mother with three grown children who sells groceries. She has a small store where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oils, fruits, meats, and vegetables among other. She started her business six years ago with the savings of her children and has her store in Pampa de Villacuri, located 15 minutes from the city of Ica. She has a good income and her customers are loyal. The problem she confronts is that she has to travel each day to her store, which is located far from her home. Her dream for the future is to buy herself a vehicle to transport her merchandise. She will invest this loan in further setting up her store and helping her business to grow so that it generates more income. Benedicta is very appreciative for the support she is being offered.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Noemi Floresca's Group

texts.en:
Noemi F. is from the village of Almaguer South Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Noemi is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Noemi F.'s Group.

Noemi is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Noemi operates a direct-selling business, providing AVON cosmetics and apparel products in the local community. Noemi has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Noemi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noemi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Noemi is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Noemi from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Precy's Group

texts.en:
Precy M. is from the village of Simmimbaan. She is 47 years old. Precy is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Precy M. Group.

Precy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Precy runs a general store where she sells a variety of products in the local community. Precy has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Precy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Precy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Precy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lilia M. owns a sari-sari store.  She is 48 years old, married, and a resident of Barangay Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she operates a sari-sari store and sells snacks. For 10 years, she was able to maintain her business even in hard times.  Now, she is earning an average net income of not less than P10,000.  This amount is so helpful for Mrs. M. and for her family. 

Mrs. M. joined PAGLAUM MPC in 2008 because she was interested in the organization's products and services.
