As part of Mrs. M.'s 10th loan cycle, she was given the privilege of obtaining the amount of P25,000 to add her capital for her existing sari-sari store and snack vending business. The future income from this business will be used for her daily basic needs, loan repayments and savings for the future. She is hoping that someday she will be able to expand her little stall and also to improve her business.

loans.use: to provide additional capital for her sari-sari store and snack vending

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental, Minda

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is 38 years old and married.  She has five children, four of whom go to school.  

Her business is selling clothes and food.  Her husband washes clothes for a living.  Mary's future goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, muken, onions and beans

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Mrs. Severina A. is presently engaged in bamboo buying in their barangay (village) of Bintana, Tangub City, Mis. Occ. She is 58 years old, married to Rogelio A. and blessed with 3 grown children. 

They previously earned their living from farming exclusively, and because of this they experienced hardships, especially in terms of financial matters. To help her husband, she decided to open up a little business, and for 10 years she was able to manage this business. 

Currently she is earning an average net income of 4,000 Philippine pesos from sales of the business.  She joined Paglaum MPC 4 years ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao (Paglaum MPC was awarded Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006). 

As an existing member in good standing, she was allowed to request a loan of 14,000 PHP to add her capital for her existing sari-sari (general) store. Her plan in life is to improve her business and to be able to support her family and her grand children.

loans.use: to buy bamboo

loans.name: Jun

texts.en:
Jun F. is from the village of Arwas Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old. Jun is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jun raises pigs for fattening and sale. Jun has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jun joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jun is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jun from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Шарифов Толибчон проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. Детей не имеет. Образование-среднее. Он три года как занимается торговлей. У него имеется собственный магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки растительного масла, новых видов конфет и молочных продуктов.
texts.en: S. Tolibjon lives in the Hamadoni region. He's thirty-five years old, married and has no children. He has a high school level of education and for the past three years has worked as a salesman in his own store, where he sells groceries. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase vegetable oil, some new types of candy and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil, candy and dairy products

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena B.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for breeding. She is 47 years old, married and has one grown-up child. She is from the village of Rang-Ayan. Elena has been in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Elena is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 12th loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma D. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 42 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Elma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Elma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Elma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Debbie's Group

texts.en:
Debbie B. is from the village of Caliguian. She is 53 years old and the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Debbie B.'s Group.

Debbie is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Debbie has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Debbie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Debbie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Debbie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Debbie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shohrat

texts.en:
Shohrat H. is 33 years old. He is married and his wife actively helps him to raise, breed and fatten sheep. Shohrat has three years of experience in sheep breeding and knows very well how to choose, breed and look after the animals.  As a rule, he purchases sheep in the  livestock bazaar, feeds them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

Shohrat gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills make his business successful and generate a stable and considerable income for his family. Shohrat is now planning to expand his herd and purchase sheep. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase 15 lambs.

loans.use: to purchase 15 lambs.

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
Zaman K. is 60, married and has two sons who are 1 and 3 years old. His family lives in Sabirabad city. Zaman sells household items and children's clothes in his shop. This business has become the only source of income for Zaman`s family. Zaman already has successfully paid his loan and now applied for new one.

Zaman has been in the trade for 12 years. His business is characterized by stability and positive performance. The inventory he sells is always in demand as people need dishwashers, laundry soap, towels, dishes, perfumes, and other household items and children need seasonal clothes. 
Zaman wants to see his business growing in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to increase his turnover capital.

loans.use: to purchase more houshold items to sell

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad M. is a young gentleman who has dedicated himself to the business of farming and raising livestock for the past three years. He is married and has two children. The necessity that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. His wife is helping Fuad as well. For this simple reason he is seeking a loan of 500 AZN to purchase one calf to sell. Fuad is grateful to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: to purchase one calf

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz N. is 45 years old. He is married and has four children. Mubariz sells cattle; he purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and than resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

After 9 years in this business, Mubariz knows very well how to choose, breed and look after the animals. He gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills make his business successful and generate a stable, considerable income for his large family. 

Mubariz is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase more cattle. He is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase young cattle and feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Mutalib

texts.en: Mutalib R.  is a young, tenacious farmer of 21. Mutalib usually buys small calves in the livestock bazaar, raises and fattens them, and sells them for profit. Mutalib is now applying for a 1,200 AZN loan to increase his herd and to improve his living standards. This loan will be used to buy three calves. Mutalib plans to get married next year and he hopes to save enough money to have a great wedding party.

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
Elbrus A. is a responsible father of  four children. From the time he was young, Elbrus learned the honorable work of raising livestock from his parents, work which today brings him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. Elbrus has six years of experience in sheep breeding. 

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Elbrus hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his livestock will bring better prices. For this reason, he is requesting the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep

loans.name: Elgun

texts.en:
Elgun O.  is a responsible young man. From the time he was a teenager, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock from his parents, a work which today brings him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. 

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals.  Elgun hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his livestock will bring better prices. For this reason, he is requesting the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase one calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle

loans.name: Sudaba

texts.en:
Sudaba A. is married and raising a son. She and her husband sell women's clothing and shoes in a rented shop in the central market. Sudaba has been in this business for 6 years and it is constantly growing. She usually brings new clothes to the Baku central market once a month.

Sudaba realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business, as loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and expand her business. She would like to make it easier for women to find comfortable and good quality clothing, which is why she is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN. Sudaba further plans to continue expanding her sales and eventually generate enough profit to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase new seasonal clothes

loans.name: Farrux

texts.en: Farrux V. is 48 years old and married with four children. He has a great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for 7 years with his wife. Farrux is requesting a loan of 600 AZN. He would like to expand his business by adding more cattle since he recently acquired orders from outside villages to supply milk. With the additional income, Farrux will be better able increase his monthly turnover.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en: Almaz M. is married with two children. She is an entrepreneur from the small village of Imishli. Almaz runs a business selling cometics and other household items in the central marketplace. Her enterprise is well-known for the flexible discount system she offers to her customers. Almaz has always wanted to be self-employed and decided 6 years ago to start her own business. Almaz wants to keep her enterprise running in order to provide for her family and support her elderly parents. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN and promises to repay the loan without any lapses.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin Q. is a a cattle farmer. He has earned a living from raising cattle since he was young. He buys small calves in the livestock bazaar, fattens and raises them, and then sells them at a profit. He has 6 years of experience in the business and knows his job very well. Elchin has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase two calves.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of items to sell

loans.name: Ditalala Plus Group

texts.en:
Ditalala Plus is a group of eight owners of small businesses chaired by Gyslain. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Gyslain is 27 years old and single. He started his business of running a telephone booth in 2006 with $120 as beginning capital. He worked very hard and his business prospered. Gyslain decided to join an MFI HOPE group in 2009 in order to, some day, achieve his dream of opening a large general shop in his area. Gyslain has already received four loans from HOPE DRC and repaid them properly. He is glad to join HOPE’s group because he hopes to enhance his business. With the next loan from HOPE, Gyslain is planning to purchase 50 packages of prepaid phone cards to resell. He intends to use the profits to increase his working capital. His business brings in about 50 USD per week and is located in the southwestern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To purchase 50 packages of prepaid phone cards to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Besetana Betty lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Betty has been a farmer for 3 years, working 7 days out of every week. Betty sells her products at the market both wholesale and retail. She has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of millet and mushroom mother spawn. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenge(s) for Betty include drought, which hits most parts of Uganda and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to start exporting mushrooms to neighboring countries. Betty lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of millet and mushroom mother spawn

loans.name: Mahabbat

texts.en:
Mahabbat H. is a married man who lives with his family in Bilasuvar. He is 32 years old and the father of two children 7 and 9.  Mahabbat makes a living breeding cattle and selling meat and dairy products in the Bilasuvar bazaar and his wife helps him in his business. Before he started his business in 2006, his family lacked the means to cover all their expenses. Since then the business has been the only source of income for the family. 

This is the first loan Mahabbat has received from Aqroinvest and KIVA. He used this loan of 1000 AZN to buy two cows and feed them. After repaying this loan, he plans to take out another loan to expand his business. Mahabbat thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en: Sadaf Ibarahimova is a 57-year-old woman living in Bilasuvar. She is married with three children. She and her husband breed cattle to earn a living. They began to raise livestock 15 years ago. This is Sadaf's first loan, and the extra income she expects to earn will be invested into the family's cattle-breeding business. She used this loan to buy two cows and feed for her animals. The support of this loan helps her to financially meet the needs of her family. The monthly income of the family has increased to 350 AZN. Sadaf and her husband plan to expand their dairy farming operation in the future.

loans.use: to buy two cows and feed for animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Erick Cristopher

texts.es: El Sr. Erick tiene 28 años de edad, el es padre de un niño de 4 años de edad, el vive en la casa de sus abuelos desde niño, casa ubicada en el distrito de La Tinguiña, casa de material noble de 2 pisos. El se dedica al servicio de tranporte urbano en el ambito de la ciudad, en vehiculo alquilado, el viene realizando esta actividad hace 3 años, como todo joven tienen muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder adquirir su propio vehiculo y asi obtener mayores ingresos. Erick invertira el dinero en la compra de utiles escolares como libros cuadernos, mochilas, uniformes entre otros ya que desea que su hijo se desarrolle profesionalemente.
texts.en:
Mr. Erick is 28 years old and is the father of a four year old boy. He lives in his grandparents’ two story house located in the District of La Tinguina. He has a rental car and for three years has provided transportation services in the city area.

Like most young people he has dreams and goals and one of them is to obtain his own car. He is requesting the loan for school supplies such as books, notebooks, backpacks, and uniforms, because he wants his son to develop professionally.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio de 31 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, está soltero y es empleado de una gasolinera, trabaja hace 2 años como despachador, cubre sus gastos y ayuda en el hogar con su salario.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para cubrir unos gastos personales, sobre una escritura, ya que no dispone de la cantidad que el notario cobra por realizar los trámites de traspaso a nombre de él.
Le ayudara esta inversión a tener más patrimonios e ir mejorando su condición, también tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Julio, 31, lives in San Miguel.  He’s single and employed at a gas station.  He’s worked there as a Gas Pump Attendant for two years.  He covers his expenses and helps at home with his salary.

He is asking for a loan to pay for some personal expenses related to a deed because he lacks the amount that the notary charges to process a change of ownership to him.

This investment will help him have more assets and improve his condition as well as to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to pay notary fees

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en: Yagub H. has been a hairdresser since 2001. He was born in 1971 in the Cabrayil region. He is an internal refugee from Nagorno Karabakh. Yagub fled to the Bilasuvar district of Azerbaijan in 1993. He is married and has two children. Both of them are adults. This is his first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan in the amount of 500 AZN to improve the fittings in his barber shop. He promises to make the payments on time, since he would like to have more loans in the future.

loans.use: to improve the fittings in his barber shop

loans.name: Jose Estanislao

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijas de 2 y 4 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, el aprendió este oficio por su padre, quien desde pequeño lo acompaño enseñándole todo el trabajo agrícola.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como abono, fertilizantes y preparar la tierra donde realizara la siembra.
Dicha inversión le servirá para tener todo lo necesario y dar el cuido debido al cultivo, con el que espera tener una buena producción.

Su objetivo es ir creciendo, aumentando su producción, comercializando las cosechas y ofreciendo una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José, 39, lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department, with his wife and two daughters who are 2 and 4 years of age; he’s a farmer and cattleman.  He learned this occupation from his father who took him along since he was a little boy teaching him everything about farming.

He is asking for a loan to buy some supplies like manure and fertilizer to prepare the soil for his next planting.  Said investment will make it possible for him to have everything he needs to provide proper care for his crops which he hopes will yield a good production.

His goal is to continue growing, increasing production and selling his crops to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.es:
María D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Elena departamento D. Usulután, se dedica un negocio D. productos D. consumo, el cual fue iniciativa propia, junto a  su esposo, no tienen un horario fijo para atender a los clientes y tienen experiencia en el negocio, ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos D. 13, 7, 5 y 4 años D. edad.

Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para abastecer el negocio, esto contribuirá a que brinD. una mejor atención y servicio a los clientes.

Su objetivo es continuar creciendo, trabajar fuerte por darles a sus hijos  un futuro diferente con una mejor calidad D. vida
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and lives in the Santa Elena division of Usulután.   She works together with her husband selling consumer products, which was her own initiative.  They have no fixed hours for serving their customers and they have business experience.  She lives with her ​​husband and their children, who are 13, 7, 5 and 4 years old.

María is currently seeking a loan to buy merchandise to supply the business.  This will help proviD. better care and service to her customers.  Her goal is to continue to grow the business, work hard and give their children a different future with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Cinthia Yovanna

texts.es:
Cinthia tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz  en Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.  Su comunidad es pequeña y fue formada hace casi 6 años. Actualmente cuenta con luz eléctrica, pero aún no tiene agua potable. 

Desde hace 2 años, brinda servicios de tipeos e impresos desde su domicilio. Cuenta con una base de clientes establecida y fiel. Adicionalmente, trabaja como secretaria para la Municipalidad de Cañaris. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de suministros de oficina para complementar su negocio de tipeos. También planea ofrecer en venta los útiles a sus clientes para generar otros ingresos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 soles.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 27 years old, single and does not have any children. She lives with her parents in the District of Jose Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque Region. Her community is small and was founded about six years ago. Presently it has electricity but not running water yet.

She offers typing and printing services at her house. She has a base of fixed and faithful customers and also works as a secretary in the Municipality of Canaris. The loan will be used to buy supplies for her typing business and to sell them to her customers to increase her income. This is the reason for her requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her typing business.

loans.name: Margarita Florizelda

texts.es: Margarita tiene 42 años de edad y es casada. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y salud. Dirige este negocio desde su domicilio. También brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Margarita es muy conocida en su comunidad y tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos personales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Margarita is 42 years old and married. She lives in her own house in the District of Olmos in the Province of Lambayeque, more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling beauty and health products from her house for more than three years. She also provides transportation services with her motor-taxi which is a motorbike with a cabin for the passengers.

She is well known in her community and her services are in high demand.  She wishes to utilize the loan to fix and maintain her motor-taxi. It is important for her to keep it in good condition to offer high quality service to her customers. This would increase her income to provide for her personal expenses.  This is the reason she is requesting a loan of 1.000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: to fix and maintain her motor-taxi.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es: Maximina tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo menor. Viven en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos de luz y agua. Su comunidad es pequeña con aproximadamente 100 familias. Se gana la vida desde hace tres años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando su ganado ya ha alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo lo ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado y desea hacer unos arreglos al techo. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar el material necesario para reparar y mantenerlo. Maximina es  honesta y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maximina is 48 years old, married and has a young child. She lives in her own house in the rural area of the district of Lambayeque. Presently, it does not have the basic services of electricity or running water. Her community is small with about 100 families.

Her income comes from breeding small animals in pens located in the back of her house. When the animals are ready, she sells them to customers who visit her area. She learned this trade from her parents which provided her with experience.

Presently her house is in poor condition and she wishes to fix the roof. She is requesting a loan of 1.000 Nuevos Soles to buy the materials necessary for the repairs. 

Maximina is a very honest person; one of her main goals is to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Don Concepción tiene 53 años de edad, reside en Cacaopera departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa doña María y cuatro hijos Deysi de 16 años, Marina de 15, Miguel de 10 y Vilma de 8 años de edad, todos dependen económicamente de él.
Don Concepción se dedica al cultivo de la caña de azúcar, ganado y cerdos, inicio hace 12 años a trabajar en sus propias parcelas en un horario de 6:00am a 4:00pm, su dificultad es el traslado de la producción para el mercado, ya que debe cargar el producto y cruzar un rio, para llegar al transporte. Él está solicitando un préstamo para el proceso de molienda, ya que este trabajo se hace con varios empleados, es un trabajo fuerte que requiere desvelos pues deben triturar toda la caña para transformarla en miel y dulce de panela.
Este dinero del préstamo le ayudara para pagar empleados y realizar el trabajo, incrementando la producción y continuando en el comercio de miel y dulce, aunque siempre tiene riesgos pues la zona donde vive muchos agricultores hacen esta misma actividad, lo que dificulta vender rápidamente los productos.
Él aspira el reconocimiento de nuevos mercados, trasladar su producción a otras zonas y crecer como microempresario.
texts.en:
Don Concepción is 53 years old, he lives in Cacaopera in the department of Morazán with his wife Doña María and four children, Deysi, 16 years old, Marina, 15 years old, Miguel is 10 and Vilma is 8 years old. They are all economically dependent on him. 

Don Concepción grows sugar cane and raises cows and pigs. He began working his own plots of land twelve years ago, working from 6:00am until 4:00pm. A difficulty is transporting the production to the market because he has to carry his products accross a river to get to transportation. He is seeking a loan to cover the cost of milling the sugar cane and the work requires the help of a number of employees. It is hard work that requires a lot of labor to crush the cane to produce honey and brown sugar. 

The loan will help him to pay employees to complete the work, to increase production and to continue selling honey and sugar. While there are always risks in the area where he lives because many farmers perform the same work, the challenge is to sell his products quickly. 

He hopes to get to know new markets and to bring his products to new areas and to grow as a microbusiness.

loans.use: To cover the cost of milling sugar cane.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad V. is an internal refugee from Nagorno Karabakh. Now he lives with his family in a small settlement built for refugee families in the Bilasuvar district. He is married and has two sons and one daughter. All of them are school age. 

Mahammad has been a cattle breeder since 2005. He buys animals at profitable prices and then raises and sells them in the livestock bazaar. He used this loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN to buy two cows and feed for them. He and his wife work hard to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two cows and feed

loans.name: Joel Alcides

texts.es:
Joel, es un joven de 23 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, vive con sus padres, es soltero y en su hogar todos trabajan ya que tienen un comedor, este negocio lo comenzó con el apoyo de su madre, quien ya posee experiencia, el horario de atención es de 6:00am a 8:00pm.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, materiales que necesita diariamente para preparar los alimentos, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar la producción del negocio y mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio, que sea rentable y le provea lo necesario para ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Joel, 23, lives in Santa Elena, Usulután Department, with his parents.  He’s single and in his home everyone works because they have an eatery.  The business started with help from his mother who has experience.  They are open from 6am until 8pm.

He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise that’s needed for daily meal preparation.  This purchase will help him increase business production and improve customer service.

His goal is to grow in the business, that it be profitable and provides everything needed for him to help out his parents.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the eatery

loans.name: Polad

texts.en: Polad I. is a 39-year-old man who lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, an area called Bilasuvar. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), who fled to Bilasuvar during the war in 1993. Polad is a diligent man and works very hard to cover all his family's needs. He has been raising animals for many years. He sells dairy products to the local bazaar traders and neighbours. Currently he has one calf and one milker cow. His poor financial situation has prevented him from buying a calf to expand his cattle-breeding business. Therefore, he has applied to Aqroinvest and Kiva for a loan. He used this loan to buy two more cows.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Santiago Antonio

texts.es:
Don Santiago, reside en Santa María departamento de Usulután, vive con esposa, un hermano, tiene 46 años de edad, se dedica a la administración de una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa y su hermano para atender a los clientes; este negocio inicio con la ayuda de su madre, el horario de venta es de 6:00am a 6:00pm, su dificultad es que por el momento no cuenta con suficiente mercadería para los clientes, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión.

Su propósito es adquirir de aquella mercadería que tiene mayor demanda, productos como: arroz, pastas, aceite, condimentos, frijoles y detergentes. Esto le ayudara al crecimiento y ha brindar una mejor atención y servicio a los clientes.

Las aspiraciones de Don Santiago es aumentar su clientela, que sus ventas sean mejores y vivir en adecuadamente  con su familia
texts.en:
Don Santiago lives in the Santa María division of Usulután department.  He lives with his wife and his brother, and is 46 years old.   He works managing a store that sells staples, and his wife and his brother help to serve customers.  The business was started with the help of his mother.  The store is open from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.

His difficulty at the moment is that he does not have enough merchandise for his customers, so he is applying for a loan for investment.  The purpose is to acquire goods that have the highest demand; products such as rice, pasta, oil, spices, beans and detergents. This will help the business grow and provide better care and service for his customers.

Don Santiago's aspirations are to increase his customer base so that his sales will grow and he can live well with his family.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, pasta, oil, spices, beans and detergents

loans.name: Oscar Rolando

texts.es:
Oscar, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre, él se dedica a la crianza de pollo y posee una tienda, este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su madre, ellos viven en casa propia, no tiene un horario fijo para atender las actividades y actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en alimentos para los pollos y mercadería para la tienda.
Este préstamo le ayudara a realizar la compra que necesita para fortalecer el negocio y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes. Su objetivo es mejorar el comercio, atender cada día mejor a los clientes y estar cómodos con su madre.
texts.en:
Oscar, 29, lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department.  He’s single and lives with his mother.  He raises chickens and has a grocery store.  He started the business with help from his mother.  They live in a house of their own.  He does not have a fixed work schedule and needs a loan to invest in chicken feed and in merchandise for the store.

This loan will help him buy what he needs to strengthen the business and meet customer demand.  His objective is to improve commerce, provide improved customer service every day and for him and his mother to live in comfort.

loans.use: to invest in chicken feed and in merchandise for his store

loans.name: Francisca Elizabeth

texts.es:
Francisca D. 36 años D. edad, resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y cuatro hijos D. los cuales solo dos dependen D. sus ingresos, viven en una vivienda alquilada. Francisca se dedica a la venta D. productos lácteos, comenzó este negocio con el apoyo D. unas amistades,  actualmente tiene experiencia y desea invertir en el negocio.

Para llevar a cabo esta inversión solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara leche y elotes, con esta compra crecerá en el negocio y podrá ir aumentando su producción e ingresos para el hogar.

Su objetivo es crecer, ampliar el negocio, comprar casa propia, por estas metas trabaja cada día dando lo mejor y poder lograr lo deseado.
texts.en:
Francisca, 36, lives in Concepción Batres, Usulután Department with her family which is composed of her husband and four children, only two of whom are still dependent on her.  They live in a rented house.  

Francisca sells dairy products, a business she started with help from some friends.  She now has experience and wants to invest in the business.

To carry out this investment, she’s asking for a loan to buy milk and corn on the cob.  With this purchase the business will grow and she will increase production and household income.

Her objective is to grow, to expand the business, to buy a house of her own.  She gives her best to her work every day towards these goals and to attain all her wishes.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Marco Fermin

texts.es:
Marco, es un joven de 24 años de edad, reside en  Santa María, departamento de Usulután, esta casado, vive junto a su esposa, su madre, aun no tienen hijos, en el hogar solamente él trabaja, posee un taller de enderezado y pintura, comenzó a trabajar como empleado en talleres, luego decidió instalar su propio taller el cual no tiene un horario especifico para atender.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar repuestos para el taller, esta compra es muy importe para realizar su trabajo diario, ya que de ellos depende la rapidez y calidad del servicio prestado a los clientes.

El objetivo de Marco es ampliar el taller, aumentar la clientela, y vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Marco, 24, lives in Santa María, Usulután Department.  He’s married and lives with his wife and his mother; they don’t have children yet.  He is the only one who works in his home.  He has a Body Shop.  He started out as an employee of shops but then decided to open up his own shop.  He does not have a fixed work schedule.

He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the shop.  This is a very important purchase for him in order to do his daily work because the speed and quality of service provided to customers depends on them.

Marco’s goal is to expand the shop, increase customers and to live in better conditions with his family.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge es una persona muy seria y respetuosa el cual esta casado con la Sra. Rosa Elena, desean el préstamo por que quiere poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa el cual  atendería  personalmente   su   esposa  ya  que  por  el momento ella  no  se  encuentra  trabajando este   proyecto  representa  una  manera  de  salir  adelante obteniendo  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge is a very serious and respectful man.  He is married to Rosa Elena, and they want a loan because they would like to put a grocery store in their home.  His wife will attend the store personally, since right now she doesn't have a job.  This project represents a way for them to get ahead and earn more money.

loans.use: to invest in a grocery store

loans.name: Maria Carmelina

texts.es:
María de 25 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, posee un negocio de productos de consumo, ella vive con su esposo y un hijo de 2 años de edad.
El negocio de María tiene 8 años de existir, aprendió gracias a sus padres, lo atiende desde muy temprano de 6:00am a 6:00pm, su ventaja es que está en su casa de habitación, esto le permite atender los oficios del hogar al mismo tiempo que la tienda.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos, ya que desea ofrecer a los clientes arroz, frijol y maíz, preparándose de esta manera para servirles mejor a los clientes.
Su objetivo es trabajar con la ayuda de financiamientos para poder desarrollar el negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 25 years old and lives in Corinto, in Morazán department, with her husband and her 2 year-old son.  She owns a business selling groceries. 

María's business has existed for 8 years.  She learned from her parents.  María serves in her store from very early in the morning.  She works from 6.00am to 6.00pm.  Her advantage is that her business is located in her home which means that she can attend to her housework at the same time as she works in her store.

María is requesting a loan to buy basic grains as she would like to offer her customers rice, beans and corn.  This will help her to better serve her customers.  María's goal is to work with loans to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic grains

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel, de 54 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa Sara  y tres hijos Josué de 7 años, Ana de 6 y Gamalie de 2 años de edad. Él se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, negocio que administra hace 10 años, surgió por la necesidad de poseer ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, el horario inicia desde 4:00am hasta las 2:00pm, trabajando únicamente dos días a la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos, ya que quiere aumentar la mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes más variedad, esta inversión mejorara su condición de comerciante, será más competente.
El objetivo de don Miguel es continuar trabajando fuerte para mantener a su familia y sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
Miguel is 54 years old and lives in Corinto, in Morazán department, together with his wife Sara and his three children: 7 year-old Josué, 6 year-old Ana and 2 year-old Gamalie.  Miguel's business is selling small electrical appliances.  He has been in this business for 10 years.  He started the business because he needed to make income in order to cover his family's needs.  He works from 4.00am to 2.00pm, two days a week.

Miguel is currently requesting a loan to buy electrical appliances as he would like to increase his merchandise so that he can offer his customers more variety.  This investment will improve his situation as a salesman and he will be more competitive.

Miguel's goal is to continue working hard in order to support his family and get them ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy small electrical appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Dulce Corazon Group

texts.es:
el grupo Dulce Corazon esta integrado por un hombre y dos mujeres los cuales tienen mucho tiempo de concerse, juntos trabajan para salir adelante con sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la sra. Gumercina Gonzáles Suárez tiene un molino para moler maiz, ofrece sus servicios de molida de maíz para nixtamal, tortillas, rosquillas y nacatamales, tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren por el trato y buen servicio que ofrece.
Con las ganancias que le genera su negocio le contribuye a su esposo con los gastos en el hogar.
Junto a su esposo han procreado una linda niña, la que han sabido criar y educar.        
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para darle mantenimiento al molino.

la sra. Maria Victorina B. se dedica al comercio, vende cosméticos, ropa nueva y usada y joyería de plata.
la mayor parte de sus productos los vende los días sábados y domingos, es cuando sale a cobrarle a los clientes que les da crédito y aprovecha a vender mas productos, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre con los gastos del hogar, Maria es madre soltera y tiene que trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para tener mayor inventario y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

el sr. Elvin Oswaldo A. L. se dedica a la compra venta de granos básicos, compra en cosecha cuando es mas barato y despues revende el producto, con las ganancias cubre los gastos del hogar, su esposa trabaja en una fabrica de tabacos lo que permite generar ingresos que contribuye a mejorar las condiciones de vida en el hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de granos básicos, ya que aun se compran a precio bajo en la zona y esto le permitira obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The group Dulce Corazon is made up of one man and two women who have known each other for a long time. They all work hard to support their families. The following paragraphs detail the different businesses activities of each member:

Gumercina Gonzáles Suárez owns a mill for grinding maize. The maize flour is used to make tortillas, rosquillas (ring-shaped pastries), and nacatamales (steamed meat and vegetable-filled tamales wrapped in maize or banana leaf). She has many loyal customers because of the good customer service she provides. With the profit earned from her business, Gumercina helps her husband pay for household expenses. The couple have a beautiful daughter together. This loan will be used to purchase spare parts to maintain the mill.

Maria Victorina B. is a small retailer, selling cosmetics, new and used clothing, and silver jewelry. She sells most of her products on Saturdays and Sundays, when she collects money from customers who have purchased items on credit. Maria takes advantage of the weekends to make additional sales. With her business income she pays for household expenses. Maria is a single mother and has to work very hard to take care of her family. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise so that she can stock a better selection and meet the demands of her customers.

Elvin Oswaldo A. L. buys and sells staple grains. He buys during the harvest when the price is low and later retails the grain at a higher price. With his business profit he pays for household expenses. His wife works in a cigarette factory, which allows her to earn enough money to improve the family's living conditions. The loan will be used to buy grains because the local price is currently very low and this will give Elvin a better profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for mill, clothing, cosmetics, silver jewelry, beans, maize, and rice.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña papelería. Para poder tener su papelería ella tuvo que esforzarse mucho y con ayuda de su padrastro con un capital que le prestó puedo surtir su negocio. 

En la actualidad vende papelería como cuadernos, hojas, plumas, carpetas etc. Trabaja sola desde muy temprano atendiendo a los clientes con una buena predisposición. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando. Quiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos, hojas, carpetas, plumas etc.
texts.en:
Lorena, 32 years old, is a hardworking woman who owns a small stationary store.  In order to get her store she had to work very hard, and she had help from her step-father in the form of capital that he loaned her so that she could stock the store.  

Currently she sells stationary items like notebooks, loose-leaf paper, pens, folders, etc.  Beginning very early in the morning she works alone, attending to the customers with a good disposition.  She has many aspirations for her business, and for this reason wants to keep working.  She wants the loan to buy notebooks, paper, folders, pens, etc.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, loose-leaf paper, and pens

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es: El solicitante de dedica a la actividad de venta de jugos extracto y otros eligio este negocio por que vio que era un trabajo fácil y como no tenia mucho capital y no tenia trabajo permanente es por ello que decidió iniciarse en esta actividad ya tiene diez años laborando en esta actividad, su sueño a futuro es construir su casa de material noble con todos sus acabados no tiene carga familiar sus hijos son mayores e independientes ,el préstamo que esta solicitando será invertido en comprar un motor para preparar los jugos , extractos y otros y también servirá para darle mantenimiento a su carro tienes buenas referencias laborales y personales , se propone crédito.
texts.en: The loan requester sells juice extracts and other things.  He chose this business because he saw that it was an easy job, and since he didn't have a lot of start-up capital and didn't have a permanent job, he decided to start doing this.  Now he's been doing it for 10 years.  His dream for the future is to construct his house out of worthy material and with all of the finishing touches.  He doesn't have any family to care for; his children are grown and independent.  The loan that he is asking for will be invested in buying a motor to prepare the juices, extracts and other things and will also help him to do maintenance on his car.  He has good work and personal references, and the loan is proposed.

loans.use: To buy a juice machine for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de una filmadora para trabajar en eventos

loans.name: Marieli Cumanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Marieli I. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su centro histórico, por sus 4 ríos que la bañan, su naturaleza, su gastronomía, su gente y sus tradiciones.

Doña Marieli tiene 35 años, está separada y ha concebido un hijo de 7 años de edad que estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de sombreros de paja toquilla, esta actividad la inicio hace un mes.  Nuestra socia es toda una profesional ya que estudio para  auxiliar de enfermería y administración de empresa, pero por el momento no está ejerciendo.

Se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su tía. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de sombreros para crecer en su negocio. Sus metas son estabilizarse económicamente, encontrar un trabajo para ejercer su profesión y comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sra. Marieli I. is a member of the Communal Bank “Damas Responsables” (Responsible Women). She lives in central Cuenca, a beautiful city that is known for its historical center, the four rivers that surround it, its natural surroundings, its cuisine, its people and their traditions.

Doña Marieli is 35 years old, separated from her spouse, and has a seven year old son who attends school in the city. She does not own a home and currently lives in a rental property.

Marieli buys and sells Panama hats, a business she started a month ago. She is a professional since she studied nursing and business administration, but at the moment she is not pursuing either career.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank after being invited to join by her aunt. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of hats to grow her business. Her goals are to become financially stable, find a job in her field of study, and purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase Panama hats.

loans.name: Leonila Gerardina

texts.es:
La Señora. Leonila U. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su centro histórico, por sus 4 ríos que la bañan, su naturaleza, su gastronomía, su gente y sus tradiciones.

La Señora Leonila tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene una hija que ya  es casada. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de su hija con quien comparte los gastos, viven arrendando.

Nuestra amiga se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla, esta actividad la desempeña hace 2 años, este oficio lo aprendió desde muy niña ya que sus padres trabajaban en esta actividad.

Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por su cuñada, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de paja toquilla para la elaboración de sus sombreros. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonila U. is a member of the Communal Bank “Damas Responsables” (Responsible Women). She lives in central Cuenca, a beautiful city that is known for its historical center, the four rivers that surround it, its natural surroundings, its cuisine, its people and their traditions.

Sra. Leonila is 56 years old, married, and has a daughter who is already married. She does not own a home, so she lives with her daughter and helps with the expenses. They live in a rental property.

Leonila sells Panama hats and has been in this business for two years. She learned this trade as a young girl since her parents worked in the same type of business.

This is the first loan she is receiving from the Communal Bank after being invited to join by her sister-in-law. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of palm fibers used for making Panama hats. Her dream is have a house of her own.

loans.use: To purchase palm fibers used for making hats.

loans.name: Maura Gudelia

texts.es:
La Señora. Maura O. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive por el sector de Induarma en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su centro histórico, por sus 4 ríos que la bañan, su naturaleza, su gastronomía, su gente y sus tradiciones.

Doña Maura tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 17 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad y su segundo hijo en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en una unidad de taxi que es de su propiedad.
 
Nuestra socia es empleada privada, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, en sus momentos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon y ropa por catalogo, esta actividad la desempeña hace 5 años.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y ropa para incrementar su negocio. Su meta es que su negocio crezca mucho mas.
texts.en:
Sra. Maura O. is a member of the Communal Bank “Damas Responsables” (Responsible Women). She lives in the Induarma District of Cuenca, a beautiful city that is known for its historical center, the four rivers that surround it, its natural surroundings, its cuisine, its people and their traditions.

Doña Maura is 37 years old, married, and has two children (ages 18 and 17). Her first child, a daughter, is studying at the university while her son attends high school in the city. Maura’s husband is a driver by profession and has his own taxi.

She is a private employee and works Monday through Friday from 9am to 6pm. During her free time, she sells Avon products and clothes through a catalog. Maura has been in this business for five years.

She joined the Communal Bank seven years ago. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics and clothing so that she can expand her business. Maura’s goal is to grow her business even more.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothing to sell.

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señorita. María M. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, vive en la comunidad de Chican en el cantón Paute, este cantón es de clima templado propicio para la siembra de flores, es conocido por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

María tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.

Ella  labora hace cuatro meses como empleada domestica en una casa de la ciudad de Cuenca, trabaja puertas adentro  de lunes a sábado al medio día, los días sábados viaja a Chican  en donde cría cuyes, chanchos y borregos.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años, su crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de una chanchera y en la compra de mas chanchos. Su sueño es viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Srta. María M. is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Solidarias” (Supportive Women). She lives in the community of Chican in Paute Canton. This canton has a temperate climate that is suitable for growing flowers. In addition, Paute is known for its beautiful landscapes. The people engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture.

María is 30 years old, single, and has no children. For the past four months, she has worked as a housekeeper at a home in the city of Cuenca. She works behind closed doors Monday through Saturday until noon. On Saturdays, she travels to Chican where she raises guinea pigs, pigs, and sheep.

María has been a member of the Communal Bank for three years. Her loan will be invested in the construction of a pig pen and the purchase of more pigs. She dreams of traveling to the United States.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and acquire materials to build a pig pen.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
La Señorita Carmen M. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca pero es oriunda de la comunidad de Chican en el cantón Paute, este cantón es de clima templado propicio para la siembra de flores, es conocido por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Carmen tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive independiente, trabaja como empleada domestica hace 5 meses, labora de lunes a viernes todo el día y los días sábados estudia en un colegio de la ciudad.

Se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá quien es una socia activa, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  pollos para criar en su casa. Su meta es culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Srta. Carmen M. is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Solidarias” (Supportive Women). She lives in the city of Cuenca, but she is originally from the community of Chican in Paute Canton. This canton has a temperate climate that is suitable for growing flowers. In addition, Paute is known for its beautiful landscapes. The people engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture.

Carmen is 18 years old, single, and lives independently. She has worked as a domestic employee for the past five months. Carmen works all day Monday through Friday. On Saturdays she studies at a college in the city.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank after she was invited to join by her mother, who is an active member. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens to raise at home. Her goal is to finish her studies.

loans.use: To purchase chickens.

loans.name: Mujeres Capaces 3 Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Capaces III se conformó en el año 2009, y siguen adelante con mucho esfuerzo ya que la mayoría de las integrantes tiene un ingreso reducido.
Las señoras son de la ciudad de Encarnación, distante a 40 km. de la oficina de la fundación. Ellas destinan su dinero para diversas actividades en la zona en donde viven, relacionadas a la venta  de frutas, verduras y comestibles.
La Sra. Cecilia R. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, y como se aproxima la época de otoño desea ampliar la variedad de sus frutas, comprando las cítricas, pero para ello necesita de un crédito de modo que pueda obtener un mayor ingreso con el aumento del margen de ganancias.
Las mujeres están agradecidas por el acceso al crédito, ya que es el único lugar donde pueden obtener capital de trabajo, teniendo en cuenta su nivel de ingreso.
Renuevan por 6ta vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el buen pago en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee “Mujeres Capaces III” (Capable Women III) was established in 2009. The group continues to move forward with great effort even though most of its members have limited incomes. These ladies are from the city of Encarnación, which is 40km away from the office of Fundación Paraguaya. They will use this money for their various business activities that are conducted in the area where they live. These businesses involve the sale of fruits, vegetables, and groceries.

Sra. Cecilia R. sells fruits and vegetables. As the autumn season approaches, she wants to expand the variety of fruits that she offers by acquiring citrus fruits. However, she needs a loan so that she can generate more income and increase her profit margin.

The women are grateful for having access to this loan since it is the only way they can obtain operating capital to help them raise their income level. They are receiving their sixth loan and entering this loan cycle with a good payment history.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and citrus fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some cosmetic things for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new carpet-weaving frame

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a young man from Hebron. Ibrahim lives with his parents and three brothers and has a workshop where the four brothers work. Ibrahim and his brothers produce items out of craved and shaped stone such as ashtrays, plates, statues, etc.  Ibrahim and his brothers started this profession four years ago. Ibrahim took a loan from FATEN to purchase a large amount of stones to be used for this purpose in order to increase his products and income.

Ibrahim is photographed in FATEN's Hebron branch.

loans.use: to purchase stones to use in engraving and producing statues

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase things currently not available in his general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a variety of items that she needs for her embroidery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase essential items to offer for sale in his general store and to build up his business

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a 43-year-old businessman. He is married and has six children. Saidu has been selling assorted items in a shop for the past 11 years. His shop is located in the busy city market in Kenema.

Saidu established this business so that he could generate enough income to provide a livelihood for his family. He is very determined to see that this business continues to grow. Saidu opens his business by 7 a.m. and closes by 11 p.m.

Saidu has a good loan-repayment history. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leone leones to help him buy cartons of milk, some bags of sugar, pure water, toothpaste, etc.

He intends to use the proceeds of this loan to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of milk, some bags of sugar, pure water, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson F. M. tiene 37 años y está casado con la Sra. Rosana Cabrera de 34 años, tienen 3 hijos, un varón de 16 años y dos niñas de 7 y 3 años respectivamente.
El Sr. Nelson se dedica a la fabricación de joyas de plata desde hace 16 años. El negocio funciona en su domicilio y las joyas que fabrica son anillos, aros, pulseras, cadenas y diges. Sus principales clientes son las joyerías y los revendedores.
El mismo desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de plata en forma mayorista, de esa manera obtendría mayor descuento por la misma y el costo de las joyas sería menor por lo que tendría mayor ganancia por la venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
Sr. Nelson F. M. is 37 years old and married to Sra. Rosa Cabrera, age 34. They have three children, a 16 year old son and two daughters (ages 7 and 3 respectively).

Sr. Nelson has been making silver jewelry for 16 years. He operates his business out of his home. The jewelry he produces includes rings, earrings, bracelets, chains, and pendants. His main customers are jewelry shops and retail stores.

Nelson wants to invest this loan in the purchase of silver in bulk so that he can get a larger discount. This will lower the cost of producing his jewelry pieces, thereby allowing him to earn more profit when he sells them.

loans.use: To purchase silver for making jewelry.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
La sra. Ermelinda, cliente  joven y emprendedora, cuenta con 27 años, está comprometida hace 10 años con el sr. Edgar Rodriguez, quien trabaja como chofer en una empresa comercial, ellos tienen 2 hijos de 10  y 8 años respectivamente y ambos van  a la escuela.
La titular tiene su negocio desde hace 4 años, y anteriormente sólo se dedicaba a ser ama de casa, y su esposo era el que trabajaba, pero con el tiempo decidió abrir una despensa aprovechando que en su barrio no había muchos lugares para comprar comestibles ni productos de primera necesidad, y fue así que empezó vendiendo primero artículos de primera necesidad, y más adelante tener un surtido de mercaderías hasta venta de carnes y bebidas.
El crédito que solicita es para invertir en la compra de más variedad de productos (yerba a granel, arroz, carnes, productos enlatados, etc.).
texts.en:
Sra. Ermelinda is an enterprising young client. She is 27 years old and has been in a ten-year committed relationship with Sr. Edgar Rodriguez, who works as a driver for a commercial business. They have two children, ages 10 and 8 respectively. Both of them attend school.

Ermelinda has owned her business for four years. She previously devoted herself as a full-time homemaker while her husband was working, but she decided to open a food pantry to take advantage of the fact that there were no other places in her neighborhood to buy groceries or basic necessities. Ermelinda started out selling essential items and later increased her assortment of merchandise to include meat and beverages.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of a variety of products (herbs in bulk, rice, meat, canned goods, and other items).

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as herbs in bulk, rice, meat, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with a grown son named Andriy. She is an entrepreneur from Uzhgorod. Nataliya sells men’s and women’s clothing merchandise in a local market in her home town. She owns one vending location and solid clientele. She has been in the trade for 12 years. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to diversify her merchandise, to add to her stock and meet the growing demand for clothing in the market. Her outstanding credit history and willingness to strive for higher goals will help her repay the current loan and reach success in her business.

loans.use: to add more stock to her store

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with twins. He lives in a small agricultural town of Vodyanoye. Alexander grows vegetables. He owns six big greenhouses and two separate ones for seedlings. He has invested about 70,000 Grivnyas in this business. Alexander has been in farming business for six years. 

Alexander is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase plastic film. He is planning to re-cover his six greenhouses before the upcoming spring farming season to plant early tomatoes and protect them from freezing temperatures. In general, Alexander is hoping to use 5,000 Grivnyas out of the whole amount to purchase the film, 6,000 Grivnyas to purchase fertilizers, 3,000 Grivnyas to purchase coal and the rest for miscellaneous expenses related to greenhouse business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film for his greenhouses

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El sr. Rodolfo Z. es separado, posee un local comercial de ventas de Quinielas y otros juegos de azar del Nuevo Circuito comercial, cuenta con 2 años de antigüedad en el  rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.
Está solicitando de nuestra asistencia mediante el crédito, que quisiera destinarlo a la compra de una máquina para cargar los números de quinielas para las jugadas.
texts.en:
Sr. Rodolfo Z. is separated. He has a commercial shop where he sells betting sheets and other games of chance offered by the Nuevo Circuito Company. Rodolfo has two years of experience, which allows him to attract good customers and generate income.

He is seeking assistance through this loan. Rodolfo wants to purchase a machine that dispenses betting sheets for various games.

loans.use: To purchase a machine that dispenses betting sheets for various games.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with two daughters. He is a farmer from Kamenka. Vladimir grows early spring vegetables in his greenhouses. Vladimir owns three spacious greenhouses and another one for seedlings. Vladimir has been growing vegetables in these greenhouses for 8 years. He has already invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in this enterprise. 

Vladimir is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase plastic film, seeds and fertilizers for his greenhouses. He is planning to invest 5,000 Grivnyas in fertilizers, 4,600 in polyethylene film, 1,600 Grivnyas in installation of a heating unit, 1,700 Grivnyas in installation of a drip irrigation unit, and 2,000 Grivnyas in sand and organic matter. Some of Vladimir’s plans are to re-construct one of his greenhouses that needs to be improved and expanded and to install heating units in all three greenhouses (so far he has one boiler for all of his greenhouses).

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Kuña Guapa se conformó en el año 2007, y han crecido mucho como comité por las situaciones vividas. Todas las integrantes son muy trabajadoras y responsables con sus cuotas.
Las señoras son de la ciudad de Encarnacion, distante a 15 km. de la oficina de la fundación. Ellas destinan su dinero para diversas actividades en la zona en donde viven.
Actualmente, 7 señoras son las más antiguas del grupo, y otras integrantes han ido rotando por diferentes razones, pero siempre encontraron mujeres responsables para reemplazar a las salientes.
Las mujeres están contentas porque siempre avanzan de nivel y monto económico al cual acceden pues así pueden aumentar sus mercaderías y tener más ingresos.
Solicitan por décima primera vez el crédito, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas.
La sra. Zulma S. posee una despensa en su domicilio, desde donde provee de todos los productos de primera necesidad a sus vecinos, ella desea poder aumentar sus ingresos económicos pero la única manera de realizar esa meta es aumentando la cantidad de productos ofrecidos, y también aumentar la calidad de estos, por ello solicita el crédito, para poder comprar artículos de limpieza, aseo personal, de librería, entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee “Kuña Guapa” was established in 2007. The members have grown tremendously as a committee through the situations they have experienced. All of the members are hardworking and responsible with their payments. These women are from the city of Encarnación, which is 15km from the office of Fundación Paraguaya. They will use this money for their various business activities that are conducted in the area where they live.

There are currently seven women who are long-time members of the group. Other members have rotated in and out for different reasons, but responsible women are always found to replace the ones who have left. The members are pleased because they have always been able to raise their financial standard of living, increase their inventories, and generate more income. They are requesting their eleventh loan and entering this next loan cycle with an excellent payment history.

Sra. Zulma S. has a store in her home where she offers all types of basic necessities to her neighbors. She wants to increase her income, but the only way for her to do this is to offer more products that are of higher quality. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy cleaning products, toiletries, office supplies, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning products, toiletries, office supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two daughters 10 and 12 years old. She and her family live in Ivano-Frankivsk. Olga sells fruits and vegetables in the Central grocery market. She offers different fruit for sale, i.e. bananas, lemons, oranges, tangerines, apples and pears, etc., as well as potatoes, carrots, beets, onions, garlic, etc. Olga rents a vending facility in the marketplace. She has a hired employee working there with her. 

Olga launched this market venture 11 years ago. Presently, she has about 6,000 Grivnyas of monthly profit. Olga is planning to use the loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase a variety of assorted fruit and citrus for her vending kiosk. Olga is very scrupulous. All of her clients speak very highly of her and give her credit for her hard work and quality customer service.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruit and citrus

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El Sr. Gregorio C. de 33 años, está en pareja con la Sra. Maria Fernandez de 35 años de edad, ellos aun no tienen la dicha de tener hijos.
Don Gregorio se dedica a este rubro hace más de 2 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.008; para juntar un capital ellos tuvieron que vender una moto, dicho dinero sirvió para comprar equipos y herramientas para  gomería, que en la actualidad ya es bastante conocida en la zona, ya que el en barrio hay muy pocos que se dedican a dicho rubro.
El utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías (cámaras, cubiertas, rayitos, etc.)
texts.en:
Mr. Gregorio C. is 33 years old, and his partner Mrs. Maria Fernandez is 35.  They have not yet been lucky enough to have children. 

Gregorio has been doing his work for more than two years, since about 2008.  To get enough capital together, they had to sell a motorcycle.  That money helped to buy equipment and tools for the tire repair shop, which currently is well known in the zone, since the neighborhood doesn't have a lot of people who do that kind of work.  

He will use the loan to buy more merchandise (tubes, tires, spokes, etc)

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (tubes, tires, spokes, etc)

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité fue formado gracias al interés y entusiasmo de la señora Esthela G., junto con María Iluminada Rodas del km 13 ½  Acaray Minga Guazú de Ciudad del Este, ex integrante del grupo. Ellas contactaron con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina Virgen de Fatima, están en el Sexto Ciclo, cuenta con 17 integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes realizan reuniones quincenales y organizan diversas actividades. Poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la Fundación. Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus actividades.
La sra. Roque Teresa, integrante del comité, se dedica a la venta de ropas, tiene muy buena clientela desde hace varios años, pero ella desea poder contar con mayor variedad de ropas para ofrecer a sus clientes, como se acerca la época de otoño desea adquirir abrigos pues la competencia es mucha y no quiere perder a sus clientes.
Ella espera contar con la ayuda crediticia de Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
This group was established through the interest and enthusiasm of Mrs. Maria Iluminada Rodas from 13 ½ Km in Acaray, Minga Guazu, 'Ciudad del Este' [City of East], who is no longer a member. She established communication with neighbors and friends to form the group in the area.

The group is called ‘Virgen of Fatima’, has seventeen members, and is in its sixth loan cycle. It is a cohesive, caring and responsible group.  Its members have biweekly meetings and organize diverse activities. Their enterprising spirit keeps them working and responsibly paying back the loan with the Foundation. The loan will open doors to continue progressing.

Mrs. Roque Teresa has been selling clothing for several years. She wishes to have more variety to offer to her customers and since fall is approaching she wants to buy new coats to better compete with other similar stores and keep her customers. She hopes to obtain assistance from KIVA and Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy coats

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is divorced with two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine, and she sells retail household items in a busy place in the local market that attracts many potential customers. Tetyana has been in this trade for nine years and presently has 40,000 Grivnyas invested in her inventories. Her monthly net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas.

Tetyana is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase various small home products.
