Operating her business with integrity and skill, she is looked up to by others as an entrepreneur of authority and intelligence. Additional merchandise, combined with Tetyana’s work ethic and experience, will enable her to expand her business, increase her income and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase various small home products

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila sells women’s clothing at the central market in Nova Kahovka town. She has been in this business for five years. She’s got 7,000 hryvnias invested in inventory. Her monthly income is about 7,000 hryvnias. Ludmila enjoys her business very much and would like to develop it further. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 Ukrainian hryvnia to purchase inventory for the spring and summer seasons. She hopes to make additional income and invest most of it back into the business. Ludmila is married with two grown-up sons.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the spring and summer seasons.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with two children. She sells women's underwear and tights at the local market in Beregovo. Larisa started her business two years ago. She's got a great location that attracts many clients. Larisa has a hardworking and determined personality. Her goal is to make this business a success and a stable source of income for her family.

Larisa would like to borrow 15,000 hryvnia to increase her assortment of merchandise. She hopes to receive additional income and invest most of it back into the business.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of merchandise.

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is married with a 17-year-old son. She has owned a retail business selling men's clothing for 3 years. She runs this business with her husband, Mykola,  and their monthly income is 6,000 UAH.

Olesya used to work as a salesperson in a similar business at the same market. After she got enough experience, she decided to start her own business. Today she has 2 business locations at the market. Olesya's dream is to move to a small store to do retail business. Olesya would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase 100 pairs of jeans.

loans.use: to purchase 100 pairs of jeans

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia C. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Remegia is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Remegia runs a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Remegia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Remegia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remegia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase addtional goods and soft drinks. This will be Remegia's fourth loan from GDMPC. Remegia has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods and soft drinks

Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Cecilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the borrower's business.

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es:
La Señora. María T. es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad de las Minas que pertenece a la parroquia de Nulti, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisaje, su gente se dedica a la artesanía, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades.

Doña María tiene 20 años, tiene una relación de unión libre y aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo labora operando maquinaria pesada, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus padres compartiendo gastos.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y va a iniciarse en el negocio de cría de pollos.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, alimento y otros artículos para iniciar su negocio. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria T. is a member of the communal bank named Vegaspamba. She lives in the community of Las Minas, belonging to the district of Nulti. This district has many beautiful sceneries and its population is made up of artisans, farmers, and agriculturists. Many work in the city of Cuenca in different occupations.

Maria is 20 years old and she is married common-law and she still doesn't have any children. Her husband works as a heavy machinery operator. They don't have a house of their own so they live in her parents' house and they share the expenses. 

She is a housewife but she will start a poultry business.

She is on her third loan through the communal bank, to which she was invited to join by her sister. She will invest the funds from her loan to purchase poultry, feed, and all that she needs to start the business. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, feed, and all that she needs to start a business

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa D. es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad de Rayo Loma en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta hermosa ciudad esta  bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico fué nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con  una variada gastronomía y su gente es amable y cordial.

Nuestra socia  tiene 62 años, es casada y tiene un hijo que ya está casado y vive  independiente. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción ya que es albañil.
 
Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar  y aprovecha su tiempo para criar  chanchos, cuyes y gallinas a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

Este es el octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas. Su meta es incrementar más animales para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa D. is member of the communal bank Vegaspamba. She lives in the Roya Loma community located in the city of Cuenca. This beautiful city is surrounded by 4 rivers, had it's historic town centre named as cultural heritage of humanity, depends on a varied cuisine, and has it's people known to be friendly and cordial.

Our member is 62 years old, married, and has a son who is married and lives independently. Her husband is a construction worker; he is a bricklayer.

Mrs. Rosa does housework and takes the opportunity to raise pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens which she sells when she needs money.

This is the eighth loan she has had with the communal bank and she will use it to buy guinea pigs and chickens. Her goal is to acquire more animals to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ronalet

texts.en: Ronalet is a 27-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating an electronic re-loading of phone cards business. She lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. Ronalet joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ronalet has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 24,500 to purchase more electronic loads to sell so that she can continue to save up for future house improvement. Ronalet is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more electronic loads (phone use cards) to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is a 28-year-old single who supports her family by operating a general store business. She lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. Analyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Analyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to pay for the purchase of additional stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future house improvements and business. Analyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store and a farming business. She lives in San Carlos, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and farming business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,500. 

Edna is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can buy stocks to sell in her general store. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Edna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is a married woman who lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a tricycle transportation business. Her husband Eusebio, who is 46 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 5 and 21 years old. Estela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Estela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 to pay for more maintenance on her motorcycle so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Estela is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Neang

T. sells groceries, earning $6 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $100 US on food and $40 US on other expenses. T. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her fifth loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store.

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a farming business. She lives in the island of Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,700.

Ana, Aloran, Mis. Occ. Emelia has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Emelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emelia L.'s group is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and bread for sale. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. Emelia is the leader of a 3 member group accessing a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana, a 40-year-old lady, is married to Martinus, 52 years old, who is working as a public transport driver. They are blessed with 6 children:
-	Maria, 21 years old who is in the sixth semester of a local university
-	Ryanto, 19 years - graduated from junior high school
-	Arie, 17 years old - graduated from senior high school
-	Fendy, 11 years old who is in the fifth grade of elementary school
-	Veronika, 8 years old who is in the second grade of elementary school
-	Deny, 5 years old, not at school yet
Adriana and family live in Oebufu Village – Kupang District.

To support her husband in generating money for their family, Adriana is running a piglet breeding business. She said that she has to help her husband in making money for her family as Martinus’ income is not sufficient to meet all of their needs. Even so, Adriana knows that Martinus has done his best for his family. 
 
Adriana initiated the business with 2 piglets to fatten, but she really wants to improve her business by having more piglets to fatten. She is requesting a loan of 10,000,000 IDR. She wants to spend the loan to purchase piglets and fodder. She hopes TLM will assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and fodder

Eva is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. Her picture was taken in her banana plantation.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan famous for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family. She is a working woman who shares the financial burden with her family by selling clothes. She started this business 5 years ago. She receives orders from her clients and fulfills them by purchasing clothes from Lahore city. She travels to Lahore once a month for this purpose. Najma is married to M. S., who works in a government school for a low income. She has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son has a private job. The second one has a construction supplies business, while her younger children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her clothes selling business. She will use the loan money to buy clothes in bulk quantity which will help her offer more variety of clothes to her clients and make more profits. Bulk purchasing will also cut her costs of transportation. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her forth loan application. She has proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time in previous loan years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Najma.

texts.en:
Jose D. is from the town of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. He is 45 years old. Jose is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Jose raises crops, primarily rice, for sale. Jose has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Jose is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Jose from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Bushra is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has four children and all of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She is married to A. A., who sells crockery. He operates his business on a four-wheeled cart and sells by visiting different places of the city. 

Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her husband's business. Through the loan, he will buy crockery of plastic and glass in bulk quantity to sell to more customers and to earn better. Bushra is hopeful that an investment will help him run his business better and increase his profits. He has been running this business for the past five years and Bushra has a lot of confidence in him.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. She is a very responsible loan user and has maintained a good credit record by paying her installments on time.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bushra.

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 33. Thi Tran. Thieu Hoa (12.13.33).

Loan is married and has two adult children. To making a living, Loan operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily cattle, for sale. Loan has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 2011, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Loan is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Loan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:
1. Ngo Thi Tu (11) is a 45 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
2. Nguyen Thi Thuy (13) is a 42 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
3. Nguyen Thi Ly (12) is a 40 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Loan N. thị (7) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở  Thị Trấn Thiệu Hóa, Thanh Hóa.  Loan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 33. Thị Trấn Thiệu Hóa, Thanh Hóa (12.13.33).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Loan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Loan kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2011, Loan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Loan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman who lives in Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a barbecue stand and carenderia/eatery. Her husband Gideon, who is 59 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 31 and 38 years old. 

Evelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase meat, chicken, pork and other ingredients so that she can continue to save up for future expenses and household consumption. Evelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, pork and other ingredients for her barbeque stand

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en:
Ms. Chanthoeurn N. (pictured above), 24, is single. She lives with her sister, brother and parents on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthoeurn is a weaver. She is applying for her first loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Juicy

texts.en: Juicy is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari store, fish vending and food vending businesses. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store, fish vending and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Juicy is borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Juicy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: 34. Thi Tran. Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hong L. Thi T. (8) is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Thi Tran Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa. Hong is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 34. Thi Tran. Thieu Hoa (12.13.34).

Hong is married and has one school-aged child. 

To making a living, Hong operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily cattle, for sale. Hong has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 2011, Hong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Hong is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Phung Thi Ngan (10) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. Nguyen Thi Nghia (9) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is a 51-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a general store and an electronic reloading business.  She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and electronic reloading businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. 

Ma. Isabel is borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell in her general store. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Isabel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: purchase more stocks to sell in the general store

loans.name: Thlang

texts.en:
Thlang N. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. N. produces traditional scarves, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 40 on other necessary expenses. 

N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for one of their kids to commute to work in the city. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for one of her kids to commute to the city
